<Author>CPhelan
<Content>Terrible Service and unnecessarily hot rooms My husband and I spent a week on holiday in New York recently and while we enjoyed everything about our Trip we were very dissapointed with the Belvedere. On check-in we were offered a double room with two double beds an extermely small bathroom and a functional kitchenette. We were initially happy with the hotel in general and its location close everything. As our flight was quite late arriving into JFK ~8.00PM and we were quite tired we called reception and enquired as to the possibility of getting a snack or room service. The response was a very short grunt like no and then a swift hang up. OK we thought there was no need for that but - give the place a chance. Later in the week when we enquired regarding day trips and theatre tickets we were left standing at the desk for at least 15 minutes while two members of staff continued their chat - aware of our presence I might add. The heating in the room was also a major problem which made sleeping at night extremely uncomfortable to the point that we had to continously turn on the air conditioning as an open window wasn't sufficient to cool the room eventhough there was snow outside!The final straw for us was on our final day we had requested a late checkout (at the time of check in, we had reconfirmed this mid week at which time we were told there would be no problem just to call reception on the morning we were checking out) and on the morning we rang reception at 6.30AM to reitterate our request and were swiftly told that there was no possibility we would not be getting a late check out. We found the staff 's attitude nothing short of rude and not reflective of the service we have recieved in other hotels in the past. I would say location is the only positive this hotel has going for it. We will most certainly be making a return to New York in the future but I am dissapointed to say the Belvedere will not feature in our accomodation plans.

<Author>miamichele
<Content>Refreshing Hotel And Staff This hotel is 2 blocks from Broadway and within walking distance from shows , shopping, metro, and just a slew of restaurants . The best way I can put it is, you can be in the mix in a few short steps, but it's nice to be out of the mix in a few short steps also. It's New York, the city that never sleeps, but I do. I was glad to be out of the mix and the horns when it was time for bed.My husband got me tickets to see the Lion King for Christmas, the rest was up to me. I began my quest a few days after New Years. I began researching hotels throughout the city and quickly found very high priced rooms that wanted to put my 11 year old daughter on a sleeper sofa instead of a bed. After reading many reviews , I decided on the Belvedere Hotel.As with most of our vacations , I get a little nervous as the time gets close and wonder if my choices were the best. I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the hotel. Our baggage was quickly taken from the cab and the bellman directed us to the front desk. We arrived at 10 am and check in isn't until 4. While registering in I was informed that they would hold our luggage until check in and would contact me via cell phone when our room was ready.Important? Maybe not to some but friends who had stayed at other hotels were charged for this service and for us it was free. Also after checking out , we were able to leave our bags there and catch the cab from the hotel much later that day. BATHROOMS Well , for me , it's the most important thing. A nasty bathroom is just as bad as a nasty bed. This bathroom was great. Clean, Bright, Roomy, and oh did I mention CLEAN. AAAA+++I found the rooms to be not so small. I've stayed at larger rooms, but for New York, I thought they really weren't so bad. From reading other reviews from other hotels I would say they were probably much larger than most. That is if you compare apples to apples. The bathroom is my issue, the air and heat are my husbands. He likes it about the temperature of ohhh a morgue. I on the other hand enjoy it cool rather than freezing. Its funny because we both said that was the first time the temp. was just perfect to sleep for both of us.We didn't take advantage of the free breakfast but we did however eat at the Churrascaria Plataforma Restaurant. Outstanding. Yes it is pricey but it is so worth it. They are just so nice and so friendly and the food is just sooo good. Oh how we laughed when we forgot to turn our discs over and the food just kept coming and coming.. Nice job . Fantastic food and service. Well Belvedere, thank you for making our first trip to the big city a memorable one. It's nice to know that there is a place not so far away that we can go and still feel at home.Looking forward to our next trip with you.We have traveled a lot over the years and I have never really written a review. I guess I felt the need after this trip because it was New York and I wasn't really sure what to expect. I felt very safe and was really very pleasantly surprised at how nice everyone was . I don't just mean at the hotel . I mean, the city.

<Author>sparky39
<Content>Would go back to the Belvedere Just back from a five night stay in the Belvedere. There were three of us in a delux double double on the twelfth floor and we had plenty of room. Our flight was delayed and it was after midnight when we arrived. As we had not contacted the hotel during the day we were a little worried that our room would be gone or that we would be given a smaller one but we were given exactly what we had booked. Check in was very quick and we were told there was some construction work on the 15th floor between 9.30 and 4pm but we never heard a sound - we were hardly ever in at that time anyway.The room was a very decent size - all our luggage fitted in the wardrobe space. Yes the bathroom is small but perfectly adequate and the kitchen area was a bonus. Having read a review here we brought plastic plates and cutlery - very handy as there are some nice delis and cake shops in the vicinity. Mugs, glasses and a coffemaker, fridge and microwave are provided. There is also a programmable safe. The staff are very helpful. The location is excellent - short walking distance to Times Square, theatres, restaurants, bus station, subway.We never ate at the hotel so I can't comment on the food. The Brazillian restaurant cannot be entered through the hotel - you need to go around the corner. We looked in and it was packed and very lively looking.There is a business centre with internet access ($2 for 8 mins - 25cents a minute thereafter) and phones. I would recommend the Belvedere Hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again.

<Author>RLTS
<Content>Great Location!!! My husband and I stayed at the Belvedere in mid March for 6 nights. This was our first trip to NYC, and we will definately be back!The Bevedere was a pleasant part of our stay. While we typically stay in slightly nicer hotels, this property was recommended to us as being reasonably priced, and with a great location. We were not disapointed. The positives:- amazing location. Within walking distance of several subway lines, times square, a plethora of restaurants, and most Broadway theaters.- Clean, well kept rooms. Ours was right next to the elevators, and we were initially quite concerned. I think this resulted in a slightly smaller room, but it was functional, and surprisingly quiet.- an included buffet breakfast (book through the hotel website, and it is one of their 'deals'). Although not exactly gourmet, and they didn't change a single item in a week, the food was fine, quick, and a convenient way to start the day.- kitchenette in all rooms. Handy if you have leftovers etc. or would like to keep drinks in the room.The negatives:- the room temperature seems to be an issue in this hotel. It is an older property, and has correspondingly older HVAC. Our room was pretty warm, but tolerable if we left the window open an inch or two.- the elevators are terribly slow. We were on the 16th floor, and you really had to allow 'elevator time' in anywhere you were going. A little secret...there are elevators at the opposite ends of the hallways that can be a bit more responsive, and have fewer stops along the way. They do, however, take them out of commission occasionally.- make sure you bring some physical documentation of your reservation. There was a problem with our room rate when we first checked in. To their credit, the front desk staff were polite and dealt with it relatively quickly. I had confirmation numbers, screen prints, and was able to pull up their confirmation email on my black berry. If not though, we may have ended up paying a higher rate.Overall, I was happy with the Belvedere. I consider it good value, and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

The Subway is also very close by, but the taxis are quite cheap, so you are never stuck.All in all, a very pleasant experience at The Belvedere. When returning to New York, i will definately stay there again and would not hesitate to recommend this Hotel to anyone.

<Author>epowers1127
<Content>Bring paper proof of your reservation and any cancellations..... I had planned a trip for my family to visit NYC, and the hotels we have stayed at in the past were booked. I came across the Belvedere, and the reviews and website made it look rather nice. We really did not need anything fancy because of the small amount of time we would be spending in the room. Here are the positives and negatives of the Belvedere:Positives:*clean, large (by NYC standards) rooms*bellmen were EXTREMELY friendly and accomodating*you can store your luggage if your room is not ready for no extra charge, and they will also store it for you after check-out if needed*excellent location for Broadway and Times Square....easy 5 minute, safe walkNegatives: (Main reason I rated the Belvedere so low)*beds are extremely uncomfortable *I made 3 reservations for the Belvedere. We only ended up needing 1 room, so I cancelled the other two. I cancelled on their website, and they gave me a cancellation number. The cancellation number was the same as the reservation number, so I just recorded the numbers on the page I had printed for our correct reservation confirmation, and thought we would be fine. When we arrived at the hotel, the VERY rude front desk clerk told us we had 2 rooms reserved. My husband and I argued with her for about 10 min. and in the end she told us that unless we had physical proof of the cancellation, we would have to pay for both rooms. I had received emails confirming my cancellations, so we had to pay to use their computers to prove that we had cancelled BOTH reservations. We brought the physical, paper proof of the emails showing the cancellations to her, and received NO apology! Unfortunately, the rudeness of the front desk clerk will keep us from ever coming back to the Belvedere. My warning for anyone else giving the Belvedere a try, make sure you bring physical proof of any reservations or cancellations with you.

<Author>jbthbt
<Content>The most dissapointing Hotel Experience I've ever had MY wife and I recently spent a night in The Belvedere Hotel in New York city and I must say, I expected so much more from a $300 hotel stay. I have had better accommodation in much cheaper hotels. The quality of craftsmanship in the actual construction was very disappointing, not the mention the fact that there was more of that poor quality craftsmanship going on in the room directly above us. The construction was so loud we had to scream in order to hear one another. The power kept going out in our room also. Whether a result of the construction above or the use of a hair dryer I don't know, but very inconvenient nonetheless. It seemed like so many of the basic necessities were afterthoughts, such as the light switch for the bathroom, which was found outside and behind the door. The microwave and refrigerator were hidden behind the entrance door and sacrificed functionality. I'm not completely sure where they got the king size bed, but it felt as if it were nothing more than a piece of plywood with an foam egg crate mattress topper. The air conditioning unit was another afterthought, as it was a window unit rather than a built in, which is something I generally associate with much cheaper hotels. For some reason our $199 room ended up with a $306 charge on our credit card, which is confusing considering we ordered no movies, etc. The Belvedere Hotel all but ruined our NYC experience and I know that the city must have much better hotels to offer

<Author>mdw
<Content>Great Location, Very Friendly staff, Ask for a low floor We stayed at the hotel from the 3rd February to the 9th February. The hotel was a very good and comfortable. I would stay here again. Check the hotel website for specials that include breakfast because its too expensive to pay $17+tax for it. However we got a rate of $199per night including breakfast.We stay on the 17th floor for the first night and the room was freezing cold. (Granted it was one of the coldest fews in New York for a long time) There was no heat in the rads at all. The next day I informed the desk and they gave us a choice of 3 rooms none had heat working but beacuse they were on lower floors they were a lot warmer. The staff did everything they could for us. Thank you all very much. Stay on high floors during warm weather!!! Stay on low floors during cold weather.Location was brill!! Only a few blocks from everything, Port Auth Bus(For Woodbury Common and Jersey Gardens), Subway, Shops, Time Square, Bars and Cafes.Shopping I would recommend Jersey Gardens $9.50 return compared to $35+ for Woodbury Common both from the port auth a couple of blocks down, Plus its indoor for the cold winter days.Eat in Buppa Gumps for a great view of Time Square. <Author>Corazon5
<Content>Excellent hotel I spent a week in this hotel from 7th - 14th February 2007.The hotel location is perfect for anyone who wants to visit Manhatten. The hotel is just 2 minutes walk from Times Square and just around the corner from the Gray Line Tourist Centre. The hotel is surrounded by shops, restaurants, bars, etc and everything you need can be found practically outside the hotel door.The hotel staff are very professional offering an excellent service. The staff are polite and friendly. The hotel also offers a facility where you can book tours, theatre tickets, excursions etc directly from the hotel. The reception area is very big, spacious, very clean, modern and very beautiful. The hotel rooms are very big ( we had a king size room but the price of a king size room in the belvedere was the same as an ordinary room in any other hotel ). The rooms are very well equipped with everything you need. The housekeeping was excellent. Every night I came back to a perfectly clean and tidied room.The service offered by the hotel is very efficient and fast. We had a problem with our hairdryer and our safety deposit box and within 2 minutes of my phonecall to the reception, someone had come to the room and everything was repaired immediately. Apart from those 2 minor details, we had no problems at all.The rooms are old style rather than very modern but all the furniture is in perfect condition. The bed is of excellent quality.If I was going back to New York, I would definately stay here again.

<Author>SunsetCoaster
<Content>We'll be back First time in NYC, but not the last. Fell in love with the city and its people. Glad to see the stereotype of rude New Yorkers is just a stereotype. We found everyone, everywhere, to be friendly and helpful. And felt safer than in our own small hometown.As for The Belvedere, when we return to NYC, we'll be staying at the Belvedere unless it's booked up. Enjoyed our stay there - 4 nights in early January. Location was great, front office staff were great, price was great. Room was perfect for what we were expecting at that price. We can't afford Trump or the Hilton, so our expectations are based on that. And actually, The Belvedere exceeded those expectations. We were expecting smaller and drearier since NYC is supposed to be so expensive. But we found excellent value. We had a room facing the back, which was very quiet, although the hotel is on a not-so-busy street. They were doing some construction up the road though, which might have proved noisy for those in the front.The Olympic Diner around the corner is a great little diner for good value simple breakfasts. Fast service, lovely staff. We also liked the Sombrero Mexican Restaurant down the block. Times Square and the Theatre District are a few minutes walk away, as are subway stations. The location was so handy.Two thumbs up from us. We'll be back.

<Author>estragon
<Content>A very good tourist hotel This is a great tourist hotel -- reasonably priced, centrally located, with decent sized rooms and comfortable beds. It's an older property, with a finicky heating system and somewhat shabby furniture, but in my room at least, the money had been spent on the most important elements: the bed and the spotless (though small) bathroom.Check-in was very smooth, and both my colleague and I were allowed to check in early. My room was cold, but the hotel promptly sent someone to fiddle with the windows and the valve on the radiator, and eventually supplied a space heater. My colleague had to wait an hour and a half to get his TV fixed... but then, who comes to New York to watch TV in their hotel room? Overall, in my experience, service at the Belvedere was excellent.And now, some quibbles:It would be nice to have an armchair or at least a second chair in the room. And the heating system definitely needs work.The breakfast? Forget it! $17 for an American breakfast and $12 for an extremely mediocre continental is a joke, even at New York prices. Have breakfast at one of the many places in the neighbourhood (but avoid the overpriced Pigalle at the corner of 8th, where we had one of the worst breakfasts of all time).Internet service at the hotel is a joke. The Belvedere is definitely not a good business hotel. There is a 24-hour business centre, which consists of a few pay-as-you-go internet terminals at 25 cents a minute, some of which don't work (according to some other guests). Wireless access in the rooms is $10 a day. I needed to send a file to a client on my last day, so I agreed to pay the ten bucks. The connection was extremely poor and conked out for good after five minutes. I am amazed at how many large hotels overcharge for substandard internet access. If you charge for it, it had better be bulletproof.Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Belvedere again when on vacation or on a work trip that doesn't require a lot of time spent at the hotel. But the poor internet service and lack of other business amenities really makes this a place to sleep, not work.  
<Date>Jan 25, 2007
<Rating>4	5	3	5	4	5	5	1	

<Author>oghowie
<Content>It used to be better This is the 3rd time we have stayed at the Belvedere in NYC since we do 2 trade shows a year in New York. We used to love it, but it's just not up to our standards anymore. Our previous stays were pretty good but we had numerous problems this time. First, we reserved a Queen bed over 2 months in advance and weren't able to get it, so we took 2 doubles for our 4 night stay.The room we got was also in need of repair. The bathtub drain was disgusting and the metal covering had been removed for some reason. The bathroom sink was also leaking water onto the floor so we had to place a towel there so that the whole bathroom floor wouldn't be wet.It also got chilly during our stay and we found out that the room didn't have its own heater, only an ac. Room service had to bring up a portable heater for us to use during our stay.Another thing that bothered me was that the bell boys had frowns on their faces the whole time and just looked like they didn't want to be there.Overall, the hotel has a good location (close to Times Square) and decent prices, but is in desperate need of a makeover. For our next trade show, we'll definitely be looking to stay in another hotel.

<Rating>3	3	2	4	2	4	3	3	

<Author>krisq78
<Content>Very satisfied My wife and I visited the Belvedere Hotel for 4 nights starting on January 18th and were pleased with the accomodations. We arrived to the hotel at around 1:00 PM and I was a little worried that we would not be able to check in so early, but it was not a problem at all and was never even brought up. We booked our room at Hotels.com and paid about $200 a night after taxes. Hotels.com assigned us to a room with 2 double beds, but the hotel was happy to honor my request to be upgraded to a room with 1 king bed. Also, the upgraded room also brought us up to the top floor of the hotel (17th floor) with a very nice view of the city.I did a ton of research before booking a hotel in New York City and I believe it paid off with finding this hotel. The hotel was not perfect but the rooms were good size, we had a fridge and microwave, the view was great, the room was clean, and the location was awesome! As mentioned by most reviews on this hotel it is only about a 5 minute walk to Times Square. The hotel seemed to be in a very safe neighborhood.The only negative comments I have about this hotel are the staff was not very friendly, and the doorman/bellboy was pretty much non existant as we had to carry our own bags to and from the room. Please do not read too much into this however as even though the staff was not overly friendly, it does not mean they were unpleasant. I am from Wisconsin where people tend to be genuinely nice, especially when dealing with the service industry.A few side notes:A cab ride from JFK airport to the Belvedere Hotel is $49 and covers your fare, plus tolls. With a decent tip plan on paying $60 each way from the aiport.Use the subways. At only $2 a person each way it is very economical and we never felt unsafe. There is a subway station down on 50th St (The E Train) which is only a block away that will take you all the way down to the financial district (the World Trade Center Terminal).Skip the big restaurants and eat at all of the corner store deli's and pizza places. If you want to go to a Broadway show find the TKTS ticket booth to purchase tickets the day of the performance. This ticket booth sells all of the different theatres surplus tickets on the day of the performance. We purchased 2 tickets to Rent, orchestra level seats, for only $51 each. These were half priced tickets. The TKTS booth is under construction in Times Square, you can't miss the building, although small, but the temporary location is right near by in front of the Marriot Hotel.  
<Date>Jan 24, 2007

<Author>Han_chan
<Content>A real gem Ok, so reading endless reviews might get tiring, but you should honestly believe how great this hotel is. So we took the plunge and booked it.... It was definately the right choice to make, a great location a few steets from Times Square, Subway stations a few blocks away, great friendly service and fantastic sized rooms. I had read about many other hotels having tiny rooms that was typical of NYC, but don't compromise, go here, the rooms are a great size with a small kitchenette incase you want to bring some food to your room. Great! Very clean (remember to tip your cleaner every day about $5, it's standard practise). The hotel doesn't have a restaurant, but who'd want one with so many choices outside your door. You're right by 'Restaurant Row', and for a great Big Apple experience go to the Olympic Diner on 8th Ave round the corner for breakfast. It's cheap, cheerful and has all the American-style breakfasts you could want. -Another tip, we booked this hotel through purelyamerica.com and we got a great deal that meant the usual price of a room was cheaper by about 拢200 for the week!

<Author>meche
<Content>Belvedere is really good! I just got back from a very cold weekend getaway with two of my friends in New York City. Neither had been there before so we wanted to do the tourist type thing. I got a great deal at Expedia and used Trip Adviser to narrow my choices of where I would stay while there- the Belvedere was in the top 20 and for good reason. The location is nothing short of fabulous- 2 blocks from Times Square but quiet at night. The room had two double beds (that's a BIG room by New York standards if you're not in a typical chain hotel.) The bathroom is on the smaller side but this is an older hotel in NYC. The room was clean, had pleasing colors, and had plenty of drawer and closet space. It has an in-room safe that works quite well. The staff was friendly and very helpful- my only mild disappointment was that the doormen seemed to be on mental break at times and while I have no problem opening a door, one of the travellers in my group is quite elderly and has terminal cancer- she really needed prompter assistance on occasion. They serve breakfast but have no full service restaurant nor is room service available but there was a mini-frddge (empty), microwave, and coffee maker in the room. The concierge desk was helpful and had lots of suggestions. What I really loved was the fact that the wait for a cab was never more than 3 minutes and there is this incredible candle/Lamp Berge/incense store just past the hotel towards Time Square that is a lot of fun to wander in and Mohamed (the owner) is a really great guy!

<Author>twklelylstar
<Content>Spendid stay After reading some of the negative reviews posted on this site, I was very skeptical about the hotel and our stay there. After our stay, I realized I should continue to stick to my motto of experiencing things for myself and not pay too close attention to other people's opinions. The hotel and room were very nicely decorated and the staff was both patient and helpful. Being new to the area, we had lots of questions - all of which were answered with geniune patience and kindness. When we needed to hail a taxi to leave for the airport at 5:00 AM, the receptionist had anticipated our needs before we finished the paperwork and had contacted the bellman. The bellman and taxi driver were already outside to assist us when we walked out of the hotel. Yes, the elevator and bathroom were small, but as I found out with several public restrooms, all the restrooms were small in NY. As for the elevator, we never had to wait too long and when one was full, the other was already on its way down/up to us. All in all, I would definitely consider this hotel again for our next trip to NY.

<Author>pennysandnickles
<Content>Great value, No better Location!! Got a great deal for New York, the rooms were great, the mini kitchen came in so handy and saved us the trouble of getting up with the kids early, they got there own breakfast and watched cartoons and we got to have our coffee and get ready for the day on our own time. The staff was great, helpful and polite, very professional. The 24 hour laundry mat in the basement was a great perk, don't have to over pack or go back home with dirty clothes. It was very clean, not noisy at all, great bathroom, really deep old fashion bathtubs. There is a mini kitchen, the hallway and a bathroom before you hit the bed area, so there was no noise from the corridors, we got a room on the 14th floor so there was no street noise. It was a fantastic stay, we were there for 6 days, 5 nights. The corner stores with the full hot/cold buffets were awesome, something for everyone, we ate there 3 nights, it was cheap and good. There also is a 24 hour full grocery store near by, with a hot cold buffet on the main floor and the grocery store below called the Emporium I think that was great and reasonably priced. Great hotel for families, cable tv was included and you get lots of chanels with 24 hour kid programs for free. Only 2 blocks from Times Square, 3 for Broadway and 5 from 5th avenue shopping. Take the hop on/off tour it's worth it to get your bearings then take the local bus, or walk, it's just as fast there's so much traffic. The bus only takes change, no paper money, just to let you know.

<Content>A great place to stay We stayed in the Belvedere for 3 nights in mid December whilst experiencing the famous NYC Christmas ambience.The hotel had come recommended by our booking agent and we were given an excellent rate, so we were full of high expectation upon our arrival - it did not disappoint.It provided the perfect start to our trip, and having experienced a wonderful 3 nights there, it's now on our list for future visits.The Belvedere is very well situated, just a couple of blocks from theatreland and Times Square. <Author>nickBed4d
<Content>excellent in all respects We just spent 3 nights at the Belvedere, covering the New Year holiday. <Author>scooplady
<Content>It was everything we expected and more. Once we had decided to visit New York it didn't take very long to realize that decent sized rooms were as rare as nice inexpensive rooms. After quite a bit of searching, we found that The Belvedere was very likely one of the best values for money spent in New York, normal sized room (large by New York standards) King size bed, complimented by a microwave, a refrigerator and an in room safe. Enhanced by a building that has been recently remodeled and a mid-block location on a quiet street. Reviews of the hotel seemed to indicate good experiences by all who stayed there although many people thought their elevators were too slow. This hotel was everything we thought it would be and more, we stayed on the 17th floor and couldn't see why anyone would complain about the elevators. The only time they were slow was when they were stopping at many floors each morning, a pretty normal thing given that all hotels are busy every morning. The planning has already started for our next visit to New York and there is no question that The Belvedere would be our choice again!

<Author>vjohnson
<Content>NYC Great Location The Belvedere was not the hotel I chose for this NYC visit, however, it made a nice change of pace. The hotel originally chosen on Priceline was demolished to build condo's. The original location chosen was near Carnegie hall, not Times Square. All that said I have to say that our stay at the Belvedere was quite nice. The staff were wonderfully pleasant, it turns out that a continental breakfast was included, the rooms were immaculate and believe it or not, I did not find the elevator's that terribly slow most of the time. We arrived at the Belvedere at around 1:30PM, knowing that check in time was 4:00. We were pleasantly surprised as just as we were checking our luggage, the front desk stopped us and said that the room we were booked for was ready, would we like to proceed up. The location was excellent for theatre and restaurant choices, within walking distance of shopping, had easy access to liquor stores, a grocery and deli. This was a convient choice as they had a microwave and small refrigerator in the room. The rooms are fine for two persons, however, would be cramped with four. As noted by others, the bathrooms are small, but have great water pressure and lots of really hot water.The only criticisim of the Belvedere is that it is a little noisy being so close to Times Square (and we were on the 14th floor). This entire hotel is non-smoking which is wonderful!! As a suggestion, all NYC establishments should turn off the heat when it is 60-70 degrees, even though it is December.I would certainly recommend the hotel for a weekend stay in NYC.  
<Date>Dec 26, 2006
<Rating>4	4	3	4	4	5	4	-1	

<Author>Bahston
<Content>GooD Value, Great Local After studying the reviews for the Belvedere Hotel on this website I booked a 3 night stay over Christmas weekend. I requested a quiet, renovated room. We checked into a room on the 7th floor and I was told all the rooms had been renovated. The furniture in the room was quite banged up, although clean. Because of this website I knew that the rooms on the upper flors were nicer and I requested a different room. It was no problem and we were moved to a room on the 14th floor, which was much nicer. Although it faced the street it was very quiet too.Our rate included breakfast which was extensive and not bad. However, if it wasn't included I would definitly find something more interesting elswhere.The best thing about this hotel is the location. We easily walked everywhere and always felt safe. It's right between the crazyness of Times Square and the old Hell's Kitchen neighbohood (nice, reasonable restaurants)I really can't complain about this hotel (excetpt the beds were a bit soft), the location and staff are great. I wouldn't hesistate to stay here again, but only on a high floor.

<Author>DenJ33
<Content>Good location - no problems Stayed for 7 nights from 19th Nov - pretty much as advertised.If like us you like to do a show (or 5) and eat late this is a perfect location as main resturants (Resturant row / Hells Kitchen) are on your route back from Broadway. Mostly an easy walk (10min max) even in the rain. NB for a 24hr city most places still shut around 11pm... 12 at weekends.... and all day on Thanksgiving!If your room is near the service lift shaft it can be noisy during the day but no problem during hours that are important. Our room was good size with microwave and full size fridge so you can DIY breakfast although eating (Breakfast is good value - try 'Village' south on 8th) in NY is a major part of the fun. Keep an eye on the 20% automatically added service charge? and still space for the tip on the bill! in most resturants.Our room kept very clean and all staff were great... helpful efficient and friendly.Slightly negative points to bear in mind...Lifts are slow and very busy at peak times (8:30 - 9:30?)and NY is a very noisy city so a high room is good on both counts (at least you get in the lift - even if it does stop a lot).Good hotel, great location... not cheap and there are alternatives but it's location could save you any extra you pay?Have fun - NY is a magic city.

<Author>kazoolene
<Content>Watch out for the concierge! After researching many hotels, my boyfriend and I were excited to stay at the Belvedere, with a decent price and great location. When we got there, everything was what we expected and saw on the website, and we were very satisfied - UNTIL THERE WAS A PROBLEM. After being slightly annoyed with the concierge getting reservations right next to our show, which was actually 14 blocks in the opposite direction, the only other question we needed to ask was airport transportation to Newark. She gave us our options which were: $65 cab (price sonded too high) or $24 each 2-hour shuttle bus (2 hours didnt sound right). Using many other concierges in the past and trusting their knowledge of a city we were unfamiliar with, we asked if there were any other options, and she said no - so we booked the shuttle. We later found out from a person we met that there was an $8 each 25-minute shuttle from Port Authority. When we asked the concierge lady about this, she said that she was not authorized to give that information because she is not familiar/affiiliated with that organization. We explained the lack of logic in paying $24 for a 2-hour shuttle versus $8 for a 25-min shuttle, and while she agreed, she said there was nothing she could do for us.We then explained the problem to the front desk, and they said the concierge is not affiliated with the hotel, something which I have never heard of before. We told them we enjoyed our stay but were very frustrated with the problem. We asked if there was anything they could do for us, and she said no. WE WOULD HAVE BEEN CONTENT WITH ANY TYPE OF COMP, EVEN A FREE BREAKFAST! The manager was rude, and I was very disappointed in their lack of respect toward their customer (and possible future business).So this is a good hotel in this price range, and I would recommend the hotel itself, but WATCH OUT if you have any problems, as the main desk is not inclined to fix problems, and do not trust the concierge to give you unbiased recommendations of the city, as they are affiliated with certain restaurants  businesses.  
<Date>Nov 28, 2006

<Author>DougieMac
<Content>Good Solid Hotel What a lot of nonsense people talk.My wife daughter and I stayed at this hotel 17th - 24 November. This was our first trip to NYC but not to the USA. It was a treat for our daughters 21st.The hotel staff were polite and helpfull. The porter had our bags up in the room within ten minutes. What do you want from a room when you are a tourist. You want it clean  tidy safe, functional. It was all of that. Yes the room was hot but we hit upon a magic idea of opening the window - even in November it was quite pleasantHere are the facts.Room 1420 facing 48th street2 double beds with clean fresh linen and bedspreads. The beds were soft and comfortable.The room was not huge but it slept the three of us and had plenty of storage space for our clothes. The room was equipped with ironing board and safe free of charge.The bathroom had a toilet. tub/shower and wash hand basin - what more do you want. It wasnt big enough for a foam party but it easily met our requirements to use all the facilities comfortably. It again was clean and the towels changed every day. Small point on the towels if you are over a 36 inch wats then the towels ar small, however a quick call to houskeeping had an additional batch at my door in under 15 minutes.The kitchen had a microwave, fridge, coffe making facilities, and a sink. I wasnt cooking thanksgiving diner but as a tourist eating in all the fantastic restaurants and diners it easily satisifed our requirements.Yes there is a fire station at the end of the block but it is no noisier than all the other noises in New York.The street felt safe and was definitely well located for all the attarctions and shopping.Would I recommend it YES I wouldAll in all what I am syaying this was a good hotel, some people just seem to gripe for the pickiest of things. Ok so the Internet access was a bit dodgy but so aree internet cafes. I can olny assume that if the wrong attitude and approach was made to the staff you would get the same back.If you want top class service with people fawning all over you and you want to live in your room then go somewhere else and pay over the oddsMy reasons for not giving it 5 stars was beacuse the towels wer too small and the heat in the roomI am a genuine tourist and it you wish to e-mail me then do so travelandtunes@aol.com

<Author>DGunner
<Content>A Good Bargain, friendly, roomy and clean Bottom line - a good hotel at a good price.Pros - Very Clean, very friendly and helpful staff, above average size room, convenient to all of Times Square, Restaurant Row, Hell's Kitchen eateries, and anything else in mid-town, great bargain ($174 at Hotel site) for what you get.Cons - Noisy from outside (try to get higher level room - we were on 5th floor facing street), tiny bathroom (usually not a problem, but you could not sit straight without knees hitting wall), hot room with no thermostat, beds hard as a rock, elevators small (VERY small) and slow.Would I stay again? <Author>pellapopper
<Content>Fantastic stay at The Belvedere - NYC We booked our stay at The Belvedere in New York City through Skoosh.com. It turned out to be a great deal for the location and amenities. Paid $260 for 1 night.If you don't need a resort hotel and just a clean, nice place to stay this is it. 2 blocks from Times Square and a few more to Rockefeller Plaza. The location is great. Just out of the wildness of Times Square and in a decent neighborhood. We felt safe the whole time we were there and around the surrounding area.The room was clean and nice. Perhaps a bit small, but for New York, it was great. TV, Microwave, small Fridge, bathroom with tub/shower, A/C unit. We were on the top floor and had a nice view of the city.We came early to the hotel just to drop off our luggage and they had a room ready for us (10:30am). We were VERY impressed. It was nice to be able to ditch our stuff and freshen up a bit before hitting the town.There is a gym on the second floor, as well as an ice machine. There are elevators in the center of the hotel and well as at the ends of the hall. The middle ones tend to be slow in the morning because so many people are using them.There is a restaurant in house, but we chose to eat elsewhere because it was expensive. The olympic diner (around the corner to the left) was a great breakfast place. Costs about $6-$10 each. We ordered and had the food on our table in 3 minutes.The Italian restaurant (turn left on the corner with the flowers and go a block or two) was very tasty. Caffe Cielo? Or something like that. Cost us about $60 for an appetizer, 2 sodas, 2 dinners, and a dessert to share. Pretty good dinner deal really. We loved the food. They've been there for 20 years, so they've stood the test of time.The Belvedere is a great place to stay. The location is fantastic and safe. The subway is just around the corner a block away. We had a great time and I would definitely go back there if given the chance!

<Author>MMMH
<Content>What a perfect hotel I stayed with a friend in the Belvedere Hotel for six nights from Oct.29th to Nov.4th. We had the most fantastic holiday and our hotel really contributed to this. It has the very best location on a nice quiet but safe street. We never felt threatened in any way walking home at night.The staff were most helpful, especially the consierge. We ate breakfast in the hotel every morning which offered 2 menus, the continental for $12 and the full american for $16. The restaurant was spotlessly clean with lots of staff on hand. The rooms were really big, in our twin room we had 2 nice double beds. We also had a kitchenette complete with kettle, microwave, fridge and coffee maker!! There is a safe in each of the spotless rooms.There is a little supermarket a couple of doors up which was handy too. There isn't a bar in the hotel which is a pity as it would have been nice at night to have a few drinks in situ however this is the only negative thing we could say and it's not that important. Another really big plus is that the office for the Grey Line bus company is just around the corner so any time we were doing a tour we hadn't far to go. I could not recommend this hotel highly enough. It is perfect for anyone who wants to really see New York. Perhaps if you wanted late night parties and drinking it might be a bit too tame but for the tourist who is interested in sightseeing, shopping and going to the theatre it's the perfect base. I wouldn't stay anywhere else!

<Author>dlcroswell
<Content>Wonderful Stay This was a wonderful hotel in a perfect location! It was my first trip to NYC and I will always return to the Belvedere for future trips. The NY1 package that includes the buffet breakfast was nice, however, breakfast can be found less expensive on the corner at the Pigalle Brasserie. There is also a store/deli right on the corner where you can get beverages to put in the fridge in your room. I stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. Twice during my stay the room key had to be reactivated. The staff said ths was due to the key being near a debit/credit card, etc in my purse. Finally I started using the envelope for the key  it didn't happen again. The main elevator is in the lobby  does take a few minutes if the hotel is full. Plus it is very small. Maybe 3 people with luggage can fit at one time. I had read on here previously about the two side elevators  boy was I glad! Never a wait at those! It is the best kept secret at this hotel. The location of the Belvedere is fanastic. You are literally within walking distance of everything - Times Square, Broadway plays, Grand Central, Rockefeller Plaza, NBC Studios,etc. The subway was exciting. We took it to Chinatown for shopping and eating at Wo Hop, great food! We also took the subway to Little Italy for eating at Angelo's  cocktails at Nino's. Highly recommend these food places. The tour bus with the seats on top was awesome. We bought the two day pass for $45 dollars  it was worth every penny. You can get on  off wherever you want and since they are constantly running it isn't difficult to find one when you are ready to go to another place. The tour guides are also very infomative. I can't wait to return!

The room was spacious and clean. It looked like it had been recently remodeled. The room was quiet. I was on the 11th floor and there was no street noise. My only complaint would be the slow elevators. This was the only inconvenience during my stay. The location is outstanding. I went to three musicals during my stay and I was within 15 minutes walking time of all the theaters. The staff was friendly and offered suggestions. <Author>BonVoyage100
<Content>Would stay there again, however ... We are always looking for good, reasonably-priced hotels in the general area of Times Square. We spotted the Belvedere in one of our visits, so we stayed there on this trip. The location is good - 2 blocks from Times Square. Unlike many comparably-priced hotels we've stayed at in the area, our room was quite large and very up-to-date; the bathroom was small, but seemed to be recently renovated. There was even a mini kitchenette area with refrigerator and coffee maker. The front desk folks were extremely nice. We were also concerned about having to wait a long time for elevators, as we had seen this mentioned in other reviews - but there were 4 elevators and we had no problems in this area. So we generally loved the accommodations -- with 2 exceptions:#1 - the most significant was that the room smelled of smoke; it was supposed to be a non-smoking room and was so designated outside the door; but the room not only smelled of smoke, there was also an ashtray in the room! Since the bedding also smelled of smoke we asked for a change of linen; the new bedding was delivered to the room, but then the maid made up the beds without using the new linen. Had we been staying more than 2 nights we probably would have requested a different room.#2 - this item is less significant, but is a safety issue. The floor of the hallway entering the room, in front of the bathroom, and in the bathroom was nicely tiled, but the tile was extremely slippery - it had been polished so well. We had to put objects on the floor in this area to remind ourselves to step very carefully - and even then slipped a couple of times - even with sneakers on.We felt we would try this hotel again, but if we had a similar experience with smoke smell we would then cross it off our list.

<Author>SandraJohnstone
<Content>Classy hotel at an affordable price We stayed at The Belvedere 16th - 22nd September 2006. When we arrived (quite early ) to check-in, there were no problems. The duty manager found us a room that was ready and allowed us to check in about 4 hours early. The room was on the 16th floor and positioned midway at the rear of the hotel. The view was good, especially at night. The room was a King and we also had the NY1 package (full breakfast included). I had read previous reviews about the bathrooms being small, but was pleasantly suprised - those reveiwers should visit Rome to see what a small bathroom is really like! The room was clean and very comfortable, but there appeared to be some re-furbishment work going on in the room next door to us. So, if you are visiting soon and are allocated a room on the 16th floor check with staff if this is still going on. The work didn't start until about 10 and was over by 3 most days. But on our final day it started at 7.30am!! This said however, it did not spoil our overall experience of the hotel. The breakfast was one of the best we have experienced on our travels, excellent quality and choice. The location of the hotel was great and although we chose to do alot of walking, the subway was nearby and also buses. The taxis are cheap, but unfortunately the UN were in session during our visit, making cab journeys difficult due to the gridlocked traffic. I will definately stay at The Belvedere when I return to NY.

Turned up at 3pm and checked straight in. We used the elevators all the time as we had a pushchair but never had a problem - instead of using main elevators, use the ones at end of corridor - never had to wait. Room was great - loved having a fridge. Air con was fine. We overlooked the road and didnt have any problem with noise. Loads of places to eat nearby - Empire and Galaxy Diners good for breakfast - fantastic Hard Rock Cafe on Times Square for dinner that was walkable. Paid $160 per night for room through hotel web site. Good value. Loved everything about this hotel.

<Author>smithcvs
<Content>Apology We stayed at the Belvedere in May 2005 and I posted a subsequent review on this Forum. We were more than pleased with the place, its facilities and the price. However, I had a minor issue with the attitude of one of the door staff. Everyone else were excellent as was the whole experience. As a result of my review and concern about the staff member the manager at the Belvedere telephoned me from New York to Staffordshire in the U.K. to say that he had read my Tripadvisor report and was dealing with it, as he felt that it was not acceptable behaviour by one of his staff. I found that service fantastic, to actually ring from the US to the UK.I just want to apologise to the management of the Belvedere for not posting this review earlier as I cannot get over how thorough they have been. Well done.Anyone visiting New York should give this hotel serious consideration it has everything going for it.

<Author>Royalpalmbay
<Content>Everything we expected - well done Tripadvisor We stayed here for a week at the end of August 2006 and chose the hotel after careful research, especially taking account of the Tripadvisor reviews. We were not disappointed. The hotel is welcoming, with the reception team very helpful and pleasant. I forgot to book a smoking room and they were full when we checked in but it was no problem to switch the following day. The Bell Boys and Doormen were again very effiecient and pleasant. The room was very comfortable (the usual two double beds in an American hotel) and housekeeping did a good job. Althouth the bathroom was small it was satisfactory. The air conditioning also worked well and it was handy to have the fridge in the room. We used the service lift on occasion so no problem there.The location is perfect: There is a good deli on the corner of W48th and 8th Ave and a decent diner just round the corner for breakfast. We had two good meals at a Vietnamese across 8th Ave. and there was a Thai restaurant next door which looked good but we did not get a chance to try. We also ate at The Olive Garden in Times Square which was also good and only a five minute walk away. The Grey Line Bus Tour office is just round the corner on 8th Ave and the location is perfect for picking up the up-town and down town loops. We walked less than five minutes to the Winter Garden Theatre to see Mama Mia (excellent), we also walked about 1 mile to the Cruise Line departure dock on W42nd street, and the subway is just round the corner on W49th and 7th Ave. so getting round was really easy.We would definitely recommend staying at the Belvedere.

<Author>dadada767
<Content>The good, the bad and the unclean I stayed at the Belvedere as an alternative to the incredibly over-priced Sheraton several blocks further up I stayed at previously.Firstly, Belvedere is cheap for its location and for New York City. The 'mini' gym is free here, something which the $300-per-night Sheraton charges for. They can probably charge $100 more and get away with it. New York City prices are beyond silly.Having said that, Belvedere is lacking in several aspects. Breakfast is not included for the $175 nightly charge. The wireless internte access is expensive and has a low bandwidth - on the 12th floor anyway. The two elevators are quite slow and crammed. A hotel with over 20 storeys needs to rethink its transportation issue.Most importantly, however, was the cleanliness issue. The room and the bathroom were nominally clean, but I found a long strand of hair beneth the covers on my bed the first night. Hoping it belonged to a maid, and not a previous guest, I allowed the matter to pass. However, on the second night the second bed had flies on it happily roaming upwards. This might be a New York-wide issue or the price for staying near to Times Square, but I am neither comforted nor satisfied.

<Author>2teenmom
<Content>Good choice in the theater district We (a family of 4) stayed at the Belvedere for a total of 9 nights. The room was surprisingly large and comfortable (2 double beds), and the kitchenette (microwave, fridge, and coffemaker) were a real bonus. The a/c worked just fine, and the bathroom was adequate (though could have used more shelf space). Hotel staff and service were very accommodating. Wonderful location -- incredibly central to everything, but the street that it's on (W. 48th) is relatively quiet, with a feeling of neighborhood. Great Mexican restaurant 2 stores away. Wireless internet is extra and expensive. We researched lots of hotels in NY for price, convenience, etc. We were very pleased with the Belvedere, and would stay here again. (A word to the wise: NYC hotel taxes add a large chunk to the hotel price!)

I really did not find the elevators that slow except maybe in the AM when people were checking out. <Author>FamilleSB

The TV had a green cast to it and was ancient. Since we had such a low floor and I had read how slow the elevators are, we took the stairs all the time and it was the one advantage to having a third floor room. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly, but we never complained about anything, we just focused on having fun.This hotel is in a great location. <Author>jaskev
<Content>Good hotel, great location just a few problems This review might have some of the same information as the one from Thornhill, below, becasue that one was written by my son after the first night. Now that we've completed our 4 night stay, here's the full scoop.This hotel is ideally located on a quiet side street within easy walking distance of Broadway, Times Square, 5th Avenue stores and Rockefeller Center. It is a converted apartment building but that doesn't matter - the rooms are standard, comfortable, nice sized hotel rooms (except the bathrooms - which are ridiculously small). The staff from front desk to door man are exceptional. They just can't do enough and they do it all quickly with a smile on their faces.Here's what you need to know before booking the Belvedere:1. Top floors have been recently renovated with new beds (very, very soft) and luxury linens, larger and newer TV's. But, because you are on a higher floor, your windows are in the open air meaning you hear every bit of traffic - horns, sirens, etc, that come from the major NYC streets below. And these go on continuously, all day and night. The lower floors facing the back (we were on the 6th after we moved from the 14th) have no view at all and back onto another apartment building. This insulation means we didn't hear any street noise at all from this room. A QUIET ROOM WOULD BE A LOWER FLOOR, CENTER OF THE BUILDING, FACING THE BACK. 2. The washroom is tiny. Don't plan on displaying any toiletries.3. Blow dryer - awful. Call the front desk and the they will bring up a very powerful handheld blow dryer.4. Elevators can be slow - there are service elevators on either side of the hallway. Use them.5. There's a fridge and microwave in each room which are great for snacks and drinks. The little store on the corner has very reasonable prices on fresh fruit, drinks, etc.6. The Conceirge is fabulous. She has great ideas and a lot of up to date information on restaurants, attractions etc. In fact, she told us to avoid an area restaurant because they had just changed chefs the week before and there were still a lot of kinks in the food and service. Her recommendations were great.All in all, this hotel is very clean, comfortable (in the right room) and a great value for the location. It's not luxury by any means but it's a nice place to come back to after being out all day.  
<Date>Sep 1, 2006
<Rating>4	5	4	5	5	5	5	3	

<Author>GCV
<Content>Really enjoyed our stay! My husband and I definitely enjoyed our stay at the Belvedere (Aug. 20-23) and would definitely come back, particularly if we got a great rate like we did this time. The pros:1. Great, quiet location that's a short walking distance to major attactions like Times Square, Broadway, and even Central Park, as well as several subway stations. If you like to walk (short and long ones) and use the subway/bus, you have the perfect location.2. If you are a couple, get the room with king size bed (very firm, but that was fine with us). While not super spacious, space was very adequate, room laid out nicely, and was very clean and fresh smelling. The room's decor was traditional, nothing fancy. We had a great view from our room on the 15th floor.3. Small kitchenette area with microwave, mini-frig, sink, coffeemaker, cabinets. Didn't think we would use it, but came in handy in saving $$ for breakfast and snacks. Stores selling food/breakfast/drug store items a short walk away.4. Closet5. Friendly staff.6. Lots of places to eat nearby. Great diner--Olympic Diner w/i 3 blocks. If you love Indian food, must try Baluchi's on W. 56 near Broadway. Further out by subway or cab, if you go to Little Italy, you must have dessert at Ferrara's. And check out Pete's Tavern near Union Square.The cons:1. If you are not used to window air conditioning units, they are noisier, but you get used to it and it has sensitive temp controls.2. Not a lot of counter space in bathroom (pedestal sink). Otherwise, bathroom small but well laid out and for the most part, looks elegant.3. Not a lot of amenities (just get the basic soap, lotion and shampoo).4. No eating utensils, plates or dishwashing detergent provided automatically, but staff washed glasses supplied with room when dirty. Regarding the elevators, yes, the two main ones in the lobby are small, but we didn't have any problem. The secret is there are actually 4 elevators; look for the service elevators on your floor, and use them.Also, we found the area very quiet for its proximity to major attractions. I saw some great hotels right on Times Square but I think I would prefer the Belvedere's location. Otherwise, people have to consider they are in a major city, and will hear noises on occasion.Now, if you are looking for a hotel experience with super large luxury rooms/suites with loads of extra room amenities, this isn't the place for you. But if you are looking for a high quality hotel that'll provide a very comfortable stay and a nice price, try this hotel.

<Author>MJCB
<Content>Good theatre location, good NY rate Considering how expensive New York hotels can be, for its rate this hotel offers adequate facilities. Its strength is its location and very friendly service. It is located within walking distance of Time Square, the theatres and the Rockefeller centre (great views of Central Park and Empire State building from the top!). It also has a small fitness centre. We had the hotel breakfast one morning and would not recommend it 鈥?self-service hot or cold buffet and not so great coffee at a hotel rate charge 鈥?better to go to Starbucks around the corner or other diners for a cheaper and perhaps better breakfast. The hotel鈥檚 weakness is its very small bathroom (walls are an arm鈥檚 length apart) and both the washbasin and toilet had cracks 鈥?our bathtub also had a black patch where the white enamel is worn. This contrasts greatly with the very smart lobby area. However, if your main aim is sightseeing, the bathroom is not a problem. Another disappointment was its complete inflexibility about a later check out time and the staff were not very knowledgeable about restaurants outside its immediate area. For its price and convenient location I would stay here again.  
<Date>Aug 29, 2006

<Author>Penney1000
<Content>Wonderful Hotel! My daughter and I came to NYC in May and stayed at the Belvedere. I stayed there 7 years ago and was impressed. We were there for 3 nights and had a great time.We arrived a couple of hours before check in and our room was ready, we requested a non smoking room and received one. He was busy answering phones, putting away mail talking to people who went by, etc.Our room was clean, the bathroom was tiny but OK, I loved the coffee pot and refrigerator. We did not eat at the hotel at all, I thought the food there was pricey. One thing I liked is the location. It is so central to everything, it is only a few blocks walk to the Today Show, you are right around the corner from Times Square where you can catch the red double decker buses (they were great - I would highly recommend them), it is an easy walk to the theatre and to the United Nations. Plus restaurant row is only 1 block away, I would recommend the Olympus Diner, right around the corner from the hotel - they were very friendly and the food was resonably priced.We really enjoyed our trip and would not hesitate to stay at the Belevedere again. The hotel was as great as I remember it 7 years ago.

<Author>maroyt

We were able to buy juice/fruits at a nearby store and have it on hand in the room for snacking. The elevators were small and a bit slow at times, but it didn't affect our stay in a really negative way. Overall, our stay a the this hotel was terrific and I would definitely recommend staying at the Belvedere.

<Author>kckmullen

There was usually a line to use a crowded elevator, with no air condition, and it usually stopped at many floors before we reached our 10th floor. I tried to use the laundry room, where you can't purchase laundry soap. The change machine does not work and the front desk, gift store, and concierge do not give change. They do have a restaurant, but no room service. When you're payin $400 per night, you expect a great hotel. The rooms were clean and the doorman was always nice.This is a 2 star hotel with 4 star prices.

<Author>CindyMH
<Content>Perfect Midtown Hotel We stayed at the Belvedere July 18-21, 2006. Having had some negative experiences in the past at Manhattan hotels, we were very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the Belvedere for the price ($200 a night, which to me is high, but not by NYC standards). All the staff members we encountered were friendly and efficient. Our room was spacious and looked recently renovated - very clean and pleasantly decorated. The bathroom fixtures also appeared to be new and well cared for. Housekeeping was great. The lobby and elevators were lovely old art deco. The view from our room (16th floor) was breathtaking. The 2 elevators are very small; this never caused us any problem until the day we checked out. Lots of others were checking out also and the volume did cause a wait of 10 minutes for the elevator. We didn't eat at the restaurants - had breakfast around the corner at the Olympic, which served good, hearty food for a reasonable price. The location of this hotel can't be beat for access to the theatre district, the great Hell's Kitchen restaurants and all other midtown attractions. I highly recommend!

<Author>Taja029
<Content>A nice place to stay with minor shortcomings... We just returned from a four day trip to New York where we resided at the Belvedere. My husband and I traveled with our 2-year-old as well as an 18-year-old relative. Overall, the hotel was fine. The room was large enough for all of us and the refrigerator and microwave came in handy for drinks, snacks and doggie-bag leftovers. Just bring some plastic-ware to eat with. The bathroom was small, but managable. We had to ask for additional towels twice, and both times we recived them quickly and without any problems. Also, when we first checked in, the toilet didn't flush. Immediately, a repairman was dispatched to our room and it was repaired within minutes.The front elevators are a little slow, so just pack some patience. There are additional, smaller elevators at the end of the hall that you can use. We didn't try the on-site breakfast, but it looked a little pricey at about $17 per person.The staff was relatively friendly, I think it just depends on who happens to be working when you step up to the front desk or dial 0 from your room phone. One complaint I did have is that I called the night before we were scheduled to leave to request a 1-hour later check-out time. I was told on the phone that it shouldn't be a problem, but to call in the morning to confirm with the morning staff. So, I called again the following morning and was promptly told that I could not have the extra hour in the hotel room. The staff-member told me that there were no more late-check outs available for our floor. I'm not sure what that means - and didn't realize there was a race for late check outs.I would recommend the hotel with those notes. The location is great and the accomodations are fine.  
<Date>Jul 22, 2006
<Rating>4	4	3	5	4	3	2	3	

<Author>beachloverMemphis
<Content>Would stay here again We selected the Belvedere after reading the excellent reviews and our family of 4 stayed here July 10-14. We were very pleased with the cleanliness of the room and felt it was certainly large enough to accomodate us comfortably. The staff of the concierge desk were especially nice and helpful in getting us tickets to about anything we wanted to do. The location of the hotel is excellent--very close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, 5th Ave, etc. It is just around the corner from Hell's Kitchen (restaurant row), so there are many choices of restaurants with about any ethnicity on 9th Ave. A few negatives: We were on the 6th floor facing the front and we do agree that the curtains do not block enough light. We were bothered with noise beginning about 10:15 each evening when the garbage trucks make their pickups. After the first night we knew to expect that so it did not seem to bother us as much after then. But I would recommend bringing some foam earplugs because the honking horns and other street noises can also filter in. Yes, the elevators are slow so just be prepared for quite a wait or request a lower floor room so stairs can be utilized. Even though we had these minor negatives, we definitely would stay here again. It's a quaint, lovely hotel in just a super location and we felt the price was affordable.

<Author>got2trvl
<Content>Wonderful stay This hotel has much to offer: perfect location, comfortable and clean rooms, pleasant staff and good value for money. The bathrooms are on the smaller side as there is little counter space to spread your things out, however, we managed fine with two adults and two kids. The kitchennette was useful to store drinks and prepare quick snacks. The elevators can be slow, but there are three on each floor and one can always use the ones at the end of the corridor if service is excessively slow. We found the staff very pleasant and helpful. They stored our luggage well past the checkout time, provided directions and extra towels were made available when we needed them. There are many restaurants close by (try Seeda on 50th between 8th and 9th for Thai food), and having the subway within walking distance was very handy. The Belevedere met our expectations and we will stay there again when in NYC in the future.

The doormen hold the door open every time you leave and return and are so helpful. The conergie got us great tickets with dinner to the Phantom of the Opera. The bathrooms are small, especially if you are traveling with a family of teenagers, but we took turns getting ready. The elevators are slow in the mornings around 9 or 10 (especially weekends) but really aren't as bad as others have complained about. I will definetely stay at this hotel again when I return to NYC. It was incredibly muggy and warm when we were in NYC but our room was a cool oasis when we came back to it from a day of touring. <Content>Great hotel, great location ,great city. Stayed at the Belvedere for one week from 25th May to 1st June with my wife and two sons(12 and 9.) Would definately stay again.TIP-I booked and printed off Empire State Building tickets online which means avoiding queuing at second floor on the day-you just go straight to the elevators. However when we got to the 86th floor observatory there were signs for the recently re-opened 102nd floor obseravtory but tickets can only be purchased at the second floor office on the day. There are no signs on the lower floors to tell you this and once up you cannot go down to buy them so if you want to go all the way up buy additional tickets before entering elevators

<Author>moushy
<Content>Good hotel in great location If you are looking for somewhere central to stay for a quick trip to New York, then The Belvedere is a good option. It's really near Time Square and perfectly positioned for either spending the day uptown or downtown within walking distance. The room we had was neat and clean. The bathroom was on the small side. The air-conditioning unit was old and noisy but, at least you could cool the room down. The breakfast was not nice and was overpriced but, the location of the hotel means that you have cheaper, better choices about 1 block away.The other thing to note about this hotel is the lift - it's annoyingly slow. We were on the 15th floor and it took forever to get up or down as the lift stops on every floor. Towards the end of our stay we found a lesser used lift which was much faster. When you are standing in reception by the main lifts, look down the corridor to your right. At the end is the other lift. Overall, an above average hotel in a great location.  
<Date>Jun 5, 2006
<Rating>4	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fantastic Stay We stayed at the Belevedere for 3 nights over Memorial Day weekend with our two daughters, ages 10 and 7. Our room on the 16th floor was very nice and spacious enough (the bathroom was small, but I wouldn't say tiny). Everything looked new or new-ish, so this might have been a recently remodeled room. The location was PERFECT, short walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and the American Girl Place (a must stop for us :) ) and a not-too-long walk to south Central Park. There was a subway stop two blocks north which we used to go to the Museum of Natural History, for example.The staff was helpful and friendly to us. Minor kvetches - we had booked a room with two double beds but they only had a room with a king sized bed to give us upon check-in. They offered to move us the next day, but we preferred staying put (we all sleep in one king sized bed at home, so we were used to it anyway). The hair dryer is a standard issue hotel hairdryer; they are never efficient, so if that bothers you, bring your own. They provide a coffeemaker with all the necessities, a fridge and a microwave. We brought our own bowls and plastic spoons from home along with a box of cereal to have quick breakfasts in our room. There's a very good convenience store at the corner of the block, about 100 feet away.Our room was not noisy probably due to being on the 16th floor and running the air conditioner. I don't know what it would be like in the winter. We didn't think the elevators were slow as described in other reviews, but they are small so they fill up quickly. Being on the second to top floor was an advantage because the elevator was empty when we called it up. It seemed to get called at several floors almost every time on our way down, which is perhaps why people think it is slow.For an average of $200 per night for a holiday weekend, we felt we got a fantastic value and didn't feel like we were staying at a budget hotel.  
<Date>Jun 4, 2006
<Rating>5	5	5	-1	5	-1	5	-1	

<Author>lingof
<Content>Great location We have stayed at a number of hotels in New York during our visits to the city. This booking was based on recommendations in Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The staff were helpful and the room was a good size for New York . The refrigerator and coffe making machine were also welcome although we did not use the microwave also supplied. The room was clean and well kept and the bathroom was also very acceptable. We were on the 16th. floor so we were not bothered by traffic noise but this could possibly be a problem on lower floors facing the street. The breakfast room was spacious although priced at $12 undoubtedly more expensive than local cafes. However, it was convenient. There is a large choice of restaurants within walking distance and you are far enough away from Times Square not to be affected by the crowds and chain restaurants.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Good quality, pleasant  Stayed at the Belvedere on a first visit to New York. As someone who spends more time in hotels (on business) than I would choose, I'm critical of many but found little to fault here. We were met by friendly and efficient reception staff and were able to check in well before the stated 4pm time. Other staff were unfailingly helpful. The room was of ample size, comfortable and very clean and had a wonderful view, especially at night. The only quibble was that the aircon unit was noisy. Didn't eat in the hotel - plenty of diners nearby for a traditional breakfast, and a wide range of good restaurants within 10 minutes walk for dinner. Chose this hotel on personal recommendation, which proved to be fully justified. I'll be back!

<Rating>4	4	4	-1	5	-1	5	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very nice stay We've just returned from out 3 night stay at the Belvedere. The room was large with a spacious bath, spotlessly clean with minimal street noise, and very comfortable. We found the staff to be helpful and they responded quickly to our requests for extra towels and decaf coffee. We asked the concierge several questions and found him to be curt, almost rude, as if we were bothering him from reading the newspaper. The bellhops were most friendly and gave us tips on taxi and subway travel. We ate breakfast at Pigally, which was relatively inexpensive and delicious (french press coffee!); and also at Olympic Diner, which was bland (no salt) and over cooked. There were 4 ladies in our room and we were very comfortable and didn't feel crowded. We had requested a nonsmoking, dust free room as one of our party has asthma and they accomodated all requests easily. Found the small fridge and sink area convenient, as well as the safe. We were allowed to check in early as soon as a room was available with an approximate wait of 10-15 minutes. After check out, they stored our bags until we left for the airport, offered us a place to freshen up, and hailed a cab. Elevators were never a problem for us even with our room being on the 14th floor. If you're planning to stay here, I'd recommend that you request a higher floor since these are more recently remodeled and are insulated against street noise. Loved the location and would definitely stay here again.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Horrendous Customer Service We stayed at the Flatotel my mother and I for our annual NYC trip together and should have gone back! First of all, there is no early check-in- we tried but were told that the check is 4pm and if we wanted we could call all afternoon to see if a room was ready- Flatotel, we got right in! Also, you have to tip everyone! The baggage people to the taxi cab people- you don鈥檛 even ask for help and they run over and then you feel obliged to give one. Also there are 2 elevators may I repeat 2 elevators that you can fit no more than 5 people in or 3 people with luggage for the amount of rooms they have and one was broken all day! So room for 5 people in this hotel with one functioning elevator was horrendous! Also this hotel does not offer room service of any kind and the restaurant is open for an overpriced very basic breakfast every morning for a few hours. When we got to our room it was spic and span (that鈥檚 the only plus about this hotel) and it smelled strongly of plastic/paint. My mom was flipping through channels one night and by mistake pressed the movie button by accident and it started playing- after contacting the front desk and telling her the situation we were told we were stuck with the move- which we though was the advertised $12.95. The next afternoon we went to the front desk to try and get the charge removed again and were told the move was actually $22 and they could not remove it because it ran for 5 minutes (while we called the front desk) and the cut off time is if the movie runs for 2 minutes and the charge was not removed- Also, the shower water is always cold if not lukewarm and turns HOT about 30 minutes into the shower scolding you. There is 1 floor that carries ice. The rooms are very loud all night and morning long- we were on the 5th floor and were constantly awoken even with the air conditioner on. The bathroom is very clean, but there is not plastic shower curtain, just a cloth one that gets soaked when you shower each time. There are practically no TV channels to watch at night before bed- everything you must order- very basic cable. The coffee pot in the room had a scummy residue inside it as it had not been washed out anytime recently. The street it is located on it ok with a couple restaurants but across the street at night there are homeless people and hookers waiting outside the building directly across the street. I would never stay here again nor would I recommend this hotel- it ruined part of our experience in NYC.
