<Author>rncathy
<Content>Great stay at the Belvedere My friend and I just got home from a great long weekend stay at the Belvedere. We stayed there from May 5-8 and couldn't have been happier with the hotel. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was very clean and although the bathroom was small, found it to be fine. I thought the bed was comfortable (we had two doubles) and I usually have a hard time with hotel beds and pillows, but I slept very well for our entire stay. The little refrigerator was nice for keeping our water cold, but that was about all we used of the kitchen. Would probably be a really nice feature if we were staying there with our kids, but this was a mom's weekend! Keep in mind that it is not really a kitchen at all, but a microwave and little fridge with a coffee maker. We stayed on the 9th floor and had a pretty nice view, which I enjoyed. I didn't think that it was too noisy at all, in fact I sort of enjoyed listening to the city sounds while laying it bed. It is afterall, New York! We had a non-smoking room and I'm not sure if the entire floor was non-smoking, but I sort of smelled the smallest odor of cigarette smoke outside in the hall. It was not an issue at all though, and believe me...I cannot stand cigarette smoke at all, so it was fine. As far as the elevators go, it was fine. I didn't find that they were that slow. That to me is just being nit-picky. They were fast enough and like another person said, we often used the employee one as well because it was close to our room.The location was great! Very nice and convenient to everything. Perfect for first time travelers to NY. The concierge desk was very helpful and both of the women that were working when we asked questions were extremely helpful and nice. The subway was convenient and easy to take and we were in an easy walking distance to the theaters and Times Square. Had a nice dinner at Carmine's, but the portions were huge, so for two women it was just a little too much. Went and saw the Wedding Singer which was great fun and would highly recommend it to anyone!So, despite some of the recent bad reviews of the Belvedere, we had a great stay and would definitely stay here again! I read in Frommer's that for the best view ask for a room at the 8th floor or above, which we did request and got.Have fun!

<Rating>5	4	4	-1	5	-1	5	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The good and the bad of the Belvedere First impression of the hotel was great. Nice central location to the touristy area (Times Square, Theater District), beautiful exterior, friendly doorman. The room was decent, though we got a hotel on the smoking floor and it was really stinky. (*Big hint - pull the air filter out of the air conditioner and wash it when you get there. We found this out the 3rd day of our stay and it made a huge difference.) The room size is nice, and the microwave and fridge were nice too. Room had a coffeemaker and hairdryer. Bathroom on the small side, but adequate. There were no extra toiletries in the bathroom like a shower cap or shoe mitt, though they did provide shampoo, conditioner, and soap. Room was pretty clean (though did have the smoking floor smell), on one of the days we were there the maid cleaned the bathroom floor and left it sticky which was gross to walk on with bare feet. The main problem we had, as others did, was with the elevators. They were SUPER SLOW, so when in a hurry to go anywhere, take the stairs if you are on a floor low enough to do so. Also, our room key cards had to be rekeyed twice while we were there, as they stopped working which was a pain with the slow elevators.The front desk staff was very nice, though when we called and asked for extra pillows - it took an hour and a half and a repeat phone call to actually get them. They did let us check in at around noon when check-in time is not until 4 pm. The doormen always hailed taxis for us and held the door for us.All in all, this is a decent hotel in a decent location - but don't expect anything great. I wouldn't pay more than $250 for a room here, and that mostly location. For around $25 more a night, I would recommend the Sheraton New York Hotel  Towers in the same area over this one. The rooms were much nicer and the beds much more comfortable. Also, I have to disagree with the reviewer who recommended Pigalle across the street for breakfast and Lindys. Pigalle had some of the worst service I've ever had, we were mostly ignored (probably because the tip was automatically added to the bill) and waited forever for food (though the food was quite good) - go to the Olympic Diner for breakfast instead. Not as nice an atmosphere (very much the diner), but the service was much better. Lindys is a TOURIST TRAP. VERY overpriced average food ($19 for a club sandwich, for instance)- you can do much better with so many restaurants to choose from. Ciro Trattorio has great Italian food not far from the hotel for a reasonable price.

<Author>pointyhead
<Content>Excellent Hotel for its' price range - variable rooms My wife and I (plus our two boys aged 8 and 13) stayed at the Belvedere for 6 nights in early April. We booked on their website paying ($214, $234 at weekends). We could probably have got a better deal paying upfront via a discount site, but wanted the flexibility of cancelling at the last moment.We arrived early (about 1:00pm) to be told our room wasn't ready. Following a sigh from my wife, they checked again and allocated a room on the 10th floor. This turned out to be a mixed blessing.We had booked via recommendations on this website, so were a little disappointed at the quality of the furnishings. Everything seemed a bit worn-out and the TV had poor reception. Anyway, we ventured out to explore New York and settled down to sleep at about 9pm having had a long trip and being on English hours . However, at 10:30pm we were awoken by teenagers shouting excitedly along the corridor. This continued for quite a while, until my wife ventured out and asked them to be quiet.Next morning, we asked to be moved and the hotel couldn't have been more helpful. We were put in a room on the 15th floor, looking out the front. This room had obviously been redecorated and was really nice, including a modern TV. So be aware that the rooms are variable and try to secure one of the newer ones.As regards the hotel and rooms in general :Location : Perfect, on the edge on Hells Kitchen, but very close to the action. Felt safe at all times.Plenty of restaurants within walking distance (we found Olympic Diner and Pigalle were both good).Hotel : Lifts are a little small and there can be some wait. Didn't try the restaurant or Gym.Staff : Excellent, very friendly and helpful especially bell boys.Rooms : Good size room for four of us, in 2 double beds. Bathroom is very small, but fine. Kitchen area (fridge, microwave, sink etc.) was an added bonus, which meant we could have the odd meal in our room. Cleaning : No issues with cleanliness, room cleaned well every day.So, with no experience of hotels in New York, we relied solely on the recommendations of this site to find a good choice within our budget. Happily, I feel that we came up trumps. The only caveat is to try to secure a newer room as that made all the difference to our stay. Would definitely book Belvedere again if returning to New York.  
<Date>Apr 16, 2006

<Author>Papkins
<Content>Belvedere and beyond Hi, We My wife two teenage daughters and myself have just had a wonderful time in NYC. We stayed at the belvedere for 7 nights and cant complain, hotel was clean and friendly. Was on the 4th floor so the lifts were not a problem as some folks sometimes mention. The hotel is located in a really convienent location, only one block from Times square (less than 5 mins stroll) We had a full itinery for our stay and saw everything we wanted to. Tip for those who are not aware,before you go to NYC book your tickets on the web for Liberty island (time pass required to go inside the monument)Top of The Rock is well worth the visit and ESB all of these are a must see. We managed to get tickets to see Chicago at a really good price, Tip on the day go to the Ambassador Theatre box office for 9.30am, it opens at 10am. Shoppers, go to Customer services at both Macy's and Bloomingdales and get a 11% discount card off clothes and shoes.Food, great Pizza at Johns on Bleeker St Greenwich, best in New York, go Hungry and be prepared to queue, but well worth it. Nice sandwiches at Planet Sandwich nearby the hotel on 9th Avenue, the shop front is a little deceiving, but dont be put off. We got a taxi no problem, outside of the Hotel to take us back to JFK only cost $55 all in. same coming into the city, go to the official Taxi rank, you wont be stung.Will stay again at the Belvedere when we return to the Big Apple.  
<Date>Apr 15, 2006
<Rating>4	4	4	-1	3	-1	4	-1

<Author>MizzMocha
<Content>What an Awesome Hotel! Stayed at the Belvedere Hotel for one night (3/26/06) before a cruise to the Caribbean. I was EXTREMELY impressed by this hotel. Clean, spacious, comfortable room. The room had a separate sitting/living area with a sofa, desk and chair, armoire and TV with game set. There was a door that separated the bedroom from the living area, which was very convenient as my husband was ready for bed early and I was not, but I was able stay up and not disturb him by closing the door to the bedroom. The bedroom also had a TV in addition to two nightstands, a dresser, and a queen-sized bed. The room also had a coffee maker, refrigerator, microwave, iron and ironing board, and blow dryer--everything you would need for a nice stay. There is also free wireless Internet, though I did have some difficulty accessing it and the help number was disconnected. The staff was friendly and helpful. There is a restaurant on premise (but we didn't eat there). The Belvedere is in the heart of the theater/Times Square District right in the middle of the action. We could easily walk to Times Square and there were plenty of restaurants everywhere, from little mom and pops to trendy and upscale. Subway access was also within walking distance. PERFECT location! It was a little noisy, but in my opinion, all of New York is noisy. A good set of earplugs are necessary no matter where you stay in New York--it's a loud city!I took photos, but unfortunately I didn't know my flash wasn't working and the pictures did not come out! :(I got a smoking rate on Quikbook--just $140 for the night--a steal for this very nice, very clean, in the middle of all the action hotel. I would definitely stay in this hotel again. Thumbs all the way up on this one!

<Author>TaylorKat

We had a two double beds that were comfortable, tv, microwave, small fridge, coffee maker, iron  a safe. The room was very clean, the towels were soft and the room was quiet at night. <Rating>4	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Nice location but the elevators are a pain! Stayed at the Belvedere in April 2006. Excellent location near Times Square - cannot fault it. The room was a good standard and large by New York standards. The bathroom was a bit cramped though. The maid service was excellent and the room was spotless. In short, the Belvedere deserves its high rating. Our main issues were the following:There are only two elevators which may be used by guests. These are not large elevators (they can hold maybe six thin people!) and since there are seventeen floors we had long waits to get downstairs and back up again. While we were staying there, construction was ongoing on our floor for a few rooms. This meant that the carpet was covered with paper to protect it and there was dust everywhere until they stopped work after 5pm. In addition since our room was located right next to the service elevator our door was blocked several times by trolleys of debris which was annoying. I don't mind construction work but I do mind that the reception desk never told us this would be happening while we were staying on that floor. A little common courtesy would not go amiss!  
<Date>Apr 6, 2006
<Rating>4	3	4	-1	5	-1	3	-1	

<Author>GeorgeCoTyrone
<Content>Definitely Worth a look We are just back from a 4 night stay at the Belvedere with little complaints. The Belvedere is quite Central which is key. Its walking distance to Times Square, Empire State Building, Central Park etc providing you don't mind a 15-20 min walk and the weather is fine. The lobby is well staffed with a concierge etc to assist with Luggage, Taxi's, Tourist info etc. The bedroom we had was very clean and spacious but the bathroom was small. A fridge, Microwave etc is provided in the bedroom along with satellite TV etc, but if your a tourist you won't be in it long anyway as there's too much to see and do! The room was very warm but did have air con, although we found it too noisy to leave on at night. The breakfast in the Hotel is superb but a touch expensive at $17. There is no Bar which is unfortunate, but there are hundreds of Bars and resturaunts close by. The room rates jump substantially at the weekend, so if you can stay mid week its adviseable.All I would ask the Hotel to do is get a Bar and have bigger bathrooms.Enjoy!

<Author>vinny
<Content>i'm in two minds! okay so when i booked this hotel, following reviews on tripadvisor of course.. i was convinced this was a luxury hotel. i honestly cannot fault the cleanliness, general service, and comfort. i don't know if i was being naieve about the price vs. standard of new york hotels (i've only been once before and stayed in a really cute boutique hotel in chelsea). so when i arrived i was *slightly* disappointed at its ordinariness. BUT!!!! the hotel at the end of the day is great.. room was very clean, the bathroom was teeny tiny but that's only a small quibble. however my mum did manage to knock a pot of moisturiser into the toilet that's how little space there was. the room itself was good - i've stayed in bigger, but the two twin beds were extremely comfortable and made every day and we were given clean towels each day. plenty of storage space and there was also cable tv and nintendo. it was a pleasure to come back to our room. the breakfasts are amazing - they seem pricey, but by the time u've been out to a local diner and paid 15 dollars u may as well pay a couple of dollars more and really fill up for the day. seriously, this hotel has the best american breakfast buffet EVER. (u have to try the sausages). location is beyond brilliant. u can walk to times square and the rockerfellar in about two minutes, and it's obviously very close to the subway.staff were very helpful at all times (altho the concierge's prediction about february's blizzard being nothing to worry about was slightly off the mark, hehe!!) but honestly they could not have been more helpful in a time of crisis, giving advice about amtrak etc etc. one thing i do want to mention. the fire alarm. ringing at 4a.m. two mornings on the run. and apparently a couple of days before we arrived, according to the other guests. i get up early anyway so it didn't bother me too much but i can see how it could have been really, really annoying for a lot of people wanting a good night's sleep. but i suppose u r in the city that never sleeps!?!? no apology was at any point offered to us, or indeed an explantion. so that pretty much sucked. also one night, about 10pm, there were some guys shouting right outside our room -they definitely weren't guests and we felt uncomfortable enough to creep over and bolt the door. please don't let this put u off tho, i shouldn't imagine security is a major issue but it did make me feel slightly uneasy. we left some things in the room too which they sent to us (at our expense) and the service was reasonably speedy. so apart from a few minor points i would wholeheartedly recommend the belvedere! thanks for a great stay.  
<Date>Mar 27, 2006

<Author>tcook052
<Content>Another positive stay at Belvedere Just returned from an overall very enjoyable 5 night stay at the Belvedere and am very happy to report I can find way more good points than negatives. The $165 per night rate I got back in Nov. from the hotel's own website a very good deal considering the prices went up the closer I got to arrival date so there must only be a limited amount of rooms at this internet special price made available. The room was fairly standard with 2 large double beds, nice walk- in closet with safe, luggage rack  ironing board plus the small kitchenette that I, as others, found so handy during the stay. Front desk, bell and concierge staff friendly. As most reviews have mentioned, it's 2 blocks to Times Square so hard to go wrong for value + location, somthing not usually found together in Midtown/Theatre District. I did find it ironic two Hilton brand properties, the Hilton Garden Inn and the Hampton Inn both within a few blocks of the belvedere but when I was checking both were a min. of $30 more per night than Belvedere, and often up to $100 more for essentially the same thing but with the brand name. There were a few small notes about housekeeping I'd made to myself, such as bathtub not fully cleaned or carpet vacuumed thoroughly, but both fairly minor, picky things compared to all the Belvedere and it's staff did right. The cable TV being out for 24 hours, well, that likely wasn't entirely the hotel's fault though the apologies weren't too profuse when I called the front desk. But hey--it's NYC and I only flipped it on one night after a long day of touring to put the feet up.If you do plan on giving the Belvedere a try, and I would highly suggest it, there is a subway stop over on West 50th Street, so a very short two block walk if that. Also, buying an unlimited 24-hour Metropass for $7 probably the best value in the city besides the Belvedere.All in all, a very positive experience and I can now see why the Belvedere is so highly rated in the Tripadvisor rankings. Two thumbs way up!

<Author>Like2TravelMom
<Content>Great Location, Great Price We booked this hotel based on other reviews and were not disappointed. The location is excellent--a couple of blocks away from Times Square, close to Broadway theaters (the 1/2 price Broadway ticket booth is 5-10 minutes away), restaurants and Gray Line tour bus stops (the Gray Line Tour Bus office is a block and a half away). The street the hotel is located on is relatively quiet (you sometimes hear fire truck/police sirens--but where in New York don't you? A fire station is 1 1/2 blocks away). At check-in, we asked for a room on a higher floor and were not bothered by noise. Our room was clean and decent-sized for NYC (the bathroom is small though--big enough for one person). We had a problem with our air conditioner the first night (very noisy)--they sent someone up to repair it but the problem wasn't fixed. Another repairman came up the next day and replaced the air conditioner while we were out sightseeing. Our room had a safe, microwave, small sink and large dorm-sized refrigerator. The refrigerator is a nice convenience to store restaurant leftovers or stock up on drinks/snacks from the market around the corner. For the price we paid, this hotel was a great deal in an excellent location and we would definitely stay here again during our next trip to NYC.  
<Date>Mar 16, 2006

<Author>wimbrussel
<Content>Don't hesitate - go for the Belvedere We took advantage of the NY1 deal offered on the hotel's own website. A king bedded room with breakfast for two (otherwise $ 17 per person) came down to $209. For a double bedded room the same deal only cost $ 189. You won't find many better deals this central in New York City. Clean and quiet rooms, friendly staff, excellent buffet breakfast, three subway stations nearby. The surrounding streets are studded with good places to eat and for those who want to avoid high restaurant prices, there are excellent food halls on 8th Avenue. The only minor negative detail I can think of is the noisy air conditioning system in the room. We would definitley consider the Belvedere again for our next visit to New York.

The bedroom has a small kitchen area by the door, which is handy to make any snacks after coming back.There was a new restaurant linked to the hotel called the Churrascaria Plataforma, which was great as I鈥檝e always felt it was a pity the hotel had no bar before. The restaurant is definitely worth a visit, with a 鈥榚at as much as you can鈥?buffet and excellent food.During our stay they were re-polishing the lobby floor (which was not really an inconvenience as it was done during the night), but it meant that 2 of the 4 elevators were out of service for long periods of time, and we found ourselves waiting for long.I would definitely recommend the Belvedere to anyone visiting NYC, if only for its excellent location on 48th Street and 8th Avenue. <Author>Maxie123
<Content>Far exceeded my expectations! From arriving at the hotel a couple of hours earlier than expected to leaving six days later; the Belvedere Hotel exceeded it's expectations ten fold.I had chosen the hotel through the Trip Advisor recommendations and was not disappointed. My friend and I enjoyed a roomy, two bedded room complete with small kitchenette (microwave, coffee maker and fridge); t.v. with movies on demand; a lovely warm heater and a very tasteful bathroom complete with travel size goodies and hairdryer! The room was cleaned daily to a very good standard and was a welcome retreat at the end of a busy day. The hotel's location was unbeatable really in that it was minutes away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and all that has to offer, whilst being down a side street and away from the neon lights and heavy traffic. There were numerous restaurants of various nationalities within minutes walk (which was perhaps as well given the distance we covered during the day). The bin men / refuse collectors came every night though (although didn't stay long) and there was no cutlery available in the kitchen...but these were minor issues in comparison to the experiences of people who were being charged far more for their accommodation and were unhappy with the noise/cleanliness etc;I have already recommended the hotel to several of my friends and will no doubt continue to do so for some time to come!

<Author>NadineMelbourne

<Date>Feb 17, 2006
<Rating>4	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>brendaman
<Content>Good Location, Reasonable Price, Nice Rooms We stayed at the Belvedere from Feb. 9-14, 2006 and were very happy with the service, location and price. THE HOTEL. The Front Desk people were courteous and very helpful. We stayed in a double room on the 14th floor facing 48th street. It was relatively noisy as we often heard sirens, but it was nice to look out at part of Times Square. Perhaps rooms on the other side would have been quieter. As you enter the room, the little kitchenette area was first. It had cabinets, a dry sink, microwave and fridge. Others have written about the lack of any plates or silverware, but we did not mind since you could obtain these at the delis and convenience stores all over NYC. In fact, there were two on 8th Ave. between 48th and 49th streets. The bathroom was next to the kitchenette, and it was small, but most nice bargain hotels in NYC have such small bathrooms. Across from the bathroom was a closet with a safe/lockbox. The double room beds are double beds. We had been used to queen sized beds in double rooms, so at first we thought the beds were rather small, but they were fine. Queen sized beds would be too big for this room. The pictures of the room from the hotel website, as well as Expedia do look like what we had. The furniture was adequate and nice. My only complaint was that there was little room between the bed and the dresser, desk, etc. It was a squeeze to place the one chair in front of the desk. The second floor had the ice machine and fitness center. There were towels in the fitness center and other nice touches. We didn't have trouble with the elevators. There were two center elevators and one on each end of the hallway (although we only used the one of the end elevators, so we're not sure about the other end elevator). We didn't go to the cafe. There was a convenient sundries shop which closed around 9PM, but as I mentioned earlier, there were other convenience stores nearby.THE NEIGHBORHOOD. The hotel is located just a few blocks from the main action of Times Square on 48th St (towards the middle of the block between 8th and 9th Avenue). It is closer to the Hell's Kitchen neighborhood. We preferred to frequent 9th Avenue for restaurants, convenient stores, etc. as they were quieter and less expensive. The closest subway stop is on 49th and 8th avenue (C, E lines), but other lines were just a few blocks away and taking the subway one stop to 42nd St. provides one with access to many of the other lines. Checking out was a breeze. RESTAURANTS. We had breakfast at the Olympic Diner on 8th Ave. (between 48th and 49th) and by the 3rd time in, they would have my coffee on the table even before I took my coat off. There were many restaurants nearby which have received good ratings from Zagats (e.g. Thalia, Pigalle), but the nearby Mexican restaurant on 48th did not get such good ratings, albeit they do advertise two-for-one margaritas. We found a nice convenience/grocery store on 9th Ave called Amish (between 48th and 49th Ave?) which had great pastry, bakery, prepared food bar, fresh fruit, etc. They even had a few tables if you wanted to eat there. Of course, there is also the Food Emporium on 8th Ave. If you really must go to one of the eateries on Times Square, please stay away from the Fridays, Planet Hollywood, Olive Garden, etc. and opt for Ruby Foos, although be prepared not to have a quiet meal as the noise levels cab be rather high.We would stay at this hotel again.  
<Date>Feb 16, 2006
<Rating>4	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1

<Author>NuandMitch
<Content>Fantastic location - Great Hotel Just returned from a fantastic trip to New York (20-24 Jan) and chose The Belvedere from the reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. It is a fantastic location near everything you need without being too noisy. (It was louder over the Friday and Saturday night but that's what you expect from a city!!) Subway was close by and the Concierge was more than happy to help with directions until you get the hang of it!! We had a two double room which was much bigger than we expected, it was a little dated but for the price we paid for the stay did not expect any more. Personally we did not have a problem with the heating, size of the bathroom or the elevators. Also I managed to leave a whole load of clothes behind (teach me for not checking properly!!) the hotel were really helpful and took just a couple of days to have my items shipped back to me. We would recommend the Pigallen restaurent for breakfast, just around the corner from the hotel - we found this to be a huge breakfast at good value and really set you up for the day sight seeing. We would definitely stay at The Belvedere again, for value for money and location it would be diffiult to beat.

<Author>chorgan
<Content>Excellent!!! We stayed at the Belvedere Hotel for 5 nights from 22 Jan-27 Jan. This was my 2nd trip to NY in the past year. I previously stayed at the Comfort Inn on 35th st  there is absolutely no comparison between the 2 hotels. The Comfort Inn is shabby, old and the rooms are small, the hallways  carpet are dirty. My expectations were thus low after my experience in The Comfort Inn, but the Belvedere passed my high standards with flying colours. For a few dollars more than The Comfort Inn, The Belvedere offers clean, comfortable accommodation in an excellent location. We had a large room with 2 double beds (advertised on the website as a delux room). The beds were very comfortable, the room huge  the fridge and microwave an added bonus. There was excellent shower pressure  the bathroom was a decent size. I would highly recommend this hotel to other travellers who are looking for a comfortable stay while on holidays. The only minor complaint I did have was that the room was really hot as it was quite mild during our stay for the time of year, however we opened the window a crack  this solved the problem somewhat. The subway is close by  all major attractions are within walking distance. We did not eat at the hotel but there are plenty of diners within minutes walk of the hotel. I will be staying at the Belvedere again on my next visit to the Big Apple and I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

<Author>Grumpathome
<Content>Good Price in a good theatre location for a NYC Hotel - with a few concerns. We stayed at the Belvedere for 2 nights on Jan 27-29,2006. We go to NYC once or twice a year for theatre weekends and this was our first time at the Belvedere. The location to the theatres is great(we were within 4 blocks of the 3 theatres we were going to). You are a little way from all the action on Broadway and Times Square, but that was OK.Before I get more into the rooms, let me make one recommendation - request that your room be away from the elevators - very noisy - also the doors to the rooms are not soundproof, so if you want a quiet room you should be warned...you will hear hall noise.We had 2 rooms - my sister and a friend were meeting us in NY for the weekend, they were there for 3 nights. They had two double beds in a room across from the elevator on the eleventh floor. Their rooms had a major problem with the heat - it was like a sauna in there. There was no way to adjust the radiator, and the hotel staff were not able to fix it much(we don't know how hard they tried) so they had to run the airconditioning the whole time to try and cool it down some ( the radiator won...)  We had a king size bed which was comfortable. In both rooms, the bathrooms are tiny. You can barely shut the door when you get in there, also, the light switch is outside the door, so if you want to use the bathroom during the night, the light goes on before you can shut the door, so the person asleep in the bed gets bright lights in the eye ( I know from experience). Our radiator was not as bad as my sister's , but to keep it comfortable, we also had to run the air conditioner (seems like a waste of energy). The room also had a niche with a refridgerator, microwave and coffee maker and some cupboard space - we did not use this area at all - but it could have been useful (I would rather have a larger bathroom and the fridge etc., free standing somewhere else in the room. We requested extra pillows and towels, but because we had left for the theatre and were not in the room, they did not leave them, and by the time we got back, it was too late to wait up for them (a note and a tip got them the next day when they cleaned the room) By European standards, the room is large, by American, it is average, with smaller bathroom than we usually find.Overall, for the price, We paid $175 plus taxes - total about $204 a night, we would stay here again - it is cheap for NYC and we were so on the go, we didn't spend much time there. For the difference in price from some of the other hotels, we've stayed at, we can afford another theatre ticket or dinner out. We probably won't stay here when we come in September for the US Open Tennis - we would rather be closer to Times Square Metro stop for ease in getting to Flushing Meadows and the Open.We did not use the restaurant, but the concierge was helpful with 2 reservations for dinner- one suggestion was OK, the other an Italian - Amorone Ristorante at 686 9th and 46th(?), was excellent - try the Scalloppine al Gorgonzola - yum.It is a brisk 20 or so minute walk to the south end of Cental Park. For great choices in Musicals, must sees are Wicked, Dirty Rotten Scoundrels, Spamalot, Avenue Q (not for kids). Enjoy the Big Apple!  
<Date>Jan 30, 2006
<Rating>3	4	2	-1	4	-1	2	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Affordable option near theaters Stayed here two nights last week. I agree with just about everyone's reviews here. The Belvedere is a terrific affordable option in the city. It is not luxurious, but it is a perfectly acceptable clean efficiently run place to stay, not completely devoid of atmosphere, especially if you are going to see some shows. Pros: Good location, close to subways. Reasonable rates (we paid $375 incl. taxes for 2 nights with 24 hours of internet and one in room movie). Self park is $27, recommend this over valet ($39), as it is around the block, very close. Comfortable bedding, didn't hear a lot of noise, small kitchen area would come in handy for longer stays. Polite staff.Cons: Hot hot room, dry dry air. We turned the AC on low and this took care of it. Maybe if the weather had been seasonably cold (it was quite warm), this wouldn't have been as much of an issue.We also enjoyed Olympic Diner for breakfast, we also had good appetizers and 2 for 1 margaritas at Sombrero, right next door.  
<Date>Jan 29, 2006

<Author>royroyroy
<Content>Good budget choice for theater district I spent three nights this week on the tenth floor for $170/night incl. tax. Internet access was $10 extra. Most of the discount websites seem to offer space here like Hotels and even JetBlue.Plusses: Good value. Walking distance to all the shows- spent a nice evening at The Producers and walked six short blocks home. Refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave in the room. Reasonably large rooms. Windows that open for fresh air. Friendly efficient staff. Relatively quiet location accross from PS17 on a side street.Minuses: Slightly outdated from the lobby to the room furnishings. Medium grade sound-proofing- lost sleep the last night because of post-midnight partying in room next door. Minimal in-hotel dining opitons, but who cares- plenty of places right outside the door. Some rooms rented long-term and these guest are allowed pets- didn't bother me but might be a problem if you have allergies.

<Author>Whoami91
<Content>Great location; great hotel I stayed at the Belvedere from Jan 13-17; Been to NYC many times, but it was the first time I actually stayed in the city. I've usually stayed in Jersey and commuted, but this hotel has changed my future plans. The hotel is centrally located; close to subway, Time Square, Rockerfeller, and plenty of restaurants. The staff was very helpful everytime we needed them. The room was large enough for a party of four. It had plenty of drawers to store the clothes, closet was big and had a safe, and the little kitchenette was a plus. The bathroom is a bit small, but large enough for what you need it. The room was clean and nicely decorated. We stayed on the 11th floor. There was your usual noise from the sirens (from fire station down the street), but nothing that would stop you from sleeping. The elevators were slow at times but nothing unbearable. We never ate at the hotel; always ate out; there were plenty of restaurants nearby. You have Starbuck's on the corner for a quick coffee and a small grocery store on the corner of 8th Ave. Getting to/from Laguardia Airport was easy, only a 20 min @ night and 35 during the afternoon. We used the same driver for both trips (get their phone number and they will arrange to pick you up). I recommend this hotel to anyone. This should be a four-star hotel; it has an excellent location. The area is very safe; was not afraid to walk alone with my son at nights.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fantastic Hotel!!! I stayed at The Belvedere Hotel for five nights in Nov 2005 with my Mum and had a wonderful time. The room was very spacious with two double beds, a fridge, coffee maker and microwave. The safe in the room was also very useful and easy to use. The rooms were cleaned every day and fresh linen / towels put out. We had a room on the 17th floor and experienced no problems whatsoever with the lifts - I think the longest we had to wait was approx 5 minutes on one occasion! The staff were extremely friendly and helpful - the porters booked us a taxi to the airport on our return and kept our bags for us after we had checked out - our flight wasn't until 8.30pm. We never ate in the hotel but there are hundreds of restaurants and cafes nearby - New York breakfasts are the best! In all we had a fantastic experience in New York and the Belvedere Hotel helped make it so! I would definitely go back there.

<Author>JournoEngland
<Content>Wonder hotel and location We stayed here while on our honeymoon and it was wonderful. From check-in (when we arrived early) to check-out it was great.The staff are very friendly and helpful, even offering to photocopy our passports in case we got asked for ID. We then put them and our money in the safe deposit box (which could be accessed until 11pm).Our room was a good size (apparently unusual in NYC) with a kitchenette complete with fridge and microwave. It overlooked the street but was still quiet at night - despite being only two blocks away from Times Square and Broadway and one block away from a fire station.The bathroom had a washing line to dry clothes - but it was easier to use the laundrette in the basement.The gym (if you like the kinda thing) was well stocked and there was a shop, good vending machines and a working ice machine (a rarity in hotel I've found).The location was excellent - 15 mins walk from Central Park, right on Times Square and five mins from nearest subway.We will definitely we staying here when we return to New York.

<Author>Pippanda
<Content>Great Hotel! We stayed here for 5 nights in late November. Having never been to New York before we didn't know what to expect but the hotel was nice, very clean and the rooms very large. We arrived 1 hour before check in and the bell hop took our bags for us and the check in desk told us to come back in 45 minutes. We duly did that and were checked in straight away. We stayed on a room only basis but paid for breakfast one morning. I had the cheaper breakfast which didn't include bacon, eggs etc, which was ok but at $10 it was a very expensive bowl of Porridge (Oatmeal) (I have food intolerances and couldn't eat anything else!) - Hubbie had the more expensive breakfast at $15 and stuffed himself silly! We only ate here on the first morning as we didn't want to wander round for ages looking for somewhere to eat, which wasn't a problem as we found a great diner around the corner run and owned by a real miserable looking Greek family but the food was good! The concierge desk were very helpful and recommended and booked us into restaurants and gave us great directions and maps. Also helped us book a taxi back to JFK for our return flight. We were warned by other Tripadvisor members not to take a room next to the lifts. Our room was next to the lifts and we decided to give it one night and see if there was lots of noise but we never heard any noise from them at all.A group who were staying in the room next door to us were extremely noisy one night which we put up with for a little while but they were still shouting and screaming at 430-500am. I telephoned the night porter and complained and we never heard another noise from them.All in a great hotel in a good location near to Times Square and Restaurant Row if your a first timer to NY.  
<Date>Jan 4, 2006
<Rating>4	4	4	-1	5	-1	4	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great NY Hotel The Belvedere is a great find. We've been to NY many times for both business and pleasure and have always stayed in bigger name establishments with higher price tags. The Belvedere more than holds its own against any of them. The rooms are extremely clean, comfortable and attractively decorated. The bathrooms are a bit small, but not a significant problem in our estimation. Cleanliness and plenty of hot water are our benchmarks on that level and they pass with flying colors on both. The hotel's location is extremely convenient, particularly if a Broadway show is part of your itinerary. It is close to Times Square and some really terrific dining. The staff is pleasant and efficient and we are looking forward to our next visit.

<Author>MissCrankyPants
<Content>A great place to stay. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful for the duration of our stay. They are able to cash $100 worth of travellers cheques per room per day. The concierge staff were amazing. They helped with subway directions, got us Broadway tickets and were always a pleasure to deal with.We had heard that hotel rooms are very small in NYC but found our room very clean and comfortable. We never once heard noise from other rooms during the five nights we were there and always felt very safe and secure.This hotel is very central! We were able to walk almost everywhere we wanted to go. There is a subway station very close by and door staff are readily available to get you a cab.My only (incredibly minor) complaint about this hotel is about the shampoo supplied in the bathroom. It wasn't the best and I'd suggest you bring your own.Would I stay at The Belvedere again? Definitely.

<Author>BearTripper
<Content>10th Time Not the Charm We stayed at the Belvedere for our 10th visit (and, concincidentally, our 10th anniversary visit) from 12/27/05 to 12/29/05. This visit signals our last visit to the Belvedere. Yes, it is in a great location and yes, it is value-priced for the area in mid-town Manhattan. However, a continuing decline in the level of service and a continuing decline of the upkeep can no longer be ignored. The system was down during our entire visit (except to check out and take our money), and as a result, the following problems occurred: our room, which had a chorus of water in the pipes that chimed every half-hour, along with a bath that went from too hot to too scalding added with somewhat tattered bed linens and a hair dryer that worked if you jiggled the button, all could not be taken care of. We could not get our room changed for 27(!) hours because the system was down. In addition, the front desk manager was consistently rude when we voiced our complaints to him, saying we could speak to the manager but that we were looking at him and nothing was going to be done while the 'system was down. While we have enjoyed staying at the Belvedere in the past, since this is the fourth incident in the last four tries at staying here, it is no longer possible to ignore the slowly decaying service and declining upkeep.Unfortunately, the 10th visit was not the charm, and we can no longer endorse to our friends, neighbors, or co-workers the Belvedere any longer.  
<Date>Dec 31, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member

<Rating>5	3	5	-1	4	-1	4	-1	

<Author>blecount
<Content>Never Again I have stayed at this hotel every time I've been in New York for the past 5 years. However, the last four times I've been there, I have encountered problems. After this year's problems I will be seeking out a new hotel in New York City. Let me start with four visits ago, when the registration desk scanned my credit card twice and thus charged me twice for my room. Of course, I did not know this happened until I received my credit card statement, at which time it was up to me to prove that I had not stayed there twice as long as I had. The next visit, my registration was lost. I had booked on a leading travel site and was told by the hotel that they do not recognize bookings from that site, nonetheless they found a room for me. On the next visit, one day before my arrival, I was called by the hotel and was informed that due to a computer error the hotel had been overbooked and that they had made arrangements for me to stay elsewhere. Even though I had booked the room directly with them upon leaving on my last stay some four months earlier. I was forced to contact the district manager of the hotel and the matter was resolved, but I was told that regardless of how far in advance I had booked, my reservation was not a priority since I was merely staying a weekend, and that priority was given to people staying the entire week, regardless when they booked. The experience this past week finally forced me to inform management that I would not be returning. We arrived in NYC at 1:00 pm, before the 4:00 pm check-in time. At which time we were told that their computer systems were not working and that they should be working by the 4:00 pm check-in time. We explored the city, and returned at 4:00 pm to a mob inside the lobby, and was informed that the computer system was still down and that they would have to book our rooms manually. We received our room, only to find that there was no cold water and that the showers were dangerously scalding hot, and that the courtesy hair dryer was non-functional. But that night there was no sleep to be had. It seemed the heating pipes had moisture in them and as a result were banging around as if someone was hammering them all night long. We called the front desk and asked for another, more quiet room. We were informed that the banging was a typical problem in old NYC buildings, but that they could not move us to a more quiet room because the system was still down, and that the morning crew at 9AM would find us another room. I asked if engineering could do something, but was told that there was no engineering night-shift. At 9AM, after an entire night of no sleep, we asked for another room, and were again told that we could not receive another room because the system was still down. We returned at 1PM and were told the same thing, and returned again at 4PM and were told the same thing, quite rudely from the manager who acted as if their incompetence was my fault. We were finally moved to another room at approximately 5PM. Apparently, the fact that the computer systems were down had brought this entire hotel to a stand-still. It was clear that they had no contingency plan for such a problem. Moreover, it was unacceptable that in NYC, the greatest city in the world, where certainly there are network engineers in nearly every building, it took 48 hours to get their computer systems operational. Amazingly, the system worked fine when it came time to bill me upon check-out. This was one of the best hotels in NYC, but in recent years it has steadily gone down hill, needless to say I will not be returning.  
<Date>Dec 29, 2005

<Author>lovetolearn
<Content>Good value We stayed at the Belvedere Dec. 17th-21st. This was our third time to NYC, but our first at the Belvedere. I'll start by saying this was our 2nd Christmas time visit in a row. Last year we stayed at the Sheraton Hotel and Towers. It's nice, the bed is great, but that's about it. I started pricing hotels in July and reading reviews. Time after time the Belvedere's reviews have been good to great and we weren't disappointed. It's an excellent value for the room size. The bathroom is extremely small, but very well kept (no mildew on the tiles, clean floor, etc...), the bed was way to firm for our liking (like sleeping on the floor), but the room size is great, very clean, enough drawer and closet space. One small thing to mention about housekeeping. If you want your beds made and towels replenished, you have to stick the little privacy hanger turned over to please clean room side on the outside of the door. And yes, our room was kept very clean, but one day when we came back, and sitting on the night stand was a fruit roll up wrapper. It wasn't ours. I guess housekeeping had a snack and didn't clean up after herself. As mentioned in other reviews the little frig. and sink area is nice also. This is an older hotel set back from Times Square. It is very close to everything, but you don't get as much of the noise factor. We have also stayed at the Crowne Plaza on Times Square and unless it's below $100 would never stay there again. Noise at every hour and not a very good hotel. The front desk at the Belvedere was very helpful. We arrived very early the first morning and the room wasn't ready, but they locked our luggage up and off we went to have fun. We did eat at the Olympic Cafe around the corner every morning for breakfast. Pricing is just right and the food was descent. Some tips for first time visitors: Buy a how to do New York book New York for Dummies is a good one, but there are several to choose from. Don't be afraid to take the subway. The first time we were there the front desk at the Crowne Plaza tried to talk us out of it and instead take the big red double decker tour bus. We figured she was on commission since the prices were sky high. Took our chances and rode the subway and were so happy we did. It's a very inexpensive means of transportation, safe, some cars cleaner than others, and it's part of enjoying the way the city gets around. Wear comfortable shoes and explore, you'll find so many cool shops. Avoid China Town on the weekends. Jam packed!!! Mondays and Tuesdays are great. As far as restuarants, there are so many to choose from. That's where the how to books come in handy and read the forums posted on this site. One of our favorites is Hell's Kitchen off 9th and 46th or 47th. Very close to the Belvedere. It's a smaller restaurant, excellent service, great food, great drinks, and nice atmosphere. It is a little expensive, but SOOOOO worth it. Call ahead for reservations. Overall we would stay at the Belvedere again unless I could find a better deal somewhere else at a hotel I'm familiar with.  
<Date>Dec 23, 2005
<Rating>4	5	4	-1	5	-1	4	-1

<Author>toela
<Content>Great Hotel Stayed at the Belevedere Hotel Nov 9, 10, 11,12,2005. We had an early morning flight so we arrived at the hotel at 10:30 am. and were very pleased that both our rooms were ready, and we could check in that early. We booked through valuhotels.com and there were no problems checking in, with our prepaid reservations. The lobby is very nice and the staff were so friendly. The rooms are very large and clean, and have a great kitchenette, with fridge coffee maker etc. This was really nice to allow us to have a quick muffin and coffee before heading out into the city. The location is perfect, within walking distance to everything. We had two rooms, one on each side of the hotel. Our room was at the rear, so it was alittle quieter, You could hear the traffic noise alittle more in the room at the front of the hotel, but the view was worth it. We were on the 12th floor. As mentioned in other reviews, the elevators can be a bit slow, and because its an older hotel,the elevators are quite small. But this is a small inconvience and only happens a few times at peak hours, and certainly would not prevent me from happily coming back to stay here again.We flew into New Wark, and got a mini van cab that cost us $60.00 including tolls and tip, with 5 people.When we were planning our trip back to the airport, we asked at the hotel if we could book another mini van cab, the hotel quoted us $130.00. We went outside and flagged down the first mini van cab we saw, and asked him to come pick us up at the hotel in 3 hours to take us to the airport, we agreed on $80.00 including tolls and tip. He was waiting in front of the hotel, 15 min. early, to take us to the airport, and he was a really nice guy to boot. So grab the cab - yourself! New York is an awesome city, two of the highlights from our trip was the xmas spectacular rockettes show, and we took a subway to Brooklyn, and walk the Brooklyn Bridge back. Go to New York and stay at the Belevedere Hotel.  
<Date>Dec 17, 2005

Finally, the bathroom was clean and reasonably sized.So what more do you want? Stay at the Belvedere as soon as you can!

<Author>bwco
<Content>Great Service, Value, Location, Great Hotel My fiance and I stayed there one night over the weekend. We have nothing but praise for the hotel. The employees go out of their way to help their guests. We got in at about 11 am and asked if we could have them store our bags until the 4 pm check in time. Instead, they let us check in early. We put our bags in our room (14th floor) and we went spent the rest of the day Christmas shopping and playing tourist. The concierge was very helpful when it came time to recommeding restaraunts.The hotel's location is great. As my fiance put it, we could have paid at least $200 more in a hotel right on Times Square, or stayed here and put that money towards a show; which we did. The hotel is only about a 5 minute walk from Times Square. There is also a subway station about two blocks away from the hotel. During the Christmas season, it is easier to get around Manhattan by subway than it is by taxi. The room was clean and modern. It had a refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker and two tvs. The closets could have been a little bigger and we could see where someone might have a problem storing clothes if they were staying there for an extended period of time.The elevators were a little slow, as some of the other reviews have mentioned. One trick is to go to the east or west end of the main corridor and use those elevators.For breakfast we walked around the corner and grabbed some bagels from the local deli. There are a lot of restaraunts in the blocks around the hotel,(including the omnipresent Starbucks) One thing that we did hear were sirens from fire trucks, ambluances, police cars, etc. The hotel is situated between two major north south streets in New York. What makes the location convienent for the guests also makes it covienient for the Emergency Services to travel from one part of the city to another, especially with a fire station nearby. However we did not hear any sirens after midnight.Would we stay here again, definitely. As we were leaving, one of the bellmen wished us a Merry Christmas and said that he hoped that he would see us next year. We told him we could not wait to come back.

<Author>Jadeyc
<Content>Value for Money I recently stayed here for 4 nights. The rooms were spacious, clean, and air conditioned with facilities such as an iron and ironing board, fridge, microwave and coffee maker - no kettle though to make tea!The only problem we had was the room we had booked was not available on our 1st night, so we had to check out the next day at 12 noon, with our correct room not being available until 4pm. This was a little inconvenient and the staff werent particulaly helpful about this. However, at all other times we found the staff to be pleasant, polite and helpful.The hotel is just off Broadway and about a 5 minute walk from Times Square. 9th Avenue is a 2 minute walk away and here you can find some good resteraunts that are reasonably priced. I would definatley recommend Pygalls for breakfast!As for the elevators, the 2 main reception ones were always busy. However at the end of each corridor is another elevator, we found these were always free and it was an extra 10 second walk from the main elevators!  
<Date>Nov 25, 2005
<Rating>4	5	3	-1	3	-1	2	-1	

<Author>Ferdinand
<Content>Cant go Wrong We stayed here at the end of a 2 month trip around the states. What a farewell. Really friendly downstairs staff, doormen and reception. Lovely room, big and clean. Walls a bit thin so you can hear a bit in other rooms but if people are too loud you can always complain to reception i guess. Lovely new fitness room open as well. Great location and safe. Top value. We were a bit miffed with the advice the concierge gave us re getting to Newark airport. They take a cut so book your own and pay cash in the van with your discount voucher. Also she put us off using the train to the airport by telling us it took an hour. That was silly and we were a bit annoyed about that. But concierge apart, a brilliant hotel and one you will love in New York.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Love the Belvedere - will be my first choice anytime I have stayed at the Belvedere several times....... well that says it all really. I'm very fussy about anywhere that I have to stay.I found myself in a predicament and the staff were really helpful.I'm not sure of the actual rating of the hotel as it differs depending on what site you look for it on, however I feel it is way above the ratings that I have seen it for ie 2 and 3 star.I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay close to the action, but not actually be in it. It is very central and is easy access to any part of New York. I also like the fact that it is close to the Port Authority Bus terminal where you can catch the bus to New Jersey for even more bargains if you are a shopoholic like myself. <Author>kristine61
<Content>Would definitly recommend! My mom and I recently spent 7 nights at the Belvedere and would definitly recommend it. The room was a good size with 2 double beds and included microwave, small fridge and coffee maker. We stocked up on fruit, yogurt and water at the corner store and enjoyed breakfast before we started out most mornings. The Belvedere is within a very short walk to theatres, Time Square and 2 Subway lines. The staff was friendly and helpful. The concierge was extremely helpful with subway directions etc. It is hard to get an elevator in the morning as everyone seems to go out at once. We had asked for a lower room and received one on the 5th floor so it was an easy walk down to the lobby in the morning. We bought a 7 day Subway ticket and it was the best and fastest way to get around - just get to know your uptown from your downtown. Hilights for us were the Abysinnian Church in Harlem for Sunday service (get there early to line up and dress warmly), Brooklyn Bridge, Carnegie Hall tour, Grand Central Terminal, Central Park, Metropolitan Museum and the archetecture in Soho. Enjoy!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Excellent Value My husband, teenage daugher and I stayed four nights at the Belvedere in early October. We mainly chose it for the value and location. Finding a hotel room with a microwave and refrig was great. There was a small grocery store nearby so we stocked up on bottled water, fruit and breakfast-friendly snacks. Location was pretty good -- I was not at all concerned for my daughter and I to go out walking alone. Subway entrances were close enough; Time Square and the Theaters were within walking distance. Fifth Avenue, Rockefeller Center and plenty of shooping were within walking distance. We only took a taxi once our entire trip. I also recommend Becco's -- an Italian restaurant on Warehouse Row (also walking distance). There are no prices listed for wine bottles, they are all $20/bottle. My husband had steak, my daughter had seafood and I had the pasta. They were all excellent.It is an older hotel but the staff were nice and it was clean, although the rooms were small. (Elevators were slow!) I would definitely stay there again.

<Author>dlab719
<Content>Excellent Experience for 2 New Orleanians My husband and I stayed at the Belvedere Oct. 24 to Oct. 29. We can't say enough good things about it. Our experience was fantastic. We flew in from New Orleans and our flight was delayed. We were staying one night in a hotel by JFK and then going to travel to the Belvedere since the hurricane caused us to reconstuct our travel itinerary. Well, we ended up arriving in NY at 4am. We cancelled our one night stay near the airport and went directly to the Belvedere. Got there around 6am... tired and delirious. The front desk helped us out so much, getting us in our room much earlier than the 4pm check-in, realizing that we would need some rest! Our room was more spacious than I had imagined for a NY hotel. The bathroom was not as small as I imagined either. It wasn't the most spacious, but it was just fine for our intended use. There could be a little more space to set your toiletries, but not a big deal at all. We found all of the staff to be most helpful. Really nice bellman helped us when we arrived and held our bags. The elevators were not as bad as I anticipated after reading some of the reviews. We never waited more than a minute or so. The location is perfect. Very close to Restaurant Row and Times Square. We felt extremely safe there. This was our first trip to NY and we had an excellent time. We will have great memories of our trip and the hotel played a big part in that. Oh... and our airline gave us both free round trip tickets for the inconvenience on the flight in, so we're going back! We are definitely staying at the Belvedere!! I will recommend it to everyone.

<Rating>5	5	4	-1	4	-1	5	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Hotel Stayed in the Belvdere from 22nd October to 28th October inclusive. Like most people I booked it based on the reviews on trip advisor. It was fantastic. The rooms are lovely and very comfortable (personally I liked the firm bed!). Yes the bathroom is smallish but what do you want to do in it!!. The coffee maker and microwave were a real bonus. It is lovely to be able to have a nice cup of coffee either in the morning or when you come back in the evening. We were always left two or three sachets of coffee. Despite intending to make use of microwave due to the enormous variety of eateries in the locality we didn't!! The staff are efficient and helpful. I changed a travellers cheque every morning no problem (I think we were there at a very good time of the year. The hotel was busy but not overly so). We had no problem with the lifts but as we were only on the eight floor we used the stairs when going out and the lift when we came in. The hairdryer wasn't working and within five minutes of a phonecall to reception a new one was delivered. The location of this hotel is superb with Times Square only a couple of blocks away and theatres and restaurants within walking distance. We went to see The Phantom of the Opera which was marvellous. We got the tickets at the ticket booth in Times Square for 50 dollars each. It's worth going to for the special effects alone. Use the subway. It's the only way to get around. It is 2 dollars for any journey and there are different tickets you can get for a certain amount of days. We got a weekly ticket that costs twenty one dollars (per person) and used it all the time. If you are going to be there on a Sunday try and fit in a trip to Harlem. There are many you can book and it is a great experience. We spent a full day in Central Park and it is really lovely to walk around it. It's an oasis in the middle of the city. A visit to the Metropolitan Museum is another good day out but it can be very busy and it's not easy to get a coffee or whatever in it so be sure to bring water with you. The area around Pier 17 is very nice with lovely shops and restaurants. It is also close to Battery Park where the ferries to Liberty and Ellis Island leave from. We spent another day there and it was a wonderful experience. Anyway, back to the hotel. I can highly recommend it and it is excellent value for money. You couldn't be any closer to Times Square, Broadway etc. Yes there can be noise at night from the fire station at the top of the road but who does'nt hear noise from fire engines and police cars at night if they live in any city? When in New York go with the flow. The pace of life is mad and everyone seems to be running around the place but you'll be on your holidays and don't have to run with them! Try and let people know that you are on holidays. There are so many different nationalities living in New York the people in shops, restaurants and bars do not know automatically that you're a tourist. We generally found most people very friendly - talk to them and they'll talk back to you. New York is full of people looking at maps and it's the same on the subway. We found that on a number of occasions strangers stopped and asked if they could help us and this also happened on the subway. Don't be nervous just go and enjoy!!  
<Date>Nov 8, 2005
<Rating>5	5	5	-1	5	-1	5	-1

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Good location, poor hotel. The only reason stopping me from giving this hotel 1 star was that the service was excellent when we arrived, the guy took our suitcases and within 5 minutes we were checked in. The room however was very, very basic, it was a room for three people but there were only two cups, there were plates for food but no knives or forks, the room we stayed in was very dark and dull, even with all the lights on it was dull. We had to go to reception twice because the toilet overflowed. The bathroom was very small, the kitchen area would only fit one person at a time. The hotel is pretty close to Times Square but the view from the hotel room was terrible. Also, the taxi drivers had no idea where this hotel was and if you didn't have you room card handy to show them you were screwed.It is beyond me how anyone could give this hotel more than two stars.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Comfortable facility; great location Just returned from a 6-night stay at the Belvedere.The experience was totally satisfactory. Every staff member we encountered was friendly, courteous, and helpful. The room was clean, comfortable, quiet, well-equipped (hair dryer, cable TV, refigerator, microwave, safe, internet connection) and relatively large by New York standards. The bed was very comfortable. The elevators are a bit small, but we had no problems with them during our entire stay. The location on 48th street between 8th and 9th avenues is superb - relatively quiet neighborhood; easy walking distances to theaters, subway station, Times Square, and numerous restaurants. We have stayed in several NY hotels and would rate the Belvedere as the best overall value. We plan to return.

<Author>splash's_pal
<Content>Belvedere is a real jewel The Belvedere is a real value. We stayed there this past January (2005) -- and got stranded in the Blizzard of 2005! In spite of the weather, we really enjoyed our stay. The rooms are very clean -- and reasonably spacious (considering it is mid-town Manhatten)! The hotel staff is friendly -- and they were very accomodating helping us deal with the snow storm -- including extending our stay for one additional night at the same rate. They were also helpful in recommending some of the good restaurants in the area and advising us on using the subway system. Be sure to use your AAA card -- it will help with the rate.

<Author>susanderek
<Content>Just back Just back from 4th trip to NY. Stayed here with sister. Very impressed - have stayed in more expensive hotels, but this had by far the best view - ask for a high room. No probs with lifts despite 12th floor. Very clean, and fridge was a boon in unseasonably hot weather. Room very big by local standards. Bathroom typical of city, but who spends time there when there's the city to see?! No probs with hot water supply as two females soaking off the after effects of much walking and shopping can testify. Did not try in-house cafe, as favourite Celebrity deli just a few blocks down 8th Ave.Front desk staff v. pleasant, and offered to fix airport transfer (c$20), but we used the Airtrain to JFK instead. (Hotel 2 blocks from 50th St subway and E line to meet Airtrain at Jamaica Station - faster and far cheaper transportation comp. to any other method used in past.)Great central location, but in a tree lined side street it seemed relatively peaceful.Will be back - and most probably here...

<Author>Raymond01
<Content>Clean and well located hotel. My wife and I stayed at the Belvedere for 5 nights in August, 2005. We had not been to New York or the USA before.Given the room rate, we did not expect a great deal but were pleasantly surprised. The bedroom was immaculately clean as was the bathroom. Compared to later accommodation in Paris, it was palatial. The staff were generally very helpful.It was a bonus having a small kitchen with cooking facilities but somewhat inconsistent that there was no cutlery or crockery. We were pleased that it had a fridge and tea and coffee making facilities. The bathroom did not have adequate storage but we managed.We were close to Broadway and attended two stage shows. It was also well located in relation to accessing public transport and cafes and restaurants. There is a laundromat in the same block which was a big plus for us. We had great views of NYC and despite being on the front of the hotel, it was very quite. We felt very secure walking the streets late at night.We would stay at the Belvedere again and recommend it to friends or acquaintances who may visit New York.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Belvedere..service "just ok", location "10+" Arrived early, 10am, asked for early check-in, total indifference by staff, finally checked in almost by 4pm, a number of disgruntled people in the lobby waiting for rooms, overheard lots of complaining. When I left, I was allowed late checkout at 1pm (usually noon). I was less upset about their inability to check us in early as I was how unfriendly the staff were. And I found this consistent over the 5 days I was there. I've been to NYC numerous times, usually stay at Hotel Penn which was cheap, cheap, cheap, dirty, dirty, dirty, but very friendly and great service for such a huge hotel. I had a mouse in my room last visit so I decided to change hotels and try something new. Belvedere is very convenient to Broadway. I was able to walk to every play (and I saw 6) and never had to take a cab except when I went to the village. The breakfast was good. Three young women working the breakfast buffet stood talking to each other, unfriendly like we were intruding (10:45am and the buffet closed at 11:00am but still, there were only 2 other customers and we weren't able to check in....). The rooms were clean, nothing special, one chair in my room, no desk. It was very humid and hot while I was there, even in October. The window a/c worked very well. Toilet very small, hot water not consistent. My rates were not great. I would stay there again but none in my party of 4 had anything glowing to say about it except how conventient to the theaters. Oh, and cabs were very easy to grab here, more so that other hotels I've stayed at. TIP! for Broadway lovers, check out Jim Caruso's Cast Party at Birdland Monday Nights, I've been twice and it's the best. It's on 44th, just 4 blocks away.

<Author>Danny Boy 123
<Content>Belvedere hotel - a great stay Stayed at the Belvedere for 5 nights in September 2005. The hotel is in a great location only a 5 minute walk from Times Square, and from our 8th floor room we did not hear passing traffic. The hotel is additionally situated near the grey line bus tour stops for all 3 tours (downtown tour, uptown tour and the highly recommended night tour).Don't eat breakfast at the hotel, take a 1 minute walk to 8th Avenue where there is a good diner called the Olympic, since you will save well over 50%. The lifts are a little on the slow side, so we took to only getting the lift up, and walking down. The hotel concierge was extremely courteous and helpful. The air conditioning was great, if a little noisy. The kitchenette area had a coffee maker, fridge and microwave which did come in useful.Overall a great stay. If returning to NYC, I would stay in the Belvedere.

<Author>feoffe
<Content>Fantastic Hotel!!! I stayed at the Belvedere for 7 nights in late September. We arrived at the hotel before midday and the staff still checked us in and offered us a room although check-in is not until 3pm! The staff were more than helpful for the whole of the week that we were there. The bellboys were extremely friendly and nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff, it seemed. The rooms are fairly spacious and incredibly comfortable, and are equipped with everything you need for your stay. Maids clean the rooms daily, which is a real bonus. Most importantly, the location is wonderful - within walking distance to all of the main attractions, yet in a quiet enough area such that noise was not a problem! I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit New York! It really cannot be faulted!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved New York and the Belvedere Hotel Belvedere West 48th Street New York Great Location and HotelMy husband myself and 19 year old son all stayed at the Belvedere for 5 nights from the 13th September 2005. We chose this hotel because of the really favourable reviews always on trip advisor. Because there was 3 adults going on the trip we had to keep the cost reasonable and were not disappointed with the Belvedere. We arrived early at 1.45 lunchtime but had no problems checking in straight away. We were given a room on the 7th floor at the front of the hotel and our bags were brought up to our room within a couple of minutes. The room was plenty big enough for 3 adults, 2 queen sized beds, and my son is 6ft1in,tv etc.There is a really good little kitchenette with a micro,fridge sink and a coffee maker.They will leave you ground coffee sugar etc every day if you use the machine.You just need to buy milk from the deli(and coronas) for the fridge.The room was very clean and tidy and well kept. The hotel furnishings are in keeping with an older hotel, no mimilist here,but its great.The bathroom is very small but has a good shower,hairdrier and always plenty of clean towels.The wardrobe was not very big though,but plenty of drawers.The Belvedere is in a great location only a couple of minutes to Time Square, Theatres and restaurants.Just round the corner on 48th street is known as Restaurant Row with every sort of eating you can think of (Broadway Joes Steakhouse great)We had an amazing time in New York walked millions of miles will be returning as soon as I can and will be staying at the Belvedere again.ps the hotel breakfast is good for the first morning but then walk left out of the hotel to 7th avenue (only a couple of minutes) turn left on 7th avenue after about 50 yards on the left is the Olympic Diner.Had breakfast every morning there brilliant!!,New York PD have theirs has well. Have a great time!!!!  
<Date>Oct 3, 2005
<Rating>4	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>regalaone
<Content>Good hotel, well located I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights early Sept. I was traveling with a friend, we were in NYC for a wedding. I searched a long time to find a hotel with good reviews that I could book at that time of year for under $200/night. I was lucky enough to find such a rate for this hotel on Hotels. I've been to NYC many times, but usually stay with friends. I was very pleased with this hotel. It's very well located near all the subways you'll need and just walk to 8th ave. to catch a cab uptown or 7th to go downtown. Many restaurants nearby and the concierge was EXTREMELY helpful in both recommending reasonable restaurants nearby as well as giving any kind of info. needed. The room, while somewhat small, was certainly roomy enough, and probably larger than many NYC or european hotels. The bathroom was big enough and the fact that a frig and microwave are there is also a big plus. Our room was on the street and yet noise really wasn't a problem. All in all you could do LOTS worse and pay much more $$$$. Highly recommended for location, knowledgeable staff, and cleaniness of rooms.

They obviously could have cared less about getting my business so I won't give it to them again! When I went into my room I discovered that it was a double even though I had very clearly booked a room with one bed. I was looking forward to having the extra space and perhaps a desk and chair (I rarely travel alone and wnated to relish the experience...!). When I went down to tell them I really didn't need, or want, two beds the manager told me there were no rooms with one bed available (even though I had just booked such a room a half hour before by phone). He sighed as if this was all a very big deal to him and finally said okay, there is another room you can have. When I went up to check it out, it was right next to the elevator. I definitely got the feeling he was punishing me for being a pest by giving me this room! I decided to stay in my original room with two beds because it was at least in a quiet spot. When I told him this it all prompted more eye rolling and sighs on his part. I am really not a difficult person! When hotel staff makes you feel this way there is a definite customer service issue here....I even asked this manager how he could be so rude to people - and said how do you know I am not a hotel reviewer? (!!)... I have never been treated this way at a hotel - or any place, for that matter! So - then later that night I came back to the room hoping to watch David Letterman. I discovered the cable wasn't working and I couldn't get that channel! Called housekeeping and eventually someone came up, tried to fix it unscussessfuly and told me I should just watch the channel that worked! When I told them I really kind of wanted to watch other channels (imagine!) the guy reluctantly agreed to deliver another t.v. (but was clearly annoyed with me) An hour later I finally got another one. Well, this one didn't work either (as it was clearly a cable problem) By now it was 1:00 in the morning and I gave up. But I have to admit the room was big, somewhat clean (there were some Cheerios on the floor from the previous guests - hmm......) and quiet. Unfortunately I will not return as the surliness of the staff (both front desk and housekeeping) is quite hard to stomache. It really put a damper on my NY stay.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fantastic and highly recommended A friend and myself stayed at the Belvedere for 6 nights in September 2005. It was a fantastic hotel, we had a great room, perfect size with the luxury of a double bed each. Big TV and lots of storage space for all the shopping! The room was cleaned every day, we didnt even have to request it, it was done automatically which was great to come back to.All the staff were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them. The concierge was brilliant, she helped us booked a harbour cruise, answered all the questions we had and also assisted us with the booking of the shuttle to the airport which was only $23, a real bargain. The bell men was also very helpful and they stored our luggage free of charge once we had checked out as we had a night time flight and wanted to make the most of our last day. The hotel is in an excellent location. 5 minute walk to Times Square and the Subway station. Also, there is an excellent Mexican restaurant next door, called Sombrero where they make the best margheritas! Also on 9th Avenue, 2 minutes walk, there is a great bakery and the Galaxy Diner is great for the all American breakfast, including pancakes, at a great price. The hotel is in a great place to reach everything in Manhatten, highly recommended.

<Author>Quality_7
<Content>If only they did what they said.... All of the reviews of this hotel here on TripAdvisor were fairly accurate.
