<Author>Frogwalters
<Content>Excellent Location and great quality hotel We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Belvedere Hotel and it was an extremely pleasant experience. The hotel location is great, just a few blocks from Times Square and the subway (which is safe as long as you are careful) is around the corner. Great for catching a Broadway show as all the theatres are on your doorstep (Good Vibrations is fantastic but don't go to see Movin' Out - it is awful). The rooms are small but have everything you need including a coffee jug, fridge and microwave, iron, safe and alarm clock. The room had a very comfy bed and the TV has about 20 or so US channels. You can watch movies but they cost around 12 dollars.The bathroom is small but very clean and has a great power shower. I did find the walls quite thin, but then NY is noisy anyway from the roads so it wasn't a problem (we had a 16th floor room which had fab views).We did a lot of research on the internet to find a good quality hotel for around 拢80 per room per night, and found this one on crshotels.com. We checked out the reviews on trip advisor and saw that it looked fine and it was!I am an extremely fussy traveller and found this 3 star hotel exactly what it is - 3 star and ideal as a base for exploring NY. You always return to a clean and tidy room which is lovely and warm!!! (There was air con for the summer too). The staff were really helpful too. :)If you are looking for a place for breakfast not far from this hotel, the Seattle Cafe just off 7th Avenue and 51st Street (3 minute walk) has the best selection of breakfasts. We were having eggs, toast, home potatoes and a tea of coffee for 3 dollars each!!!! The cakes are out of this world, what's more - it is open 24 hours.Bubba Gumps is great - the shrimps are out of this world.

<Author>Iloveholidays25
<Content>Brilliant hotel My boyfriend and I booked this hotel after reading the good reviews here on TripAdvisor, and we weren't disappointed. We requested a view and were given a lovely corner room with two double beds, two windows and plenty of space. The room was cleaned every day, and we never had any problems with feeling too cold or too hot. The shower was fantastic, the hot water didn't run out, and the kitchenette was handy. In spite of being located next to the service elevator we weren't disturbed and were generally very satisfied. The staff were helpful, polite and friendly and were happy to give local advice when asked. Breakfast was very nice, although as with most hotels quite expensive. I don't understand how anyone could complain about this hotel - obviously it's not a 5 star hotel, but it's nonetheless very comfortable. I've stayed in far more expensive hotels that weren't a patch on it. English people will find it similar to a Holiday Inn type hotel. The best way I can endorse the hotel is to say that next time we visit New York we'll definitely stay at The Belvedere again!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The Bush Leagues in Midtown A major corporate client of the hotel had made my reservations. The hotel provided written assurances, including a confirmation number that the type of room that I needed in order to complete my business would be available. When I arrived, after a long flight, I was told in no uncertain terms that the room was not available, that regardless of the confirmation number and assurances, all of the rooms of the kind that I had been guaranteed were taken. Frankly, the smugness, and the don't care attitude of the front desk staff were insufferable. The room that I finally got, near the service elevator, was barely functional. The porcelain on the sink was cracked. There was no safe ledge for the curling iron. The room was unduly cold with no means to adjust the temperature. In an era of business travelers, the room had no desk but only a small chest of drawers -- no cut-out space for legs -- that I had to use for my laptop. In short, stay elsewhere. The quality of the room and the quality of the service are truly bush league and unworthy of Midtown Manhattan.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>10 out of 10!! Stayed here November 2004. Was anxious when booking a hotel in New York as I had heard alot of bad stories about hotels in NY. The Belvedere is exactly what you want when visiting New York. This hotel is close to everything; Port Authority bus station, Central Park, Fifth Avenue, Broadway, Time Square, etc. Walked everywhere and just used the subway to go down town. We left the hotel early every morning and returned late in the evening. The bedroom was cleaned everyday we were there (our pjamas were even put under our pillow!!!!). We didn't eat in the hotel, we preferred trying places outside which there are alot of in theh area. Enjoy your stay here.  
<Date>Mar 14, 2005
<Rating>5	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very favorable I stayed at the Belvedere 2/24 - 2/25/05 and was most favorably inpressed. The staff was very efficient and helpful. The room was small but very clean and well laid out. Everything worked just as it should - TV, bathroom plumbing, phone. I could not find a thermostat, but the temperature was comfortable. The concierge was most helpful with directions and obtaining airport shuttle service. The elevators were quite small, but the wait for one was not excessive. The halls were a bit narrow, but well lighted. It is located 2 blocks from a subway station, a short walk to Times Square, and is surrounded by theaters. After the reviews I had read of other hotels, the Belvedere elicited a big sigh of relief. I have recommended this hotel, and will do so again. If I should return to New York, I would be glad to stay in the Belvedere again.

This was our first trip to New York, but when we return we will definitely stay at The Belvedere again. A little tip for food: although many of the nice restaurants are very expensive for dinner, those same restuarants have the same great food and much lower prices for lunch.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A rought start, but would return. After reading all the positive reviews about the Belvedere, we booked a room for four nights through an online hotel booking service and got a good price ($150/night) for the President's Day weekend.Although our reservation was for a non-smoking, king room, they put us in a smoking double room. After asking to switch rooms, they said that reservation requests were not guaranteed and they only had that room available. (This was hard to believe, considering my friends checked in several hours after us and got a non-smoking, king room.)In any event, the next day we moved rooms and, after communicating our dissatisfaction about the previous night's stay, they put us in a nice room on the top floor with a view. This floor had been renovated, so it had DSL service (for a small cost per day). The next 3 nights we stayed there. They also gave us complimentary breakfast (but my friends got this too, so I don't know if it was special treatment). It's a great location and the staff is friendly (except the smoking room thing). I would go back, but just be certain you know what room you're getting before walking away from the front desk.

<Author>Villasmart

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Perfect hotel for a family We stayed at the Belevedere Hotel in January 2005. The rooms were a bargain for NYC standards (really for any town!). It was one of the few hotels that offered a breakfast deal. In addition, the rooms all have a refrigerator and microwave, which came in handy for weary kids needing a drink (parents too!) after a long day of sightseeing. The buffett breakfast was good, and kids 5 and under eat free! I read a lot of reviews complaining of slow elevators, but we didn't notice any worse than other hotels we've stayed in. We would definitely stay here again; the rooms were bigger than we expected and much cleaner than many chains we've stayed in. The hotel is just a few blocks from times square.

<Author>nads_p
<Content>good new york hotel Have just returned from a 6 night stay at the belvedere. We are a couple but had 2 double beds in our room - this gave us a bit of extra room, but would say the room was quite big. There was a microwave, and coffee machine which was good - although no cutlery or plates or anything (but that could be asking for too much). The room was absolutely baking hot for the first couple of days of our stay, the temperature in NY obviously was colder before we arrived and the heating was on full blast. Thankfully the windows opened, but we were unable to turn the heating off in our room. We were right by the lifts but they didnt bother us at all, ask the bellboy to book you a cab back to the airport and you end up paying the flat rate fare - which is a bonus. All in all, Staff were friendly and helpful, rooms were clean, shower was powerful - would def go back!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Experience Having traveled to Manhattan for the last 30 years, I can safely assure you that I have had good experiences and bad. Having to attend a sales meeting in January 05, the company travel agent booked our reservations at the Belvedere of which I had no knowledge. The agent assured me not only was this a good hotel, but of excellent value. This didn't convince me, so I went on to Trip Advisors and read all of the comments. The only negative comments I could find of any consequence (from a few reports) was that the staff was testy. Positive comments was that the room was nice, near the theatre district and was of good value. Still, I was somewhat unconvinced.   This changed when I got to the hotel. I stayed 6 nights. The room was excellent and staff was terrific. I cannot think of one thing that wasn't as advertised and would recommend this hotel for family visits, business travel, or whatever reason you have in NYC.

<Author>the_crafty_traveller
<Content>Just as good 2nd time round Stayed a second time at the Belvedere 20 Nov 04 for 4 nights. Had booked a twin for sole use but got a double room (think it costs the same anyway)- but WHAT a room! It was a corner room so I had views of W48th to one side and the Hudson River to the side - boy did it twinkle at night!! Room was smallish and whilst next to the service lift, I never heard it. Bed was very comfortable with a good solid mattress and the kitchenette was as handy as ever. The bathroom was tiny - but it was very clean. Whilst a non smoking room I could still detect a faint trace of smoke - turned out it came from the bathroom but I found a vent in there and promptly closed it - problem solved and no more smokey smell the whole stay. Hotel location v close to everything I wanted, museums, shops etc.. I'd recommend dinner at The View in the Marriottt Marquis Hotel - expensive but New York's only revolving restaurant and the food was spot on. Breakfast in the hotel is great $8, $11 or $13 depending on which option you require, and if you want to go out then there is the Olympic Diner and Pigalle's just a minute away. Only slight downside if I have to find one was that when I arrived checkin was run off its feet, short staffed and phones going so the receptionist was rather more brusque than friendly, but everything else was fine and all the other staff were fine. Overall I enjoyed my stay and I return again in April.   
<Date>Feb 12, 2005
<Rating>5	3	4	-1	5	-1	3	-1	

<Author>Shamu63
<Content>Would Recommend A Visit !!!! Have just returned from New York with my partner, and a couple of friends. We stayed at the Belvedere for four nights and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a clean, comfortable and well positioned hotel.  As is the case when booking hotels after reviews on the internet we were a bit wary of what we would find, but we were more than happy with the Belvedere. Arrived at 14:00 and checked in straightaway even though actual check-in isn't until 16:00. We were given two rooms, both with two queen size beds, toilet with bath/shower and towels changed daily, fridge, microwave, iron and ironing board, wardrobe, in-room safe and TV. The rooms were more than adequate for our stay and the price paid. It's classed as a budget hotel, but I'd like to find another hotel as comfotable and clean as this in another capital city for this type of cost.  Staff were courteous and helpful when needed, had a couple of problems with the shower and bath, which were fixed within half an hour of reporting them.  Tried the full breakfast once and have to say for value and variety it was well worth it, however there are places to eat all around the hotel, so were spoilt for choice for the 5 days we were there, hence we only tried it once.  Position of hotel is one block from Times Square, there is a tourist office around the corner where you can purchase tickets for the bus tours. Walked up to Central Park which only took 20 minutes, Empire State Building is 20 -25 minutes away, or one stop on the metro and 5 minutes walk. The location is ideal for the short break we were on, where nothing is too far away.  Only slight complaint we had as mentioned in other reviews was the heating, no way to control it and also the 4:30 am symphony of the old clanging pipework we had each morning (slept through this a couple of days though due to being exhausted after all the sightseeing). Oh, and just make sure that if you do get the doorman to get you a cab to the airport, confirm with the driver he has told him the right one !! Told our driver we wanted JFK when in fact we were flying from Newark.  Would stay here again, and hopefully will. After speaking to the receptionist we found out that they have just had a full refurbishment of the reception areas and some of the rooms, they are planning more, and also there is the possibility of a gym and a bar area as well.  Good hotel, great location, well worth a visit !!!

<Author>gazzerooni
<Content>Great Great Great What can I say about the Belvedere:It is an unassuming hotel on a side street off 8th avenue. We were very pleased to have a Queen size bed each ( my sister had a single bed in the Radisson on Lexington sharing and they paid $30 for the room more than us).Checking in was very quick-less than 5 mins -and our rooms were ready even though we arrived at 3 instead of 4.The lifts were never a problem. I am sure if the hotel was very busy, maybe there would be a delay but we never waited long. Most of the time we got a lift straight away!!We went to the diner across the road on 8th-In the Days Inn-but realised that breakfast in the Belvedere was better value-and ate in our hotel after that.if you are looking for breakfast in the area-the Westside diner on 44th and 9th is very reasonable and very clean too!I have to say that we were all very happy with our Belvedere experience. <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>good stay I stayed at the Belvedere for 5 nights in the middle of Jnauary. We booked two rooms, one double and one twin. When we arrived one was ready and the other wasn't, but this wasnt an issue (we did arrive before check in time) we dropped in our bags to the ready room and went out.The lobby is large, with a seating area. Checking in does take time, the computers were very slow, but there was never a big queue so not an issue. Our rooms were right next door to each other. When we arrived at our room we were worried as it was right next to the lift, however this had no affect on our stay whatsoever, there was no noise from the lift. However on one occasion just some noise from loud people waiting for the lift, but this was only once. The rooms were large, there is a desk, bed side cabinet, tv and guide books. The bathroom is a nice size. There is a closet, not huge but enough, with a safe in it. Small kitchenette which was only used to make tea or coffee, but there is a fridge, microwave, sink and cupboard. The rooms were cleaned daily, fresh towels and flannels.We had breakfast at the hotel everyday except for one. The breakfast was great, a choice from two. most expensive $16 but you get a huge amount of choice for that and we felt was well worth it. There is also a cheaper option of $10 which exclude the hot food and some cold meat and cheese.All in all a brilliant stay for what we felt felt was an excellent price. We booked direct through the belvedere website.

<Author>simicu
<Content>The Belvedere delivered Sorry, I should have written this right after my wife and I got back in the Fall. But the memories are still fond for the week we stayed at this litle gem of a hotel. The only reason I give it a 4 instead of a 5 was due to the size of the room (especially the bathroom). Not that I was expecting a grand suite, especially when we're talking about the price of hotels in Manhattan, but a bit larger would have been perfect.That said, all else is absolutely positive. The location was incredible. Just steps off 8th Ave on 48th in the heart of the Theatre District, it's amazing how just a few yards makes a difference. As you walk west from 8th, the atmosphere suddenly takes on a Euro-like charm, with trees lining the street and a sense of peaceful ambience taking hold as you enter the doorway, where one of the staff is there to greet you. Speaking of which, the employees go a long way toward adding to the comfort and pleasant experience of staying here. They are always friendly and quick to respond to any issue that may arise. The lobby carries a nice, subtle hint of Art Deco and only adds to the overall character to the place.Back to, as they say, location location location! Two blocks away from the edge of Times Square, as well as several different subway stops. If you walk about 3 blocks or so due east on 48th, you'll walk hit the entrance of where they do the Today Show, the outside part where folks line up, that is. We were also just a 5 minute walk to the Letterman Show, which we got tickets for in advance. Of course it gets to be redundant saying what you'd be close to - this is the heart of Manhattan, so suffice to say, you're close to a lot! BTW, we dined royally every night in some great restaurants, altho I must confess, we never did get around to eating at the Belevedere itself. I'm sure the food is as good there, but we were just too busy bopping all over Manhattan. Highly recommended: Thalia (less than a block away), Gallagher's Steak House, and Carnegie Deli.Obviously I could go on and on, but you get the picture. The Belvedere is a great little boutique hotel. As long as you don't expect a whopper-sized room, you will most likely consider your stay here almost perfect.

<Author>EmilyB80
<Content>Great little find! 5 of us stayed here from Jan 6th- 10th and thought it was fab! Great value for money, great location and great hotel. No queue to check in at 5pm and very helpful staff. Rooms were more than adequate (both with 2 double beds) both clean and spacious. Only small issue was the male concierge who was neither as helpful or friendly as other members of staff. We asked him to book a taxi to take us back to the airport with Tel Aviv taxis,as I had heard they were reasonably priced and reliable. He refused as they were not a 'PREFERRED COMPANY' but said he would book it for us with a company of the hotel's choice. Perhaps this is hotel policy but I thought a little bit harsh as they claim to be happy to make reservations for you. He said he could arrange this at a total cost of $125 (plus tip/toll) for 5 people in a mini van. I decided to phone Tel- Aviv taxis myself from the payphone and got the same deal at $65.00. Half the price! Glad I didn't go along with the'hotel choice' they obviously take commission. That was the only gripe, everything else great and would definitely return!

<Author>mybagispacked
<Content>GREAT START FOR A NEW YEAR The New Year weekend was easy going thanks to the Belvedere. I have made several trips to New York in the past few years, and I am adding this hotel to my favorite list.The rooms were clean and above average in size and condition for NY. In addition, the bellman and other staff were nice as could be, did their job well with a smile and class. The resturant would only serve full breakfasts instead of just coffe which is somewhat of a hassle. The only real negative is the central heating system. There is no way to regulate your room temperature. The heat was on even though New York had a warm spell. Therefore, we used the window air conditioner to cool down our room.Considering the amount of people that were in town for New Years's Eve, they handled the mobs very well.I travel to New York often and usually stay at the Wolcott for price and location. Now that I have found the Belvedere, I will use this hotel again and again as long as the rates stay reasonable.  
<Date>Jan 13, 2005
<Rating>4	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>pwbdot20001
<Content>January 7th - 11th I booked this hotel for my now fiancee and I (proposed at the top of the Empire State) after the advice and reviews from this website and was not dissapointed. Its in a great location for the theaters / Times Square and the subways are only two blocks away on 50th. The doormen and porters are extreamley helpfull and never gave you the impression they were 'hanging around' for a tip.All was not entirley perfect though.We arrived at 12.30pm and our room was not ready so we were told to come back around 4ish. I guess the previous guest may have only just checked out at midday so it's not the hotels fault and we were trying to check in early, but after being up all night you just want to shower and chill for a bit. Our cases were kept in reception for us so we could do some early sightseeing.After having a bath in the early evening, our bath water would'nt drain so we had to call for the plumber. He arrived after about 15mins but could not fix it and said they would return the next day, which they did after we had gone out meaning we couldnt shower in the morning. It was fixed on our return that evening. Unfortunatly we could only shower after that as the water kept draining away. Typical!We only had coffee in our room and no tea. There are tea bags available which we asked for twice and were assured by reception that they would send some up. They never arrived.You can check your bill on the TV and in doing so I noticed we had been charged for two long distance phonecalls to Italy we didnt make. I informed reception and they said they would make sure they were taken off as they were made before we checked in. On receiving our final bill the two calls were still on there. However, they were taken off when we left.....its just not the sort of thing you need to be doing at 5am.Overall, the hotel and room was very clean and tidy and the room had fresh towels daily and was left in a very tidy manner by the maids. We had no problems with the lifts as some on this site have said - after all, we are used to English ones!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Belvedere was fantastic My wife and I stayed in the Belvedere over Christmas, having read the good reviews on this site, and it certainly lived up to its expectations. I booked a deluxe room via the hotel website and paid 拢700 ($1300) for seven nights, which is fantastic. (helped by the good exchange rate).This was my third visit to NY and the Belvedere was by far the best hotel I have stayed in. We had an incredibly large room by NY standards and it was very clean and tidy.The hotel's location is perfect, not too far away from Times Square and Restaurant Row etc, but far enough to be nice and quite, tucked down a side street.If I had to make two complaints, and they are only minor, it would be there is no bar in the hotel (although there are some good bars just minutes away such as the House of Brews on Restaurant Row), and the concierge service was poor (both the people we dealt with seemed totally uninterested in helping is and one of them could only come up with one restaurant that would be open on Xmas Day - as it turned out most of them were open).The lifts didn't bother us and we were on the top floor (17th) We were advised to use the service elevators by staff!Would thoroughly recommend the Belvedere to anyone planning a trip to New York.

The room was large with two king size beds, and it even had a decent view out the front of the hotel. The bathroom was new and clean and it was handy having the addition of the kitchenette, with tea and coffee making facilities and a fridge.The first day we walked to the Empire State Building, Central Station, Macys etc and the hotel was ideally located. We managed to find a great Brazillian restaurant round the corner on the first night which meant we never had far to walk. The second night we dined in a French restaurant, again just round the corner, it was superb. It meant we never had far to go at the end of the night.I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel, my husband and I both work in the hotel trade, and are probably that bit more critical! We are definitely going to return to New York soon and would not hesitate to book the Belvedere again.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Location, small rooms, would go back Not a bad hotel, very cute, close enough to Times Square, yet far enough from the masses of Times Square, Fifth Ave, and Central Park. My one complaint was the rooms were very small. For example, the ironing board took up the majority of any open space that was available. I can see where the kitchenette would be useful if you are staying there for multiple nights, but for one night, I saw this as a waste of space.But, considering the location and the price, I would gladly stay here again.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A Perfect Stay in NYC I have stayed in many hotels in NY that are both large and small. My last stay at the Hotel Carter was miserable and I was looking for a hotel in the $200 price range. I discovered the Belvedere Hotel scouring through reviews and made my hotel reservation for New Years Eve 2004/2005. It was such a pleasure to be greeted by the doorman and walk into a clean lobby with marble floors. My hotel room was tastefully appointed and the bathroom was clean and perfect. A small microwave, coffee machine, iron and ironing board in the closet, and small refrigerator for storing leftover carryout was a definate plus. The bedding was warm and cozy and worked with the color scheme of the room. The cable television received all of the local programming and even had a nintendo controller hooked to the tv set although no nintendo was discovered. Overall I give this hotel a 10 on a scale of one to ten. My only complaint was with the elevators which seemed to have a mind of their own. Of course, that has nothing to do with the room or hotel itself so I highly recommed it to anyone travelling to ny. I even caught a performance fo Gem of The Ocean with Phyllicia Rashad playing one block up and it capped an incredible weekend. So, if you are looking for a hotel for New Years or any other time of the year look no further than here unless you are on a poverty budget. The room price was under $200 for the first night and $125 for the second night. Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Price!

<Author>Martyc2Westport
<Content>Great place Just stayed at the Bellvedere my first time (Though my travel companion has been twice before). It is a lovely hotel, located ideally close to Times Square yet far enough away so you can sleep at night! The hotel itself has a very capable and friendly staff. The furnishings, roomsize, and amenities were all acceptable, if not above what I expected from a reasonably priced hotel in New York City. My only 2 minor complaints are that I did not have an end table on my side of the double bed. It may not sound like much to complain about, but when you need to put down a drink or take off your watch, etc there wa no place but the floor to put it. Also, the ice machine located on the second floor did not work for 2 days, but was fixed on the third. As a first time guest at the Bellvedere, I would highly recommend it to anyone.

<Rating>4	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great location, decent hotel, price Just returned from a 5 night stay in New York City for Christmas week with my teenage daughter. This was our first trip to NY and I was concerned about having a good safe location, sizable room and fair price. This hotel fit the needs we were looking for. The Belvedere is within walking distance to all the theatres, local stores, Times Square and the subway system. The rate was great for all the 3-Star New York hotels that I had checked out on the web. I logged into one of the smaller hotel booking websites by accident and found that I could get a rate of $130 a night for 2 dbl beds. The Belvedere hotel website as well as other search engines were priced at least $20.00 -$40.00 higher per night. The hotel's staff was adequate but generally not overly attentive. If you want a centrally located hotel with a good rate I would recommend it. If you want to be pampered like a 5-Star hotel there's not a lot of extra frills in this hotel. The city offered us whatever we needed. Those being swayed by the reviews about the elevators, they aren't really that slow. There's 2 extra elevators that most people don't even use at the end of the hallway. Save the extra money you'll spend somewhere else and spend it on the food and city. We saw 3 shows during the week with some of the extra money. Take the subway or cab to the TKTS office downtown and save yourself 90 minutes in line at Times Sqaure. I will say that the city is noisy in all areas and you will hear some noise from your rooms. But that is New York in general. Have a great trip.

<Author>Footstepstours
<Content>Great Great Great I organised a trip of 27 adults (aged between 30 - 70) from the UK  we stayed at the Belvedere in November 04. Everything was excellent, no bad rooms, no bad service, staff great, hotel very clean. First impression was that we were out of the bustle as it was in such a quiet road, but two blocks away - Times Sq... It is in a great location and would stay again. It was a comfortable hotel. Breakfast in the hotel was $15 but inc tax  drinks, and was all you can eat, so worth it. What I liked was that there was plenty of seating in the lobby for meeting friends. The rooms were over sized and the kitchenettes came in really handy. Considering we had 14 rooms - and none of us had a bad experience I would recommend this hotel to all. None of us had problem with sirens or noise from lifts (and I was next to the lift) as others have. Yes the lifts can be slow at peak times, but was not a problem - there are always the stairs.

<Rating>4	4	3	-1	5	-1	4	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great place, highly recommended We stayed at the Belvedere Hotel the weekend of Nov. 19th to 22nd. I had a real tough time deciding on a hotel, due to budget restrictions and what we were looking for was a hotel that was within walking distance of Times Square, Rockeffeler Center, Trump Tower that would be very clean, and had helpful staff and was affordable. After reading many reviews on this site, and looking at maps and photos of hotels in the Manhattan area, I decided on the Belvedere. It had great reviews, the price was right, and the location was excellent. When we arrived, the room was ready, the staff were more than helpful. The room itself was very clean, with new ceramic tiles in the bathroom. We ordered a non smoking room, and it was as promised, very neat and the furniture was fairly new. The size of the room was average, for two or three people. We used the iron, the hairdryer and the fridge and microwave, all working and very helpful to have. The wall safe was in the coat closet, and was handy for storing passports etc. The breakfast in the morning was buffet style and priced around 12 dollars. The buffet room was large and well laid out. We found it to be a great deal, as there was alot of selection, and the food was very fresh and tasty. The staff was very pleasant and cleared the tables as soon as you were done. They had a tip jar at the buffet cash, which we all donated to.The doorman gave us a name of a great restaurant to have dinner at, and helped us via the front desk to get a reservation. It was a short walk to all the main tourist areas in Manhattan, and the cabs were cheap for longer trips. A hint, the Empire State Building is open till midnight, so don't stand in the 3 hour lineups during the day, come real late, and avoid the lineups and the night view is amazing. Also, a real treat was the Fire Station just up the street from the hotel. It was great to meet real FDNY heros and have photos taken with them and the trucks. The New York Double Decker Bus Tour has an office just steps from the hotel, and there is a little deli, smoke shop on the corner. To sum up, we would have no hesitation to recommend the Belvedere Hotel to anyone who is visiting New York. The only negative item of the entire stay, was the long waits for elevators, they only have two slow ones for guests from the main lobby. But, that was the only problem , with many positives from this hotel, such as the great location. We will definately return on our next visit to New York City.  
<Date>Dec 5, 2004
<Rating>5	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Nice, clean, and safe! Read Whole Review! My husband and our two daughters stayed 3 nights during July 2004. Julie in CR helped us with a good rate....especially for summer. We arrived, and the check in was fine. The room was a fairly good size...long and narrow though. Our trip was to see NYC so we didn't plan on being in the room the whole time! The kids loved it~ Bathroom was decked from floor to ceiling in marble, and served its purpose. I forgot my blow dryer, but they have one built in. The housekeeping brought extra blankets  towels quickly as we were exhausted, and it was pouring rain outside. The a/c said check filter, so we called, and maintenance, came up shortly with a new filter. Both were very friendly. We used the microwave and the fridge, also the coffee maker. Bring hot chocolate packets for the kids though...they do not have any. We were nervous at first because everyone kept saying it was a bad part of town. We felt very safe, and the building upkeep looked good too. It was a great location, easy to walk to many places. We walked to Times Square, and took the Red Double decker Tour Bus, great deal. There is a self coded safe in the room and it came in VERY HANDY! We had somewhat of a nice view too! Actually the noise was not as bad as we were expecting!! But then again, after sightseeing all day, maybe we were exhausted...but we slept well! Someone set the fire alarm off by mistake, but management came on a loud speaker and handled the situation very professionally. (It was only about 6pm anyway). By the way...take your shower early...like other hotels...the water may run cool before dinner hours! The elevators were quick going up...but going down, it seemed to take forever. We stopped at several floors, but actually met a lot of friendly guests who were helpful with restaurants and places to shop. Front desk was supreme too! I worked in the hotel business (front desk management) for years...and I believe this hotel was up to standards! We would stay there again for sure! Thank you! Renee'  family

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great hotel, great location My 20-year-old daughter, her friend, and I stayed at the Belvedere 11/11 through 11/15. We arrived at 11:30 a.m. and were given a room right away. The staff was very friendly, and the concierge was helpful. The location is perfect - very close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, etc. I had read reviews about the elevators being slow and crowded but that was generally not a problem (we were on the 7th floor). The only time we came across this problem was when a large group was checking out, and everyone was trying to get to the lobby at the same time. I would definitely stay there again. On a completely different note, we wanted to go on the Circle Line for the two-hour cruise around lower Manhattan to see the Statue of Liberty without having to stop there. The Circle Line was dirty, smelly and crowded - thankfully, we got off before the boat left. We ended up going on a 3-hour dinner cruise with Spirit Cruises - a lot more expensive but well worth it - dinner, music, dancing, and a wonderful view of the Manhattan skyline, the Brooklyn Bridge and the Statue of Liberty lit up at night - it was our favorite part of the trip.

<Content>Great hotel I found the hotel to be really clean and the staff to be very helpful. At first I was given a room which already had people in it and they were very apologetic about the mistake. The business centre was useful, but for a better rate on the internet go to the bus tour place round the corner as you get an hour for $5. If you jot the code down you can use the computers in the hotel with the same code and pay far less.Check out was quick and all the staff were really friendly. I didn't have too many problems with the lifts, but being on the 17th floor I did have a couple of times where we practically stopped at every floor. But this was not too bad considering I was there for 5 nights.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Location made up for the room We stopped at the hotel for 5 nights from 14-19th Nov.We found the hotel to be okay - nothing special. However we have nothing to compare against as it was the first trip to NY. After reading all the other reviews I would have hated to have seen/stopped in a hotel with a worse rating!The location is excellent - simple as that. If using the subways all day buy an all day ticket from the desk for $7 and wear a good/comfortable pair of shoes. Statue of Liberty still has limited access, you'll need to be at the ticket office early to be able to get to the base of the statue.On the downside we found the room we had to be really noisy. The room was next to the fire escape stairs - which someone always decided to use late at night - probably due to the slow lifts. The walls were also pretty thin. Next door kept receiving phone calls from 3am onwards - which was really great! On top of this the road noise was pretty loud, this was not helped by the poor aircon fitting in the window.As for the bathroom, the shower does not remain at a consistent temperature.The staff we dealt with were always pleasent.Would probably stop again, but cannot see us returning in the near future.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>lovely hotel. Excellent location. Having booked The Belvedere, on the views of other guests, this certainly lived up to expectations. The room was more than adequate for myself and my sister-in-law, and the kitchenette with fridge was a great asset, especially for storing bottled water and milk. The filter coffee machine is great and the complimentry coffee too. There was some noise, but only as to be expected, being in the heart of the city, but you soon got used to that and it added to the whole city-never-sleeps element. It was in excellent distance for visiting Central Park, Times Square and further. Plenty of restaurants to choose from too, being so close to restaurant row! The hotel staff were very friendly and the Bellhops were helpful when we had to check out of our rooms and needed to store our bags (a dollar a case/bag is needed if the trolleys are used), and they also arranged a taxi to the airport for us, which was a help too. This was our second visit to New York City, and as the hotel we stayed in before was ok, but very average, The Belvedere was like a small palace, in comparison. Very clean and tidy. We would certainly recommend this hotel.

I would very much recommend this hotel!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Good location. The location was great. The room was nice, a bit small. The front desk service was not very friendly and they were not very helpful. The elevators were slow, slow, and almost always full, so you stopped on every floor. They do not have a restaurant in the hotel which was not very convenient. It was in the theatre district, close to Times Square, and the tour bus station was just around the corner. We would probably stay there again because of location, price and the room was nice. At checkout we waited over a half hour for a taxi along with about 6 or 7 other parties, and there was no one to help with the luggage when we finally got a cab.  
<Date>Nov 5, 2004

<Author>Bloke
<Content>Belvedere's the one ....... Stayed 7 nights at The Belvedere - West 48th Street between Oct 20 - 26, 2004.Hotel :Fast / Easy Check in - good service.Room - nice and clean / air con / small fridge and microwave -plenty of space for clothes / in room safe / TV / small desk.Elevators : C'mon people - whats the problem - there are 4 Elevators ( technically 1 is for Staff but hey if it's going where you're going get on board I say ). They may not be the quickest in NYC but does that extra 30 seconds really matter !!!Location2 Blocks from Times Square - and yet is in a quieter street so you don't get bustled the second you step outside like some that are in Times Square.Subway within a few blocks depending which one you want.Fire Station - yes you can hear sirens - but also Police cars / truck  car horns like everywhere else in NYC. If you've had a big day in the big apple sleep shouldnt be a problem.Summary : If you want to be near Times Square / Broadway etc - this is the place to be if you dont want to spend a fortune.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Overall good experience I recently spent 3 nights at the Belvedere October 29 - November 1. When I first checked in, the room I was given was DIRTY, littered with soda bottles, water bottles, and cigarette ashes. One of the hotel employees came up to change my rooms and acted like I was crazy for asking for a different room. The entire floor of the hotel also smelled very strongly like cigarette smoke. The new room I was given was clean, and the rooms are large for NYC. The microwave and fridge are added benefits to the room. The elevators are extremely slow and full, and they sound like they may give out at any time. At check out, I was charged for a movie I did not rent. I told the lady I didn't order it, but she still charged me over $10 for a movie that was supposedly viewed at 5:30 am when I was sound asleep (I was the only one in my room). My shuttle reservation to JFK was not made, and I ended up paying $64 on a cab as opposed to $23 for the shuttle. I wasn't even offered an apology. The rooms are spacious, the rate is fairly cheap, and the location is great. The staff's helpfullness is horrible and cleanliness and the elevators definitely need improving. I might stay at the Belvedere again but I will probably try someplace new next time.  
<Date>Nov 2, 2004
<Rating>3	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>amodle
<Content>Loved the Belvedere My husband and I just recently visited NYC. We chose The Belvedere strictly on the reviews on this website. The hotel was wonderful! The staff was friendly, and the room was fantastic. The room was very large and we had two Queen beds. But, the best part of the hotel was the location. It is just a few blocks away from Times Square. You are close to all the sights of Times Square, yet the hotel is located on a relatively quiet residential street. You are also close to Ninth, which has every type of restaurant offered-at reasonable prices. We took advantage of the refridge and microwave in our room and visited the local markets that are near by. Those markets sell very reasonably priced items. This hotel is also very close to public transportation. The subway is a few blocks away and there is a bus line #20 that will take you all the way to Wall Street. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and I would definetly come back!

<Author>angelica
<Content>No Complaints We spent 5 nights at the Belveder from 23/10/04 to 28/10/04 and can honestly say we had no complaints what so ever. The staff were helpful and polite. When we checked out we had our bill within 3-4 minutes, we have often had to wait up to 15 at other hotels. THe doormen/conceriege were very helpful, they booked a black car to get us to the airport as we left at 4.30pm the start of rush-hour, they explained it could be more expensive to take a yellow taxi with the meter running. The car turned up at 4.28pm. The room was quite roomy considering it was NY - the bathroom was small but perfectly adequate. We were on the 15th floor 2 rooms from the elevators but we heard no noise at night. Yes they were slow and got full, but because we were near the top of the building when they got to us they were usually empty. The fire station caused us no problems, only heard the sirens one night and that was because I had a problem sleeping. Overall a great hotel, great location, friendly staff - would have no hesitation in recommendating it.

<Author>SFB43
<Content>Great Location but confirm your shuttle bus! The Belvedere is a lovely hotel in an ideal location being only a short walk from Times Square. Ideal for doing the bus tour as the first stop is only a hop skip and a jump from the hotel. Our room was very spacious which was a surprise as friends who've been to NY have always commented on how tiny hotel rooms are over here. It was cleaned every day of our 4 night stay so definitely no complaints there. With the exception of the doorman the staff were average. One useful thing for us was the laundry room which is in the basement, the tumble dryer was a gift to dry our damp overcoats which we wanted to wear again later that day. It did rain a lot during our trip! One warning though is if you book the shuttle bus back to the airport doublecheck it has been confimed by concierge and bus company! On our departure we became concerned when the shuttle we had booked for 4pm the day before had not arrived by 4.15pm. On speaking to the concierge it emerged he had booked it but had not been given a confirmation number by the bus company which is usual practice but was told this was ok. The concierge was very apologetic but after a long phone call it emerged that we couldn't then get the shuttle until 5.30pm. In the end we asked for our money back and had to get a taxi which cost us twice as much each as the shuttle. Despite this hiccup i would definitely stay there again. By the way do the Empire State at night, it's gorgeous.

<Author>Nogre
<Content>The Belvedere - the start of a brilliant holiday My wife and I have just returned after spending nine nights at the Belvedere. On arrival after a nightmare trip from JFK 3 hours after landing ( we came by shuttle), we received a very warm welcome and a most helpful doorman. The room was spacious with two comfortable double beds and not cramped. The bathroom was a little small but adequate. The small kitchen was a bonus but does not include plates, cutlery or a wiping up cloth which we had the foresight to pack after reading another review. A Deli is sited just around the corner, a few yards up on the left hand side where we bought the odd items. The breakfast room was good value with a continental menu, a continental with meats, yoghourt and fruit, or a full American breakfast. The hotel is quiet and well sited for Times Square, Theatres and the NY Sightseeing Office. We would certainly return.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>a shot in the dark and a hope for the best The Hotel Belvedere surpassed my expectations of a great NYC Hotel and believe me, I agonized for days on this sight trying to find a hotel my nine year old son and myself would be comfortable in for our three day stay in NYC mid-October, '04. I went with the reviews about the Belvedere on this very helpful sight and hoped for the best. From the getgo of calling beforehand to make sure I could get a quiet room, to coming to the Hotel at 1 pm, hoping only to store our backpacks until official checkin and being told instead that we could go to our room in ten minutes time, to incredibly nice, behind the desk personnel and doormen, to someone cleaning the cracks between the wood paneling in the lobby with a tooth brush, to a spotless room each day after housecleaning, to an off the main drag location, to being able to open a window at least a little for fresh air, to a nice enough breakfast selection, to a helpful consierge, to sleeping well enough, our stay at the Belvedere was very nice.The only comments are if you're looking for a good, safe, clean, relatively quiet, friendly place to stay this is it. Obviously, the frustration for us all, is paying a lot of money just for a bed, due to late nights and early mornings. If you've never been to NYC and want a sure bet this is it. When you come, you can scope out less expensive places if this is an issue. The only slight irritations were the slow, small elevators (the elevator down the hall to the right of the main elevators is the elevator to use) and the phone charges for long-distance credit card calls, but I suppose this is standard. Great location to Time Square, the Theatre district and subways (which is a must to learn because it is such an easy and a cheap way to get around). I also highly recommend the 8:45 New York Waterways Ferry Tour of Manhatten at night with a wonderful, informative tour guide named Noah. It was beautiful and very romantic, though is seasonal. You can take the New York Waterway bus free to the Ferry putout. Buses run every 15 mins. more-or-less down 42nd and 50th St, double check on the streets. Anyway, a great time in NYC! The people were friendly and warm everywhere which was so fun. Enjoy!

<Author>gg92101
<Content>Great hotel, great location, great price! I stayed at the Belvedere in New York City on Oct. 8-10, 2004, solely on the recommendations of this site (TripAdvisor.com). I wasn't disappointed. I arrived on the red-eye from San Diego and was allowed to check in and check a bag (no rooms were ready at 8am, understandedbly) and was told to come back after noon. My room was ready by 2 or so, and I had a top floor room which was spotless and included a microwave and mini-fridge. Yes, the elevators are old and slow, but the price is great (I paid $175/night, a bargain in NYC these days). The location is wonderful, between 8th and 9th Avenues on 49th, quiet and tree-lined, but close enough to everything. The hotel was just part of a perfect early Fall weekend in NYC (with perfect weather to boot). I immediately made a reservation for another weekend in April, for an extra night.

<Rating>4	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>xaves99
<Content>Great deal , great location We stayed here from 14/9 through 24/9 and were thrilled with our choice. We have champagne tastes and a beer budget (at least in reference to NY prices for the Australian dollar!) and so worried about our hotel choice. Had booked much more expensive hotels earlier in the process but after reading reviews on this site and finding a price of $153 we thought all in all the hotel sounded nice, not plush, but with good service and well located.Well, we were very happy. The hotel does not offer the huge and glamourous lobby of bigger more expensive hotels but its still very attractive, friendly and has helpful door staff and reception staff. We arrived late and were treated like special guests that they had been waiting for after I had sent an email warning of our late flight into JFK.The rooms were not huge, although I noticed rooms ending with 12,14 and 16 I believe, were bigger. But having said that, the king size bed is comfortable, the cupboard space is fine and there is an area for storage with the fridge, sink and microwave. We didn't use these facilities other than the fridge but I can see how , if you wanted to save a bit of money on food items, the microwave and fridge would be really handy.The only negatives we found would be that the bathroom doesn't really have anywhere to put your stuff other than a little bitty shelf. However, for the price, one overcomes this without too much angst. It lacks a fan,too. The window mounted aircon works well, it just takes a bit of time to work out which temperature setting best suits you, personally. The windows are quite large and come down to the level of the bed so one can pull up the blinds, sit back in bed and watch the city. This is lovely at sunset with the lights coming on, in particular. I just loved looking out and knowing it was NY. The firehouse around the corner does play sirens quite a bit but I loved this, too. It sounded like what I expected NY to sound like and, really, it was reassuring too! I often lifted the window up just to hear the sounds better!One of the best things about the Belvedere is the location. It is 5 minutes from Time Square so one has access to buses and there is a shuttle available by subway on 8th Ave (around the corner) to Grand Central . There is another subway on 50th Street, only 2 blocks north. My husband is a light sleeper and the around the clock action of Times Square gave him more than something to do late at night and again early in the morning. He would buy bagels and coffee for $3 for our breakfast each morning from a street vendor nearby. This contrasts to a diner in Times Square we went to our first morning which cost us over $30! Ouch.There are many many restraunts in the area and quite a few bars. We loved The Social on 8th Ave, watched the baseball with the young locals. It was a happy and energetic crowd. There is Pigalle French style bistro on 48th and 8th which is open 24hrs. We had a post theatre meal here and it was excellent. Other cheaper options are available everywhere. Really, there are so many, every taste can be accomodated. We would certainly stay at the Belvedere again.

<Author>CherylAS
<Content>Absolutely Loved the Belvedere We stayed at the Belvedere for 4 nights before a cruise and loved it. We were a bit apprehensive because as the saying goes, A 2 star is a 2-star, but we can't figure out why this hotel isn't at least a 3 star. The exterior is very impressive and the lobby is gorgeous. We asked for a room on a higher floor away from the elevator (as recommended by this website) and got a king-size bed in a non-smoking room on the 15th floor, 2 doors away from the elevator. The room was much bigger than expected and perfectly clean. The only complaint we could come up with, and it was a minor one, was the bathroom door was awkward for blow drying my hair. since there was no fan, so I couldn't close the door. The kitchenette was great to have as well. The staff were friendly and accomodating. We walked everywhere from this hotel. I've read about elevator problems but the only thing we noticed is that there didn't seem to be enough of them. Often, on our way down, there was no more room for passengers when the door would open, but we never had any problem because we were almost at the top. We hope to get back to New York someday and will certainly stay at the Belvedere again. It doesn't disappoint!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The Belvedere lived up! We took a last minute quick trip to NYC on 9/28 - 9/29, and everywhere we liked to stay was sold out. We found The Belvedere through Travelocity, and got a great rate - $179. After reading other reviews here, we decided to give it a try. Check-in was smooth and quick, and we were even offered an upgrade when the woman checking us in noticed it was my husbands birthday from his id. Unfortunately, none of the larger rooms were available at that time, so we opted to just go ahead with our room as planned, as we were soaked from the steady downpour of rain that was drenching the city that never sleeps. The room itself was a little small, not unlike most in the city, but I must say it was the cleanest room I have ever stayed in, in NYC. It was like it was freshly painted for us. And everywhere you turned, someone was cleaning something. Even the lobby restrooms were immaculate. Back to the room, we were surprised to find a microwave, wet bar, and small refrigerator - great for water, snacks, and late night microwave popcorn. Our night was quiet and comfortable, and breakfast in the hotles cafe was awesome. It was self serve, buffet style, but the food and offerings were divine. With the great location, great prices, and the ultimate cleanliness of the entire hotel, we will always try the Belvedere first when in the city.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Stay at the Belvedere! I just returned yesterday from a 4-night stay at the Belvedere. It was my second trip to New York City this year, and the first ever for my mother. I wanted her trip to be special, so it was important that I find a nice hotel. I chose the Belvedere solely on the reviews from this site, and I was not at all disappointed. For the price, this hotel was perfect! The location was great, since it was so close to everything, but it was on a residential-type street that even had a school on it. The staff was very helpful and friendly, and the room was larger than I expected, and very clean. We had 2 double beds in a no-smoking room on the 14th floor with a window air conditioner that worked just fine to keep the room cool even in unusually warm September weather! Having a microwave and refrigerator were especially handy, and there is a nice little flower shop/mini grocery right on the corner where you can buy most anything you would need. I really liked having an iron and ironing board in the room, too. We didn't experience any of the elevator problems that some of the other reviewers mentioned, and although I heard a few sirens from the nearby fire station, I didn't find it to be a problem. I guess if I had to find anything wrong, it would be that our adjustable shower head wouldn't adjust, but that was no big deal! There is a great little Mexican restaurant a couple doors down called Sombrero that has great enchiladas, and we also enjoyed Pigalle and Hurley's restaurants in the area. The breakfast buffet in the hotel was very nice, but at $15, we preferred to buy bagels and cereal from the grocery and eat in the room. I would definitely recommend the Belvedere, and the next time I come to the city, I'll be sure to stay there.

<Author>brantley75
<Content>Teens loved The Belvedere and NYC Our family of four stayed at The Belvedere from 8/9-8/14. We checked in at 3 am and they had to split our family of four into 2 rooms. The next morning they moved us to a new double room and for the inconvenience added free breakfast for our entire stay. (I just asked if there was any compensation for the mixup) The staff was very cordial and polite. Location was great! Walked to Hotel Edison for breakfast, Johns Pizzeria, Rays Famous Pizza and Ellens Stardust Diner with the singing waiters for dinner (our teens favorite). Subways were close and Times Square a short 6 block walk. Dinner at Noodletown in Chinatown was excellent, follwed by dessert in Little Italy. We followed our family goal of NO CHAIN FOOD, except for ESPN Zone in Times Square--and kept our teenagers happy for 12 days! Belvedere is a great place for families.

<Author>wanderer
<Content>It Would be a Great Place if All the Elevators Worked My wife, daughter and I stayed at the Belvedere for four nights. It was comfortable if plain, and having a refrigerator in the room was really helpful, as was the in-room safe. The room was clean and well-maintained. I liked the location on the west edge of Midtown, because it gave us access both to the subway system and 9th Ave., a terrific commercial street. It's also more pleasant than being in the very heart of Midtown. At $136 AAA rate plus several taxes it was reasonable for Manhattan.My only serious complaint--one of the two main elevators was out of service the whole time we were there. This made using the elevator to the 10th floor (we'd asked for and gotten a higher floor than our initial 3rd floor room) very slow. We started using one of the service elevators, but one was off-limits to guests. It also became awkward for hotel staff to move around, to move service carts around, etc. A 400 room, 16 story hotel just can't travel on one elevator.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Impeccable service, but rooms need some work I tried the Belvedere hotel, which was a departure from my normal preference for large hotel chains which offer airline mileage and/or hotel affinity programs. I was quite pleased with the excellent service on arrival at the Belvedere. The valet staff was quick, courteous, and professional. The front desk staff was equally efficient and courteous. The art deco decor style of the lobby combined witht he service set my expectations for a fabulous room! Once I finally checked in (my room was not ready on arrival), I was less than pleased. The closet was too small. The pillows were flat. The towels were small and worn. The air conditioner (as in a traditional air conditioner installed in the window) was VERY noisy. Since the hotel was booked, I did not bother to even try and request another room. I could go on. Bottom line: for great service and a fair room rate at a hotel with a great location in the theatre district, 4 stars. For room comfort and amenities, try elsewhere.

<Author>TravelGal2Anywhere
<Content>Just As Described What can I say? I'm another satisfied customer. For my first visit to NYC, I have to say that the Belvedere met my expectations as described by reviews, guidebooks and the hotel's own website. (We stayed for ten days and booked two rooms.) I think $150 (+ tax etc.) per night per room for six people in Midtown Manhattan is reasonable for NYC. We especially appreciated the competent, professional and kind staff as well as the kitchenette in each room.Although I had read about this before booking the hotel, the one thing that still shocked me were the smallish rooms and bathrooms. Maybe small rooms are typical for NYC.I was thankful, however, for a good night's rest (although others in our family group complained about their hard beds) on the tenth floor and a clean, air-conditioned, non-smoking room (although the hallway was a bit smokey smelling) with a decent, but not great, view.I would most probably stay at the Belvedere if I ever visit NYC again--unless I find another hotel comprable in quality and location for a better price.

<Rating>4	3	3	-1	3	-1	4	-1	

<Author>parlyboy
<Content>Still Great (4th Visit) This was my fourth stay at the Belvedere and this will be my fourth great review of this gem of a hotel.Check in was quick and easy, the staff were smiling and courteous. We asked for a room on a high floor, non smoking, with a double bed, that's exactly what we got. A north facing room on the 16th floor. The room was, as always clean and well presented, slightly bigger than some of the other rooms I've stayed in in New York. The bonus being the provision of the small kitchen area with a fridge and Microwave.....nice touch that, helps when you want to heat up a slice of Pizza after crawling in from one of the excellent local bars (Scruffy Duffys, The Social, Kevin St James and TJ Keanes were all excellent!!)The first thing we noticed was after the bell hop turned on the air conditioning it was very loud, before I could even say anything the bell hop said that he'd get someone up to fix it, sure enough 5 mins later the engineer turned up and replaced the entire unit in under 15 mins and then wouldn't even take a tip That's what I'm here for Sir, I doubt if I'd have gotten that response in many other hotels.Bed linen and towels were changed every day, plenty of towels even for my towel intensive girlfriend. Girls, do you REALLY need 5 towels to take a shower?!!The Hotel, as most other reviews will state is in a surprisngly quiet part of town just off 8th Ave on West 48th St. It's a short walk to Times Square, The Theatre District, Restaurant Row and even down to Macy's is a realtively short hike as is up to Central Park. The Subway is close by and there are always plenty of cabs going by the front door. True there is a Fire Station nearby but realistically no matter where you stay in Manhattan you will have some level of noise, besides I wore earplugs at night and slept like a baby!!Apart from the air conditioning things were clean, efficient, friendly and still incredibly cheap, I booked well in advance and got a deal of $120 per night and given the great exchange rates for us Brits this worked out at less than 拢80 per night.....fantastic!!New York, as always was magnificent, the greatest city with the greatest people in the world.Thanks Belvedere, I'll be back!!  
<Date>Jul 22, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member

We then stayed 4 add'l nights after our cruise July 11-15. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. We reserved a King Deluxe Room, AAA rate of $129/night. We walked quite a bit, so bring comfortable walking shoes. The staff was very helpful. We want to say a special thank you to Fernando - what a great help he was to us during our stay. (If you need limo service, ask Fernando - he recommended Manny to our group, and we couldn't have been happier!) The rest of the staff were also very friendly and helpful. The Olympic Diner was highly recommended, so we tried it our first morning, and never went anywhere else for breakfast - close by and very good food with excellent prices! Fernando recommended the Iguana restaurant for dinner. Delicious mexican food! If you are planning on visiting NYC, don't stay anywhere else - the Belvedere will meet all your needs. We will definetly stay at the Belvedere again on our next trip to NY.

<Rating>5	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>secondchance
<Content>The Belvedere - great location and value for money Stayed at the Belvedere during June 2004 for five nights with my teenage daughter. Was a bit apprehensive about the two of us being in New York on our own, but we felt much safer than in Dublin - especially at night time. I booked the Belvedere after a personal recommendation and reading the TripAdvisor reviews. It was everything we hoped for. We had a room on the 9th floor with two double beds and were not bothered by any noise from inside or outside the hotel. The staff were very helpful. The in-room safe was very useful and much less hassle than having to use one at reception. We didn't use the microwave but the coffee maker was very handy.We flew into JFK and caught the New York Airport Express bus outside Terminal 4 and then a shuttle to the hotel for $15 each. On the return leg, we opted for a shuttle organised by the hotel - a very comfortable minibus with only 6 passengers, for $19 each. Try to bring small change with you, as the drivers expect tips.Smith's on 8th Ave is a good spot for breakfast. We went to the show Movin' Out - really good. There is no dialogue, just the songs and dance. The open-top bus tours were great (if you have time buy the 2-day ticket and see the whole city - it includes a night tour) and the ticket office is just around the corner from the hotel on 8th Ave. TGI Friday's Baby Back Ribs are to die for!! Also, the hot pastrami on rye at Smiler's deli on 5th Ave was worth travelling across the Atlantic!! The only bad meal was at Texas on Times Square - the worst chilli I've ever tasted, but you can't win them all.We didn't bother too much with the shops - the ones on 5th Aveue are too expensive and the others don't really have as good a selection as at home or huge bargains (Century 21 is worth a visit for shoes, handbags, sunglasses etc). There was too much else to do to waste time in the shops.We went to Ground Zero and found that very moving - especially the exhibits in the small church, St Paul's, across the road. These document the rescue effort and are well worth an hour of your time.The Met is also very interesting but it's probably best not to make it a morning visit, as some of the galleries are closed then. We didn't bother with the boat trip to the Statue of Liberty or Ellis Island (very glad when we saw the queues). We just took the free ferry to Staten Island and back.We had really good weather - very hot one day and a little rain on another, but mostly sunny and warm. We enjoyed every minute!  
<Date>Jun 30, 2004
<Rating>5	5	3	-1	4	-1	3	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>We'll be back! Just want to add one more Excellent rating to the list. Originally we were looking at budget hotels, but when we learned budget hotel in NYC means something a little different, we planned on spending a little more money on the hotel. We're very glad we did. We arrived hours before check-in not expecting to be given a room. They put us in a room with the king sized bed we requested, on the top floor (17th) of the hotel. I was concerned there would be noise from the service elevator our room was adjacent to, but heard nothing for the 2 days we were there - we felt like we were the only ones in the hotel! Room was immaculate, AC worked nicely and wasn't too loud, and the concierge helped us with getting transportation back to the airport. It was on a safe street, short walk to Times Square, subway, etc. We would definitely stay there again.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>So Close To Everything! This place was very welcoming --even at 10:30pm at night when we got in after being delayed 5 hours in Ottawa and Toronto. The staff was very helpful and kind, the lobbey very inviting--but the most joyful moment was entering a very clean, and cozy room with a mini-fridge and microwave to boot! I am a fanatic about clean bathrooms especially and I was very pleased soaking in the bath after a long day. New York is for walking, and this hotel is PERFECTLY LOCATED! To your right several blocks is the Air and Sea Intrepid Museum, and two blocks east is Times Square, Broadway; a couple more blocks and you are on Fifth Avenue. You are also just a short walk from ORSO a great Italian restaurant. My husband and I would walk everywhere--even the Empire States Building- and somehow getting 'home' for a quick rest was always easily done. This is the best value for money I have ever experienced!

<Content>Good Hotel, Great Location. Stayed at The Belvedere for 3 nights and overall thought the hotel was really good value. <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Look no further....this is the one. After months of searching and reading reviews, I finally chose the Blevedere and am glad I did. My husband and I had no complaints about this hotel.As written hundreds of times by others, the location is great, away from the heavy traffic but close enough to everything. We walked to Rockefellow Ctr, Grand Centra Terminal, and Madame Taussads Wax Museum with no problems subways, Broadway is a block away, and so is Times Square and NY sightseeing tour buses. Early check in was not a problem and the staff is very friendly and acommidating. The rooms are very clean and average sized, the bathroom is small, the only thing missing was counterspace but there is a shelf for storing makeup, toiletries etc. therefore that was not a problem. We stayed in room 1407 had no problems with noise, or heat or elevator traffic.The elevators are small. the in room safe came in handy as well as the kichenette. Wake up calls were prompt, no alarm clock in the room. The Olympic Resturant around the corner is good and reasonably priced for breakfast. Doorman very nice about holding luggage after check-out for late departure visitors. Didnt have time to use hotel's other ammendities, too busy having fun on the town. Overall, the Belvedere is the right hotel choice for those who prefer clean, quiet, friendly,not too lavish hotels at a decent price.We enjoyed it!!!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great value, clean room I stayed at this hotel for one night while waiting to meet up with friends. The hotel is a great value and the room while on the small side was very clean and had everything you needed. In addition it has a little kitchen with a small fridge, microwave and coffee station. The hotel is located on a quiet tree lined street and close to all the midtown attractions. There are several great places to eat within one block of the hotel and Times square is just a few blocks away. Overall, I was impressed with this hotel for the price. If you are looking for a clean and comfortable 3 star hotel in a great location this is the place. The staff was friendly and eager to help. The only real complaints I have is that you can hear noise from the hallway and from the fire station down the block. Otherwise there was no traffic noise from the street below. If I came to nyc again and was on a tight budget I would not hesitate to stay here again.  
<Date>Jun 9, 2004
<Rating>4	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1

Little kitchenette comes in handy. The bathroom was as tiny as it can be and lacks a counter but it had new tile and was clean. Good water pressure too.I would definately return here on another visit. You can't beat the location and the price.

<Date>May 30, 2004
<Rating>5	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>AZTravelman09
<Content>Belvedere Offers Great Value We had a great time at the Belvedere from May 19-26, as my wife and I celebrated our 1st anniversary. You are 5 mins. walking distance from Times Square, Broadway plays, the subway, and two blocks from Restaurant Row on 46th St. We felt safe walking to/from the hotel at all times of the day/night. We had a room on the 14th floor, right next to the elevator, and had no problems. You WILL hear sirens from time to time, but I have to imagine that this would occur anywhere else. You are in NYC!! We had a few problems during our week long stay, but they were fixed quickly. The only recommendation I can make is to bypass the concierge. For the most part, information they gave us was refuted by locals. If you are coming from JFK, take the AirTrain to Jamaica Station, and then the E train (it is an express train) to the 50th St. Station in Manhattan. That will leave you 2 very short blocks from the hotel for $7 total, and took us under an hour. We felt very safe on the subway. Enjoy, and hope this review helped!! We will stay at the Belvedere again!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great location, decent room Stayed 3 nights in mid-May. Insider tip: Rooms ending in 12, 14, 16, 18 are 1/3 bigger than the rest of the rooms. Good: Location can't be beat! Heart of midtown, super convenient to both uptown and downtown. Not as good: Our furniture was very worn, the AC unit was in a piece of plywood in the wall, some peeling wallpaper, loose cable in TV unit - kept having to get up to fix it. But the bedding and window coverings looked newish, so I would rate the room as average. Could hear sirens from fire station on corner, but only occasionally. In all, worth it for the superb location and good value.

<Author>LPPTraveller
<Content>Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service I just stayed at the Belvedere and I loved it. It's a great location on 48th St., right around the corner from hotels costing $300 a night on Broadway. You can walk everywhere to bars, restaurants, nightlife. There are several metro stops also. The hotel is clean and the staff very helpful and friendly from the front desk to the doorman. The rooms were really nice with a fridge/sink (there are a few grocery store shops right around the corner on 8th st.if you want to stock up your fridge) Everything in the hotel looks new from marble floors in the bathroom and lobby and nice bed linens. This is definitely NY's best kept secret. We paid only $144 a night, and you can't stay anywhere else for this location/cleanlines and price. Definitely recommend staying here.

<Rating>4	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved the Belvedere My wife, our two young boys and I stayed at the Belvedere for three nights, April 20-23 and had a wonderful experience. First of all, we found a very reasonable rate of $135 per night by dealing with Expedia. Upon our arrival, we requested a high floor and were graciously accomodated, receiving a large, meticulously kept room with two very comfortable double beds and a microwave and minifridge. We thought that the size of the bathroom, though not big, was fine. The only drawback was that the room got a bit warm, so we opened the window. (The air conditioner did not cool the temperature very much, as far as we could tell.) To echo others, the location is outstanding! Not only is it easy to get to Times Square, Grand Central, Central Park, and other places, but the New York Visitors Bureau is only a few blocks away. Gray Line Tours have their main building around the corner and just down Eighth Avenue with open-air doubledecker buses departing very frequently (the night tours are especially fun). And, the Hudson is maybe half a mile away, with a bike/running path paralleling the West Side Highway. One of our mornings, we were able to get there to see the Queen Mary 2 coming into port on its maiden voyage. Riding the subway is very safe and inexpensive, and if you are confused in any way, the people working the booths at each station are very helpful. Also, if you go out at night, the Belvedere's location is safe. We went to a night game at Shea Stadium, got off at Grand Central Station on West 42nd and walked back to the hotel at 10:30 PM. It was kind of fascinating to see so many people out on a Tuesday night in April. Without question, we plan to return to the Belvedere.  
<Date>May 1, 2004
<Rating>5	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>ChilliinOttawa
<Content>Liked it Very Much! Just returned from the Belvedere after taking my 16 year old daughter for her special birthday. Read many tripadvisor reviews which were consistently better than the majority of hotels and took our chances on this hotel -we weren't disappointed. Great value for your money. Recieved the CAA rate of $140 for each of first two nights and $136 for last - be careful though not to forget your card - I made these reservations long ago and forgot to bring my card - there are no exceptions (I had to have the imprint faxed to the hotel), otherwise a much higher rate would apply. On another note, we had requested a king size bed on top floor and that's what we got - only problem was that the room iwas quite small (after I had read that the rooms were spacious!) and the bathroom was beyond tiny, although the linens were classy. We asked to be moved to a room with two doubles which was considerably bigger, also bigger bathrooms, storage, etc. - great comfortable room - lots of noise at night though due to large groups of teens (maybe a little older?) travelling together - this is New York and I'm not sure that you could avoid that in most hotels. Location can't be beat!! Try Daniela for breakfast (between 45th and 46th on 8th, next to Euro Diner) - great specials at $6.95 includes coffee and juice - excellent food, service and atmosphere (tried Olympic Diner which although relatively inexpensive had greasy food, and Euro Diner which had no service and high prices). Also, Da Rosini on restaurant row - homemade pasta, reasonable prices, excellent service. Belvedere is near all of this, Times Square and much more. We'll be returning and have already recommended this hotel highly.
