<Author>G99UGS
<Content>Great Hotel We stayed at the Belvedere for 4 nights at the end of March and couldn't fault it. We chose the hotel based on the many positive reviews (thank you fellow reviewers). We arrived 4 hours early for check-in, we had to wait less than 10 minutes for our room. I am very fussy about cleanliness and couldn't find a single thing to pick at, the room was exceptionally clean, comfortable and spacious. We tried both the full buffet breakfast and the continental breakfast, both were more than adequate, but try the Olympic Diner just around the corner for very filling, cheap breakfasts. Front desk staff were fine, the concierge was extremely helpful as were the doormen and bellhops. It was our first trip to New York and we loved every second of it! We'd heard that New Yorkers could be a bit grumpy and brusque, not so!! Everyone we met even down to the cab drivers were friendly and polite. We will definitely be going back to New York and will stay at the Belvedere again, location is brilliant, less than 5 mins walk to Times Square. As for the few negative reviews about the hotel, we can't believe that they stayed at the same hotel. We arranged to meet a Big Apple Greeter as it was our first trip to NY, what a wonderful experience that was, all done by volunteers for free, we got the chance to see neighbourhoods we probably wouldn't have got round to and a chance to ride the buses and subways easily and for free, very highly recommended.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Mid-town's Best Kept Secret My wife and I just returned from a three night stay at the Belvedere. I booked this hotel after reading the many positive reviews on this site. Generally when visiting Manhattan we stay in a Marriott property but this time I took a chance and tried a new hotel. I was a little worried because I've heard horror stories about some of Manhattan's independent hotels.We couldn't have been happier. Our room (#628)was spacious, extremely clean and nicely appointed. The bathroom likewise was extremely clean.Located on 48th Street between 8th  9th Avenues, the hotel is a 5 minute walk to Times Square and most of the broadway theatres. Central Park and the Lincoln Center are a ten minute walk. The location was perfect.There is no room service or in-room mini-bar. However, our room did include a small kicthen area complete with a sink and mini fridge which we stalked with our own treats that we bought nearby.There are two restaurants on site - I believe that they may be independently operated. We did not try these as we visited other favorite restaurants that we've come to love over the years.Previously we've stayed at the nearby Marriott Marquis - and while the Belvedere does not have all the amenities of a Marriott, we also did not pay for them. More importantly the room was just as clean, stylish and nearly as spacious. And, about one third the cost!We'll definitely be back.

<Author>traveler213
<Content>Fabulous Property In An Excellent Location I stayed at the Belvedere from 2/26-2/29, 2004 and absolutely loved the property. The rooms were very clean, comfortable, well-equipped and modern. The heat/ac systems could use some work, but they functioned well. The lobby and guestrooms are absolutely beautiful but the corridors are showing some signs of wear.I stayed with a group, so I'm not quite sure what the room rate was, but I did hear that it was around $135 for a triple! This is absolutely outstanding value for New York...especially since we were within walking distance of Times Square and the midtown attractions.Meals were (although a good value for New York) quite pricey. You're better off hitting a Deli or Bagel cart for breakfast and picking up lunch and dinner off property as well. But the ambience of the restaurant is very unique and enjoyable for those willing to spend the extra money.I work for a Hotel in Niagara Falls, NY and can receive deep discounts on hotel rooms in my chain. However, I was so pleased with The Belvedere that I will be glad to spend the extra money to stay there each time I'm in New York.Stay at the Belvedere...you won't be disappointed.

<Author>amybatt
<Content>Definitely above average, but nothing special We stayed here for a quick theater trip to NYC. We decided to try some place different this time. Overall it was a fine experience, there was just nothing special about it that would draw me back. The location is about a block and a half from the top end of Times Square. It's two blocks from restaurant row. The room was extremely clean, smoke-free and quiet even though we were on the fourth floor front (the heat was a bit bumpy, but not so that I couldn't sleep). It's just that there was nothing about it that really made me say Wow. I found the hotel staff to be fine, very courteous but not overly so. The bellhops were great with us, storing the luggage after check-out until our late train home. Breakfast was pretty standard and nothing exceptional, but good for $15 in NYC. I'd definitely stay here again in a pinch and recommend it if you're not looking for anything special.

<Author>sherry68
<Content>Thoroughly pleased After much obsessing over all the reviews, I reserved a room at the Belvedere for 3 nights for myself, my husband, and ll year old daugher; February 17-20. We stayed on the 12th floor and have no complaints. We are fairly fussy, but were pleased with the immaculate housekeeping, the responsiveness of the staff, and the location of the hotel. We had no problem with noise at night. I do agree that the rooms can be somewhat warm, but we turned on the air conditioner which had the dual purpose of providing white noise to block any potential sounds. The bathroom was not large, but certainly was adequate and up to date.The fridge was handy, though we never used the microwave or coffee maker.The location was terrrific for midtown. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel or returning to it another time.

<Rating>1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>JMA07
<Content>Great Value We stayed at the Belvedere in early February, and had a really good experience. The rate was fantastic--$119 with a AAA discount, to which we added $20 a night for a full breakfast for the three of us. The room decor was plain, but pleasant, and spacious for New York. They gave us a room high up and we had a nice city view. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. We thought the bathroom was a little cramped (no way two people are going to be in there getting ready at once), but everything worked well. The best thing was that the room had coffeemaking, a microwave and a fridge that was Not a minibar full of overpriced junk, but just a fridge to use if you wanted to keep some drinks, etc., in your room. (Only down side was that they give you coffee but no tea or hot chocolate mix). We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was huge, varied and well worth the small amount of extra money; but if you don't take it there, the Olympic Diner, just around the corner to the left, is a great place for any meal. The Plataforma Brazilian restaurant, located in the same building, is excellent, though dinner there will cost more than your room. The hotel shop could use fewer souvenirs and more magazines and other practical things. The location is great, walkable to everything in midtown. On the whole, there is nothing so exceptional here that the hotel is a destination in itself, but who needs that in New York anyway? It has everything you need for a comfortable stay.  
<Date>Feb 18, 2004
<Rating>5	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Two Thumbs-Up for the Belvedere! Price/product was outstanding! Clean, comfortable, excellent location - the Belvedere was exactly what we hoped for (*thank you* Trip Advisor reviewers). No excessive frills, but didn't need them and didn't want to pay for them. We asked for upper level floors upon check-in to avoid some street volume - we got the 10th floor and noise was never an issue. Only quirk was no exhaust fan in our bathroom. Other possible issue is that heat control can only be accessed by staff. Too-hot condition was quickly remedied with a call to the front desk, though. Also, if Internet access is desired to check emails and for short-term web surfing, don't pay the $10.95 per 4-hr.(?) time block from the T.V. in your room. It uses clunky Web-TV interface and is tough to negotiate. Instead, find the high-speed terminals in the Business Services room off the lobby. $1/4 minutes access rate - I could check and respond to all of my email in $2 blocks of time. At busy access times, also would recommend use of elevators at end of halls rather than the two at main entry point to speed ascent/descent. Pigalle restaurant on nearby corner was our staple for reasonably-priced, hearty breakfasts.  
<Date>Feb 11, 2004

<Author>AndieF
<Content>Exceeded expectations We stayed at the Belvedere the weekend of January 24, 2004. We arrived early but were still able to check into our room. The desk clerk really made an effort to find a room that suited our needs, and the rest of the staff was helpful as well. We ended up on the 15th floor, in a bigger-than-expected room with a great view of the area. The kitchenette was a nice asset, the bed was comfortable, tv reception excellent. One thing we loved was being able to actually open the windows for fresh air. The bathroom and the room itself were both spotless. For the prices, the Belvedere is unbeatable. <Rating>5	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A great place to stay in Manhatten My wife and I take a trip to New York once or twice a year and always agonize over the price of the hotels. Do we stay in a cheap hotel (if there is such a thing in New York) and hate every second we are in the room or do we splash out and stay in a fancy hotel and then spend the entire time in fear of the final bill ? Based on the reviews at this site, we stayed at The Belverdere for two nights earlier this month and were more than delighted. The lobby, although small, was pleasant and well lit and the check-in was quick, courteous and efficient. Our room, with a king size bed, was a good size with views over the roof tops of New York. The bathroom was small but well equipped and very clean. I esepcially liked the curved shower curtain rod - a nice touch which made the shower just a little bit bigger and something I had never seen before. Even though it was January, the room was warm (too warm) but running the a/c for a few minutes cooled it down nicely. I don't much like window a/c units and I wonder how well it would work in the summer, but it wasn't a problem on this trip. The buffet breakfast was included in the room price and although not gourmet, it was more than adequate. The location is great - as central as you could hope for, especially if you are planning to go to any shows. Finally, the price - $149 per night. Fantastic ! This is where we will be staying from now on.  
<Date>Jan 29, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The Nicer Side of Functional I went to NY with my family last November. My parents wanted to do the trip as cheaply as possible, why pay lots for a hotel when we'll literally only be sleeping there whereas I wanted to stay somewhere extra nice, seeing as we're on holiday. The Belvedere is the perfect compromise. It's the nicer end of functional, they dont do room service or any extras. However,its clean, very very central (Times Square in under 10 mins) and the rooms were much bigger than i'd expected from NY. Re the room itself, I didnt feel anything was lacking, it was actually just as good as what I would have expected from a more expensive hotel, all I would say is that other hotels may have more amentities in their general areas. eg restaurant, bar etc So it depends what you're after.They do a great buffet breakfast which is excellant value, it came included in our package and we were v impressed. On our last day the staff were happy to arrange a late checkout and then mind our luggage until we had to leave for the airport. I would compare this hotel to a four star irish hotel. one tip though, ask for a room away from the elevator! There was some slight noise from the this and it was the only down point to the hotel.

<Author>SF_Sandy
<Content>The reviews were right... My husband and I stayed at the Belvedere December 21-23, 2003. We arrived at 11:30 a.m. and they were able to give us a room right away. It was right next to the elevator, but the room was quiet nonetheless. The room was also very clean and more spacious than I expected. The location was GREAT, a short walk to Times Square but far enough to get away from the noise and craziness. There are also many great restaurants surrounding the hotel. When we came back to the hotel at night, it was over 90 degrees in our room; the heater was not on and the window was open a little (it was 30 degrees outside). Apparently one side of the hotel (that the elevator is on) is much hotter than the other so if you like a cooler room, ask for the other side. At our request they changed our room with no problem. The only other small complaint is that the elevators were extremely slow and one broke during our stay. But overall, it was a very nice hotel and I would stay there again.

What a warm, friendly, personable and professional group of people, from the housekeepers to the front office personnel, to the doormen and concierge. My husband had not been back to New York in 40 years (he's 80 years young!). He grew up in New York City, and was a bit hesitant about this neighborhood, but there was no need at all. What a perfect location! We ALWAYS felt safe, no matter what time of day or night. The rooms are excellent, well-furnished, and spotless. A/C worked perfectlly, and hardly any noise, in spite of the fire station diagonally across the street. <Rating>1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>BenW
<Content>The Belvedere Rules! The Belvedere is awesome. What can I say about Belvedere that would be bad? A few nits only. The dresser was missing a handle and our picture frame was bent. The in-room safe worked perfect every time. The location is incredible and the rooms were spotless. Great water pressure, nice bathroom (a little small) There could be a few more towels (all you have to do is ask!) We were in a 16th floor room well away from the traffic noise. Of course you still hear the fire engines, but that would be the case in most any hotel in the city. It's also interesting to watch the people come home to their apartments across the way. The staff was utterly friendly and helpful with a minor heating problem (the valve was off). If you use the bellman, he turns it on for you. If not, it's under the vents under the window on the right or left side. The hotel is near three subway stations. Use them! December is hell for taxi riding in that the town is full and you sit in traffic. The subway is safe and (mostly) clean. The rate was $200 a night including tax (NY1 Rate) Fair indeed for NYC and the location. Consider that also includes the $15 breakfast buffet with the room (both of us). The B is within walking distance of Time's Square (one block), Radio City Music Hall (three blocks) and the island is your oyster with the subway. Only a curmudgeon (see other surly reviews) would be disappointed by the Belvedere. Go NOW! Just don't take my room next December. I love New York City and I love the Belvedere!  
<Date>Dec 11, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great hotel The Hotel Belvedere lived up to expectations derived from the reports on Tripadvisor, which was a relief!! All the staff were very helpful and friendly especially the door men and breakfast caf茅 staff. I asked for a quiet room and got the 16th floor I hardly heard any noise apart from the occasional fire engine sirens from the nearby fire station, but that is part of the NY experience for me!! The bed was very firm and comfortable. Room was very clean and the kitchenette with microwave and fridge were a great 'extra'. Breakfast in the Hotel won't break the bank you have a choice of 3 menus $15 full American, $13 or $8 Continental which is highly comparable with outside cafes. We also went to Pigalle on 48th St /8th Ave and they served lovely breakfasts and lunches with reasonable prices. Overall I had a good stay here and I would happily use this hotel again and most importantly the bill was correct.

<Rating>2	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Good hotel, great location. I chose the Belvedere hotel after reading the reviews on this website. I was expecting a small room, a tiny bathroom, and noisy nights if we were on a low floor. But we were pleasantly surprised. There were 3 of us sharing a room but it was big enough for 4. The bathroom was fine, but it took a few minutes for the water to heat up in the mornings (before 6am). Our room was on the 3rd floor facing the back and we were never bothered by noise, day or night. The room was dark so we needed the lights on all the time but we were usually out all day so it wasnt a problem. The room and bathroom were very clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast wasnt included but the diners on 8th and 9th avenues were fine. The location is great - less the 5 minutes walk to Times Square, subway and supermarkets. Plenty of places to eat nearby. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a mid-range hotel.

Spend a few dollars more, and stay in the same area in a nicer place.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A beautiful place to stay in NYC After reading reviews on all hotels in NYC for a trip in September, I chose to stay at the Belvedere Hotel. The great reviews were 100% correct. The location of the Belvedere truly is so well located. Public transportation, dining, theaters, shopping and landmarks are all within short walking distance. There is even a post office and grocery store right around the corner. However, I must emphasize that the Belvedere is more than just a conveniently located hotel. After a day and night on the town, returning to the Belvedere is like going home for the night. Our room was spacious, immaculate, well decorated and equipped with every luxury a person could require. The entire staff of the Belvedere are the friendliest, most pleasant and helpful people I have ever encountered while staying at a hotel. Each one is top-notch both professionally and personally, from the doormen to the front desk, gift shop, maintenance men and housekeepers. Each person sincerely does all they can to make your stay at their hotel as pleasant as possible and they all do a terrific job! It was actually sad to leave, but now I anxiously await my second stay at the Belvedere Hotel in just a matter of days. I will make the Belvedere Hotel my 'home away from home' any time I am in New York City and recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to the Big Apple.

<Rating>4	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A fine value Most of the praise you have read here is well-deserved. My only concern is it's been heaped on in such quantity that you may be set up for disappointment. The Belvedere is a good hotel that usually has a nice rate available. Staff members with whom I had contact were friendly and conscientious. The location IS good -- you're close to the NYC hot spots but still nicely off the beaten path. The rooms are clean and the housekeeping staff is marvelous. I accidentally left a t-shirt and jacket tossed on a chair when I went out for the afternoon. When I returned, the housekeeper had neatly folded them. The refrigerator and microwave are a nice touch that is appreciated. There's also a coffee maker. The bathroom was excellent. Despite some complaints here about bathroom size, mine was fine. Everything worked well, the water pressure was excellent and there's a shower head with adjustable settings. Amenities included only shampoo and skin lotion -- mouthwash would have been nice, too. Closet space was skimpy, made even smaller because of the bad placement of the safe. The room was a tight fit, dominated by a comfortable bed but it really offered no good place to sit. There was a small writing desk with a chair and one other chair. Climate control is a problem. It was warm (not hot) outdoors and the room was barely comfortable with the air conditioner on the coolest setting. The AC unit is behind drapes, which affects its efficiency. One of the bed covers was an uncomfortable synthetic fiber, which makes things even warmer. Some street noise does intrude, particularly with the side that faces 48th Street. There's a fire station on the corner and significant bus and truck traffic on 8th Avenue. Elevators are small and slow. You'll probably have to wait during peak times. I honestly believe the Affinia properties (all-suite hotels) offer a better value when their rates are low but the Belverdere is a fine alternative. I praise their staff and just wish the rooms weren't such a tight fit.  
<Date>Sep 28, 2003
<Rating>4	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1

<Author>tlaird
<Content>The best kept hotel secret in Midtown  I hardly know where to begin when praising the Belvedere staff for making our trip with two other couples THE best experience I have had staying in NYC. From the moment the doorman opened the front doors as we climbed out of our car service vehicle until he opened them for us on our way out, the staff of the Belvedere provided prompt, courteous service at an incredibly reasonable rate. The lobby was tastefully decorated and very bright and inviting. Check-in was organized and very expedient. I booked the NY1 package so a gift bag awaited us at the front desk. The rate of $149.00 included a wonderful breakfast buffet each morning. I had called a few weeks earlier to ask for our rooms to be near one another and true to their word they were! The room size was absolutely fine-A wonderfully comfortable king size bed with plenty of room to move around both sides. The room was extremely clean and well maintained with very nice furniture. I have stayed at properties just around the corner on 8th Ave. and on Broadway and I was pleasantly surprised to find a nice quiet sleeping environment back on 48th. I only heard one siren and NO hotel noise during my two-night stay. Sometimes when finding a hotel value one must compromise service, some comfort and cleanliness, but the Belvedere management obviously believes in providing value and quality and I for one appreciate that combination. I will NEVER stay in another hotel in NYC...I have found my home in Midtown and its name is The Belvedere. I truly felt like a guest instead of a renter, but I didn't have to go into debt for the privilege. If you are looking for quality service, a friendly staff and a clean quiet hotel that is a terrific value, then look no further than the Belvedere located on quiet 48th street in the greatest city in the world- New York. Thank you management and staff; you have earned a life long customer who will always suggest The Belevedere when asked by someone where to stay in NYC. I can't wait to come back!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The Belvedere Hotel, Check it out Me and my girlfriend visited New York and stayed at The Belvedere from August 10-15, 2003. The front desk were very courteous and friendly.The fire alarm went off early morning of Aug 11 and we're informed by the staff on their PA system that it was a false alarm.The best thing about this place is LOCATION. It's centrally located to everything you want to see in NY. Times Square, Broadway shows, etc are just a walk away. Price was also pretty good compared to other hotels nearby.There were a few things that irked me though. The rooms are quite small compared to other hotels I have been to. I see complaints about bathrooms being small, but I believe it's adequate. The airconditioner is a bit on the loud side which vibrated and sometimes woked me and my gf in the middle of our sleep.We were caught in the black out on Aug 14 and the hotel was a chaos. We were in the 15th floor so we had to walk up and down the emergency stairwells exit inside the building while staff were posted on every floor (up to 10th floor, after that none) holding a flashlight to light up the stairwells. Luckily me and my gf had mini maglight flashlights to light the hallways when we were on our own. There were no water due to the blackout. I don't fully blame the Belvedere because the blackout was something they could not prevented/control. However, they could have been more informative on the status and been more accomodating to its guest who were checking-in/out.Overall, The Belvedere was a great cheap place to stay and strategically located. I would not hesitate to stay on this same hotel.  
<Date>Sep 3, 2003
<Rating>4	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>thomastank28
<Content>Good Value The Belvedere was a good stay for our family. We used the NY1 special on their parent company's (Empire Hotel Group) website ... Paid $139 for Sat, and $129 for Sun/Mon in August. NY1 included a hotel t-shirt, and daily full American breakfast (bacon, eggs, sausage, pancakes, danish, coffee, etc). Orig reserved at $125 (w/o breakfast) on Orbitz, but cancelled after finding NY1. Found $109 (w/o breakfast) in early August, but didn't grab it. Breakfast was terrific, and saved us much $$, as we got by with a light lunch. Chose to valet park with the hotel, found out later could have saved $10 per day by self parking down the street. The king bed room was very clean. The in-room safe and fridge were helpful. Our room directly across from the elevators was a bit longer than their other rooms. Never heard the elevator once over a 3-day stay. Have never seen a sink or bathroom that small, but hey - this ain't Vegas. Only had minor problems- no washcloths one day, slow to respond to a prob w/ room safe. But many more +'s than -'s. Concierge was a joy! The location was very quiet, and got us away from the TimesSq craziness. A bonus was being just 3 blocks away from the 49thSt subway station. The Belvedere is easy to recommend. Send questions if you got 'em. FYI...the subway is very easy to navigate, never felt unsafe. Bought the all-day FunPass for $7 for unlimited rides.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>I survived the big blackout of '03...with a lof of help from the Belvedere! As I now have the t-shirt to prove, I survived New York's big blackout of 2003...but I had a lot of help from the wonderful staff at the Belvedere Hotel. A friend and I checked in on Thursday, August 14 only a few hours before the outage. Upon returning to the hotel, we found practically the whole on-duty staff downstairs providing information and assistance to their guests (and vigilently guarding the doors from non-guests). Luckily, the keycard locks on the Belvedere's doors are battery-operated. So we were able to access our rooms while some other hotels were forced to put guests in ballrooms and parking garages, etc. Hotel staff were constantly available to lead guests up the stairwells to their rooms with flashlights and candles (the emergency lights only lasted a short while). They also kept us informed and directed with occasional announcements over the emergency speaker system. The rooms at the Belvedere are good-sized (by New York standards especially), well-appointed, comfortable and clean. The location is ideal for those who want to be right near the heart of the theatre district and Times Square. The price is extremely economical. And the staff is top-notch (even in a crisis). They were even kind enough to take pity on us and give us a very generous rate when flight delays forced us to return from LaGuardia and stay an extra night. I am rather finicky about hotels, etc., but I would highly recommend the Belvedere; and I'll definitely be staying there again in the future.  
<Date>Aug 20, 2003
<Rating>5	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Hotel from hell in the time of crisis My Family  I arrived during blackout. Hotel did not give any updates on situation and didn't supply guests with even water for drinking until it was requested  then until requested they didn't supply a person w/flashlight to climb down stairs to get to the water in lobby. Upon checking out the next day, I asked where to send a complaint and the MGR. (ROBERT GRIPPO) came over and asked what complaint I had. When I told him, he did not like my complaint and became beligerent. Yes, beligerent! My family couldn't believe this. He told us because we asked for drinking water that the guests (All) were taking advantage of them because of the blackout situation. He asked me if I expected them to supply water for all 300 guests of theirs. If you are paying, how could take advantage of them? This Mgr. and owner took things too far by yellig and approaching me in a manner where I felt threatened. Yes, the owner came over and supported his employee in his unprofessionalism. He never asked what happened or made the Mgr. step away to try to disfuse the situation. He was just as unprofessional as his employee. I am a woman, and this is what two men did to me. They acted like ghetto thugs from the street and all in front of the customers. I spoke to them with courtesy, But when they didn't like my comments (Intelligent) they were extremely unprofessional. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, no matter if they gave away free stays. They have no resolution skills. How could you be in business and not posess that quality. They don't deserve anyone's money. I spoke w/a lady that was staying at another hotel and she said that they were very accomodating and supplied them with water and food, and helped as much as they could to make the situation easier, not make it worse by having a terrible attitude. I guess the Belvedere does not care about their customers and if you stay there they will not care about you. The discounted rate is not worth the hassle or the strong arm they will put on you if you have a complaint. By the way, I had already checked out when the Mgr. attacked me. I went to the Rihgah Royal Hotel on 54th between 6TH  7TH ST. and they were marvelous. I had to pay more money, but it was well worth every cent. They were pleasant and very courteous. The staff and owner at the Belvedere need to go and watch these people to see what good customer service looks like. Don't stay at the Belvedere.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Location Myself and 3 friends just returned from a weekend trip to NYC. After reviewing several hotels and prices we decided on the Belvedere. Hotel check-in was quick and easy with a very friendly staff. The room was smaller than we anticipated but was fine. The bathtub was a problem as it took forever for the water to drain and with 4 girls needing to get ready that was a problem. We're travel agents so we had the all American breakfast thrown in for free and it was excellent. We did have a fire alarm go off on Sat. night but noone went anywhere....I'm assuming it was false. Our main complaint about the hotel was the extremely small elevators. It had a great location, only about a 5 minute walk from the middle of Times Square....a big plus was the great Hersheys store. We had a good time all around and would love to go back again, staying at the Belvedere again however might be something we would have to strongly reconsider.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Adored I travelled to New York in February 2003. Firstly, I have to tell you that I was a single female travelling on my own for the first time ever, and to the city that never sleeps, New York. I wanted a break for me, and I chose New York because I thought it would be a hive of activity and I would blend in easily, not looking alone in a strange place. I was very nervous as to how safe I would be, and as I had already booked my flight I browsed all the brochures looking for a decent hotel. I saw a few different ones that looked appealing, and when I found this website I looked up the real reviews that the general public had wrote. One by one, I looked up reviews on the different hotel's I liked the idea of on location, facilities and looks, and each time I looked, I saw bad reviews on each one. I then decided to look through each hotel to see if there was any that had good reviews, and I came across one, The Belvedere. Following on the good reviews, I booked this hotel. When I arrived I was impressed that there were doormen who were there all the time, the reception area was inviting and bright with a marble floor and was very clean the staff on the desk were helpful  friendly. When I went into my room 1216, it was very nice, comfortable and safe. The facilities were very good too, even had an iron and ironing board, which I have never had wherever I have been previously. There was a kitchen area with a fridge and a microwave, and although I didn't use them, there were no crockery or cutlery to make any snacks with. I was in short walking distance to Broadway  Time Square, I used the subway to get to the Empire state building, but it was more Luck than Judgement that I got to where I came from, I found the subway signs a little confusing. There was a guided tour bus that operated from nearby the hotel that took me round most of Manhattan, and you can get on and off just as many times as you like, that's recommended, but a tip, don't book it from the concierge desk at the hotel, although they are very informative, the prices are a bit dearer. The bus people at the stop can sell you a ticket cheaper. Overall, I must say that the whole trip was a wonderful magical experience for me, and I put 50% of that down to feeling safe and secure in a friendly and clean hotel. If I return to New York, and I hope I will, I wouldn't consider going anywhere else but the Belvedere.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Stay at the Belvedere My family of 4 spent 6 nights at the Belvedere. Curteous staff, nice clean rooms, kitchenette, a useful bonus is the spotless laundry room in the basement. <Rating>5	5	4	-1	5	-1	4	-1	

<Author>Ansar_Hassan
<Content>The Belvedere is fantastic We just returned from a 5-day trip to NYC and had the good fortune of staying at The Belvedere. It was a last-minute find thanks to TripAdvisor, and we had a great stay. Located in the heart of theatre district, you are located just minutes away from all of the major theatres and Times Square. You are about 15 minutes from Penn Station, the Empire States Building, etc. The room we stayed in on the 12th floor was quiet, extremely clean, and super spacious (king-sized bed). The room is equipped with all the necessary facilities, the best of which is a kitchenette that really saves on dining-out costs. There is a grocery store nearby (Food Emporium) that allows you to stock your fridge with the necessary snacks and prepared sandwiches. The view is alright, but we did not go for the view. The service is great, and the hotel workers are courteous. The best thing about this place is the cost. With a AAA membership, I spent $120/night. My only advice is to check in early and get a room that is on one of the upper floors to minimize the noise. Also, if this your first time to NYC, take the Gray Line Bus Tour (48-hour hop-on, hop-off) - well worth it! Thanks TripAdvisor for helping me make the right choice.  
<Date>Jul 30, 2003

<Rating>4	5	4	-1	4	-1	4	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Simply Brilliant I travelled with two of my kids aged 16 and 11 and having just got back from a wonderful stay at The Belevedere, I felt I just had to submit a review......The place exceeded all our expectations. From stepping out of the cab, we were treated like royalty, the bellhops were friendly (not gushing, and automatically extending their hand out for a tip) attentive, (but not overpowering.) Our room was ready at once, even though we were a couple of hours early checking in. We asked for a high floor and got one. Sure, you could still hear the sirens (there's a fire house at the end of the street, across 8th Avenue) but it made the visit more authentic. As for any noise from the air-conditioning units, ours was minimal.....and believe me we needed the unit running 24 hours a day, the temperatures were in the 90's, aparently we landed in the middle of a heatwave....so the benefit of the unit far outweighed any noise it made. We were three females all sharing, and we managed just fine with the smallish bathroom....The two beds in the room were very comfortable, and the kitchenette was a great touch (***just order out once from the cafe and you're equiped with the plastic cutlery to help you out for the stay***) The concierge desk and check in staff were extremely helpful and pleasant....The maid service was not overly intrusive, they will come back later if you're not ready. The breakfast lounge is airy and spacious and does take out service if you don't feel like hauling everyone downstairs. Our homewards flight didn't leave until 8pm and check out is at 12, but our luggage was stored without question, leaving us free to enjoy our last day...The concierge desk booked a town car for our return journey to Newark airport, but imagine our surprise when a stretch limo pulled up for us..the kids were over the moon...(and at NO extra cost) Much much better value than a cab. For service, comfort and an all around great stay........you really can not beat this gem of a hotel.You're only a block and a half from Broadway and Times Square, the neighborhood feels safe and is clean and there's a Hershey's store at the corner of 8th and Broadway. Plenty of restaurants dotted around to suit every budget..although you have to try Rosa's Mexican place just a few doors down from the hotel..2 for 1 Margarita's.....What more could you ask for????

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Belvedere was just home from home My sister and I stayed at the Belvedere for 5 nights in April 2003. We were extremely pleased with the size of our room. Since our return to Ireland our parents and a few close friends are all planning on visiting New York next year and they will certainly be booking the Belvedere Hotel. For a Hotel so close to Times Square and Broadway, we felt it was very reasonable to stay there. <Date>May 15, 2003
<Rating>5	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Belvedere didn't disappoint My 15 year old daughter and I, along with a family friend visited New York the second week of April. I hadn't been to New York in over 20 years. We were on a limited budget and I had been worried about finding a good hotel for the price. I choose the Belvedere after reading all the reviews and I was not disappointed. The rooms were large and very clean, the staff was friendly, and the location was outstanding. We had a front room on the 9th floor, I was a little concerned if it would be too noisy but the street is quiet at night. The coffe pot and refrigerator were a definite plus. Check-in was very easy, the staff was great about getting you a cab and the concierge desk was very helpful.I had read in the reviews that some of the bathrooms are small. I was prepared for that but our bathroom was very small. The door wouldn't fully open because the toilet was in the way so you had to fight the door when using the sink. With three women trying to get ready everyday, it took a little longer because of lack of space, however there was a big mirror over the dresser that could be used. However, I think that iff you are prepared for a small bathroom, you won't be disappointed. The elavators are a little small and slow but our room was right next to them and I didn't hear any noise as some other reviews had stated. All in all, our stay in New York was an excellent one due in part to staying at The Belvedere. It's an outstanding value for the price. I would recommend it to anyone.  
<Date>May 1, 2003
<Rating>5	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Brilliant Belvedere I booked the belvedere on reading the reviews here and comparing to amongst others the New Yorker and Milford Plaza. The belvedere came out on top and we couldn't fault it. The location and quality was truly excellent, the staff friendly and price was fine. I booked online and checked the price was ok on checking in. If you book online just make sure you take your email confirmation with you and recheck it before you arrive to ensure no problems like a few here have had. I do not think you could get another hotel for the same money and quality in this location. Only the bathroom could have been a bit bigger but thats it!
